author: {'steamid': '76561197962857148', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1684796297}
review:
It was a long time coming, and arrived with little fanfare, but I'm happy to say Freedom Planet 2 delivers. This is a sequel in the classic sense, better playing, better sounding, more variety, better looking, and better acted. It still plays like a lost Saturn title, consisting of fast platforming with the occasional puzzle box, the original started life as a Sonic fangame and anyone familiar with the classic Sonics or Sonic Mania will feel quite at home here. The story is competent and fully voice acted in story sections along with a lot of incidental animations for characters that are well-timed, it's telling I didn't find myself skipping any of the dialogue.

One major change from the original is the presence of items to make the game easier or harder, but as these reduce your rewards I tended not to use them. You might find them interesting or necessary and you can grind for them as levels are repeatable, with hidden items and soundtrack discs acting as incentive to do so.

This game is not easy and a few key bosses took me around ten or so attempts to take down, thankfully it doesn't have the huge difficulty ramp at the end like the original's eye-watering final boss, but you will feel the escalation as the game continues. The guard/parry mechanic gets not one but two tutorials which should hint at how critical it is to progress, later fights feel like something from Platinum and I mean that as high praise.

Frankly this is the best platformer I've played in years, don't pass it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198986656490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1687127763}
review: Una digna secuela

author: {'steamid': '76561198354126986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3305, 'last_played': 1703046239}
review: Freedom Planet 2 is an improvement in every sense of the word. As much as I adore the first game, FP2 completely blows it out of the water with wonderful level design, bosses, artwork and sprites, the list goes on. The items and potions you can acquire are a nice addition to make the game easier or harder, the latter greatly increasing your odds of scoring higher ranks. The soundtrack is a great listen, on par with the first game in terms of overall quality, some of my favorites being Shade Armory, Lightning Tower, and Ancestral Forge. The only thing this game didn't deliver on was the extra save icons and secret bloopers, but maybe they'll be added in a future patch? Who knows. Despite the 7+ year wait, Freedom Planet 2 is everything I could've asked for and more from a sequel to one of my favorite indie games of all time and is easily one of my favorite games of 2022.

author: {'steamid': '76561198403577942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1687838322}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972312348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1685131435}
review:
This game is easily a 9.5 out of 10 for me. The last half a point is due to a couple levels where it's somewhat easy to get lost due to switch puzzles, and a little bit of frustration with a couple of the bosses. The latter is really a matter of personal taste, and it was easily mitigated by a combination of items and accessibility settings.

But yeah, nearly perfect. So incredibly fun to play. And replay - the characters feel substantially different, I'm halfway through a Carol run after clearing the game with Lilac, not even close to bored yet. And so much personality! The art, music, characters, voice acting, all aces. Would love to see this take off as a full-blown franchise. Highly recommend for fans of platformers, the Sega Genesis, and/or fun in general

author: {'steamid': '76561198076626955', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2312, 'last_played': 1683937122}
review:
I liked the first Freedom Planet game a lot. Freedom Planet 2 is even better.

The Freedom Planet games are often compared to classic Sonic the Hedgehog games, and for good reason. However, the similarities go beyond surface details (such as the lanky furry cast, the robotic enemies, and the Genesis/Saturn look and sound). The best trait Freedom Planet 2 shares with classic Sonic is that each character, even when playing through the same levels, has a unique set of tools for traversing said levels that playing with each character is a new experience.

The spritework is very good in this game. It has an appealing style that is consistent throughout, level themes are varied and creative, and the cast of characters and bosses are colorful and charming. The soundtrack is, like the last game, very good, with plenty of high-energy songs to keep you moving fast. The controls are tight and responsive, and the level design complements the intended high-speed pace of the game while leaving plenty of room for secrets to find. The game also has a ranking system for players who want to challenge themselves as well as an item equipment system that can make levels easier for players who need it or more difficult to up the rewards for players able to handle the extra challenge.

The one point of contention for this game may be the story/voice acting. I personally like it, and if you liked the story in Freedom Planet 1, you should like this one as well. However, it is over-the-top, hammy, and loud, so I can see some people not liking it as much. Also, Classic mode, which would let players go through the levels without cutscenes, is unlocked in this game rather than being available from the start. Still, every cutscene is skippable, so if the story really isn't for you, it's not hard to skip it.

review:
The best and most ambitious Sonic game in years. Vastly better than any of the glop Sonic Team has put out in the last decade, you can feel the stupefying amount of effort pouring off the screen at all times. The sheer scope and ambition of this one is impressive.
I was astonished that the story was pretty well-done, as well. The first game has some serious tonal issues in the story, but I found that the story in this one is real good.
Freedom Planet 2 is absolutely superb, highly recommended.

review: This game is fucking awesome. Like really fucking awesome. this game got some of the best platforming ive ever experienced. AND THAT LAST BOSSES FIGHT HAD ME SCREAMING. I went through the game once with milla and once with carol and the way they made these characters feel so different, i cant wait to go through again with Lilac. (I dont like the way neera plays) Story is whatever, not bad, not good, but I love these characters and how they interact with eachother. A high 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057445530', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1691202530}
review:
Não curti o novo caminho que FP2 seguiu em relação ao primeiro. O FP1 para mim foi Master Piece talvez não seja um jogo Indie que me marcou tanto como o primeiro, trilha sonora, fases, progressão, o chefão e os sub chefes, história. Um game incrível e reclamando a todos meus amigos. 

Mas no segundo eu tive momentos que estava jogando por jogar, pelo respeito que tinha pelo primeiro.

Vou dizer os pontos que não me agradou nessa continuação.

Progressão das fases: No primeiro game você tinha os Stages que dividia as zonas e tinha uma pequena varição entre elas. Neste as fazes são únicas, então eles usaram uma maneira de deixar as fases com a mesmo tempo que se tinha no FP1 de forma inteira. Pra evitar como aconteceu com Sonic 2 do mega drive por exemplo, as fazes são enormes normalmente você demora 10 minutos passar. Não consegui ver isso como lado possitivo, acabei passando no modo gotta Go fast. Não consegui pegar apego nenhum as fases sempre senti que fossem desnecessáriamente longas. Mas ao passar senti ao mesmo tempo curta. 

Sistema de vida: achei complicado, não entendi direito. A única coisa que entendi foi que morrendo ou não sempre tinha alguma vida disponível então ignorei tudo sobre as vidas. Kkkkkkk o sistema antigo era mais funcional e simples

Boss: muitos deles achei genéricos, mas alguns como a irmã da Carol, serpentine e o novo askal foram muito legais. Mas o novo sistema de Boss com barra de vida não achei legal. O que acontece é no sistema de Boss sem a barra como no primeiro você não sabe o último hit do Boss com isso você não se arrisca muito tenta esquivar mais e agir com mais cuidado. E que o Boss nesse sistema tem menos vida porém como você não sabe ao certo o quanto de dano você tudo acontece na hora certa. Mas nesse sistema senti que os bosses tinham uma barra de vida desnecessáriamente longa, mas o tinham justamente para contornar o efeito de mostrar a barra de vida do Boss. 

Câmera. Algo que tenho certeza que irão corrigir se não já o fizeram. Mas na versão que joguei passei momentos de raiva com ela, isso causado pelo auto zoom. Tipo eu até que curti a ideia de início e funciona, mas tinha as vezes que queria zoom na tela e não ia, porque é automático e você não tem controle manual (pelo menos na versão que joguei) de zoom ou não. Você tem a opção de desligar, porém fica com a câmera zoom estatico. Porém se jogar assim você terá problemas já que as fazes tem parte que foi feita para jogar com a câmera longe e outras com a camera perto. E esse problema cria algo que no primeiro não tinha porque no primeiro ele foi feito somente para uma câmera e pronto e acabou. Esse problema pode ser contornado se colocar uma função de controle da câmera pelo jogador in game. 

Elementos de RPG no game. É acho que foi o ponto que a maioria do pessoal curtiu nesse novo game. Mas eu destestei, óbvio tem o modo clássico mais o problema não é isso. No primeiro eu joguei o moto história e curti muito o enredo e tudo mais. Porém esse elemento do game ele quebrava o clima que a história tentava te prender e entrar no menu, passear na cidade e falar algo com alguém para começar a fase. É realmente bem chato pra min. Realmente preferia a pegada do primeiro que era cena de história e cai na fase, história e cai na fase.  Te dava uma tensão, me colocava no clima para lutar contra os bosses. 

Infelizmente não curti essa continuação. Se você vir me perguntar oque eu acho sobre o primeiro Freedom planet vou animado te dizer compra é um dos melhores jogos de plataforma que joguei na minha vida tudo nele é lindo e ótimo e bem feito tudo! 

Mas no segundo infelizmente não posso esconder minha frustração de não amar tanto ele como amei o primeiro. Houve mudanças de mais, erros que não me agradaram. Infelizmente senti mais que tava jogando somente por tudo que o primeiro jogo fez por min a 7 anos atrás...

author: {'steamid': '76561198437066690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1693186610}

author: {'steamid': '76561199182127055', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1664227246}
review:
I think this game is one of the best arcade-styled platformers around.
Take the original Freedom Planet and add a bunch of new systems, a new character, and a rocking story with a bunch of arcs, and you get this amazing sequel.
The controls feel fast and fluid, with your standard jump, attack, and (new) blocking, and it will be put to use with a lot of fun boss battles.
Level design is sick, with a lot of paths, making for some cool transitions, like in the Avian Museum level.
Overall, an epic platformer, and well worth the wait!

review: Recomiendo mucho este juegazo plataformero indie esta lleno de acción, con una historia bien estructurada y personajes muy carismáticos e inolvidables , un pixel muy hermoso, pulido,cuidado y gigantesco llenos de detalles y un soundtrack muy placentero y laborado algunas pegadizas y otras relajantes o ambientales segun el stage y les recordara mucho a juegos como sonic the hedgehod de Sega, FP 2 una joya muy infravaloraday que necesita mención honorifica y vale cada centavo no se arrepentiran de esta compra... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198257313354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1681664587}
review:
苦痛なゲームだった。なんとか１キャラクリアまでやったがこれ以上やる気にはならない
最初に４キャラ選べるがステージ毎にチェンジできなかったので
使わなかったキャラがどんなのかはわからない
ステージが無駄に長く同じようば場所をずっと進んでいる感覚がある
バネでぽんぽん跳ねるせいで進んでいるのかどうかさえわからない時がある
ステージ最後には毎回ボスがいるため１ステージが長く5分以上かかりさっくり感が無い
やりごたえあって良いじゃんと思うかもしれないが
このゲームは救済措置なのか数回分その場復活ができるため
ボスの攻撃をまともに回避する必要が無くラスボスですらゾンビアタックで勝てる
さらにはステージクリア後に自分のプレイをランクで評価される
初見のステージで上手くできる訳も無くゲーム後半になるとランクも落ちてやる気も落ちる

ステージはステージ、ボスはボスといったアクションゲーを求める人には合わないと思う
キャラは可愛く期待が高かっただけに非常に残念なゲームだった

author: {'steamid': '76561198057361962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1697676638}
review: This honestly feels like an evolution of the old Sonic Rush games back on the Nintendo DS. Original story, tons of levels with some cool mechanics here & there and fun hub world to interact with. Eagerly awaiting this to come to other consoles and hopefully a physical release as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010271053', 'num_games_owned': 2536, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1696259201}
review: If you enjoyed any SEGA Genesis Action/Platformer games, youll have a blast playing this. Fantastic 2d Platformer with solid combat and great visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284463659', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1699954926}
review:
Эта игра представляет собой ещё один очень качественный соник лайк.

Довольно драйвовая, с крутой музыкой и интересным сюжетом.
Конечно не без минусов в виде нескольких уровней, да и ощущается она не так полноценно как первая часть, особенно это видно в финале где в первой части была прекраснейшая работа над саунддизайном и уровнями, а во второй всё более спорно и не достаёт того уровня эпика и мрачности, хоть при это Мерга сильно более интересный персонаж.

А так спокойно могу рекомендовать если вам нравиться Соник и первая часть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158415562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1683735902}
review:
A great game once again, and the spiritual successor to Sonic The Hedgehog (Since Mania 2 got canned) continues to deliver a good platforming experience.

Other than the redesign for Lilac, this game is a faithful sequel to Freedom Planet, albeit with some aspects I particularly don't care for, such as the hub areas and level select map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028140112', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 5045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1706284712}
review: Вторая часть приключений девушки Соника. Игра еще круче, разнообразнее и длиннее чем первая часть. В первую часть я играл и прошел за два стрима, а вторую часть прохожу и уже девять стримов набралось. Рекомендую поиграть сначало в первую часть, а потом во вторую что бы был понятен сюжет игры. В игре очень приятная и красивая графика и музыка.Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088805952', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1681909432}
review:
Jugué Freedom Planet 1 en 2015 y me enteré de que iba a tener una secuela creo que alrededor de 2016. Después de eso le perdí el rastro por mucho tiempo hasta hace unas semanas atrás, cuando vi que el juego YA HABÍA SALIDO y no había escuchado nada al respecto.
Es por eso que tenía miedo de que el juego hubiera pasado desapercibido por ser una mala secuela o algo del estilo.
Por suerte, no podía estar más equivocado. Es un juego excelente y una perfecta continuación del primer juego, además de establecer elementos que caractericen a la saga. 
Lo recomiendo mucho para gente que haya jugado al primer juego o le gusten los juegos plataformeros en general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054353656', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1705888051}
review:
Freedom Planet 2 made me fall in love with 2D platforming games all over again. The first Freedom Planet was pretty good in it's own right but everything for the sequel IMO is a direct upgrade in terms of gameplay, visuals, level design, and bosses. Not to mention the entire game oozes so much personality with it's new open map and hubs.

If I had to choose one specific thing that I love, it's how satisfying it is to use character attacks to manipulate your movement.

author: {'steamid': '76561199115011597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 43, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1712278321}

author: {'steamid': '76561198229055516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1694095432}
review:
この手のスピーディな2Dアクションゲームが好きなのですが、初見だと[u]「スピードが早すぎて前方のギミックが見えずに激突する」[/u]というのが様々な作品に抱える問題点であります。

本作はそんな不満点を解消するために、[b]カメラがかなり遠ざかるオプションがあります！[/b]
これで壁に激突することもない！気持ちよくノンストップで駆け抜けましょう。
「カメラが遠ざかるとチープに見える」？本作はドット絵が滅茶苦茶細かくて綺麗なので、カメラが引いても迫力十分。
勿論カメラが近い方がドット絵をより堪能できるので、自分のプレイスタイルにあった距離感をオプションで調整しましょう。

いきなりオプション関連について書いてしまいましたが、本当によく出来たゲームだと思います。
豊富なギミック・町や山岳地帯、海といったバリエーション豊かなステージ・4人のプレイアブルキャラクターによるゲーム性の変化・美麗なドット絵、そしてスピード感…本作は開発が発表されてから発売するまで非常に長い期間があったのですが、この完成度なら納得です。

また、本作からは『ガード』というアクションが追加されました。ダッシュしながら行うことが可能なため、敵の弾とかを無理矢理すり抜けていくことも可能です。どちらかというと『回避』に近い地味なアクションですが、非常に使い勝手がよく良いシステム追加であると思います。

惜しむらくは、どのボスも当たり判定の小ささの割に動き回るせいでなかなか上手く攻撃しにくいこと。また、日本語対応していないため、ステージ中で発生する会話とかを読むことに苦労すること。その2点だけは気になるところですが、それでも本作はオススメできる完成度です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198142275794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1682255922}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999556591', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2092, 'last_played': 1680258051}
review: Have you played Freedom Planet 1? If not, play that first. If you have, then this one is bigger, longer, better acted, more emotional, and with a better story. The only flaw is that I'd say the music is more of an acquired taste when compared to the first game, which was love at first listen (but YMMV). It may not be the perfect game, but it's the perfect sequel and it makes me want more Freedom Planet games!

author: {'steamid': '76561199471071554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1689252307}
review: 当然是多少成功这些是发给还要兄弟给不会弄都不同意

author: {'steamid': '76561198446175113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1699764779}
review: I'm sorry to say, but although the game could easily be good, the simple fact that the parry is unreliable makes this game an absolute no-go for me. Sure, I can turn on auto-guard in the assist setting, but a cheap band aid doesn't fix a massive gash. I should've haft to turn on a setting to enable less game play because the actual game play is just that bad. This could all be fixed if the parry would simply instantly activate as soon as you press the dedicated button, whether mid attack or otherwise. It should take priority and NOT second fiddle, it takes away the satisfaction of timing an attack right because the game wont let you until your attack animation is finished. There are also times where the dash the character can do when pointing the analogue stick is often annoying is too easy to do at times, and will usually just end up launching you into another attack. I really want to like this game, I really do, but with the game play as it is, I simply cannot and shall not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053907320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 5016, 'last_played': 1712345705}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044673196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1709503653}
review: The best 2D platformer I have ever played. The way the attacks affect the momentum feels amazing and each level feels unique with their own gimmicks and mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561199000991825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3065, 'last_played': 1703331347}
review: A perfect game since original freedom planet. Worth for 7 years waiting. For people who want play a game that looks same like classic Sonic, this is considered to you. Cutscenes with voice, that amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199069472844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1681930296}
review: I was just introduced to the series literally a week or two ago (as of this review), and after really enjoying the first game I almost immediately wanted to give the sequel a try. Needless to say, I loved every minute of it. A lot of the issues I had with the first Freedom Planet (levels sometimes dragged on, some bosses had a lot of cheap tricks) are either completely absent or reduced to an unnoticeable degree, and everything I loved about the first game are kept intact and expanded upon. This feels like a game that took 7 years to make, and I'm fully on board for any adventure Lilac takes on next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075282807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 7485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4045, 'last_played': 1709510784}
review:
Fix the chain reaction achievement description, it erroneously lists No Petals as Petals to Crystals.  Other than that, cool achievement, and combo.

As for the rest of you, 10/10.  10/10.  It was so at launch, and they've constantly been fixing bugs I never ran into, re-balancing, and cleaning up sprites since then.  I have every achievement in the game, and there always seems to be more to do, more to improve upon, despite this accomplishment.  Furthermore, only one achievement even annoyed me (See above).  When you go for Chain Reaction, make sure you have all 30 items, then look for No Petals and Crystals to Petals.  Other than that, this is one of the best speed platformers ever made, easily on par with or better than (depending on taste) the others released recently.  Also, the biggest problem of the first game has been kiiinda fixed, as now you can adjust camera zoom.  For some reason, they only allow it to zoom out while moving fast, but it's GOOD ENOUGH.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995365170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1679000166}
review:
I bought this game on launch out of excitement, which it had a rocky start which didn't help it, but once I was able to play the game, I stopped part way through only to come back to try and see what it was that made me stop, after going through the game I have multiple problems about this game which actually made me angry.
This game is a great example take one step forward and two steps back.

The art style is fantastic, Tysontan did a wonderful job with the designs and aesthetic, the problem comes in when the designs are put in motion they can feel really awkward at times, which if they're even given motion in some cases, making them feel too rigid in some scenes, not only that, there are multiple graphical problems that occurred from some things moving too slowly, and the absolute abundance of paper doll bosses that were used.

The gameplay was really smooth and worked well, even adding some depth to the formula that was there, the issue was that the stages were not very well thought out and didn't have any flow to them what do ever, which lead to enemies being placed in blind spots and not enough visual range while playing, this lead to even some environmental blind spots while moving at high speeds, not to mention some of the enemies felt either forced or they were placed in a spot a speed traps to hit the player, which leads me to bosses being absolute damage sponges and have either literally no attacks that were a threat or being so loaded with attacks with barely any attack patterns to speak of working randomly with the intent to just pummel the player into the ground, this notion isn't made any better with the fact of the inclusion of augments to make you stronger, as well giving a retry that puts you at a check point which also includes boss fight phases that costs some crystals that can be earned from this punching bag, which implies they knew people were going to have problems.

The sound design and music is great, at first, as time goes on some of the sounds start to layer in weird, the voice acting volume is way too high for default and some of the mixing feels weird, not only that, while I do like the music in this game, the later stages music did not reflect that I heard in the beginning leaving a quality gap between them.

The last thing that was the last nail in the coffin for me was the story which was so horrible back loaded and ham fisted it felt completely out of place and could've used far better execution entirely to get the point across, which it ended up feeling completely preachy.

While I understand game creation is not an easy task I wonder what actually went on during the duration of development, as this game feels heavily front loaded, and that it needed a year or two more time to thoroughly cook, I did not enjoy this game in the slightest.

author: {'steamid': '76561199220414991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1678840073}

author: {'steamid': '76561199429917766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1682338674}
review: Классная игра, тянет даже на слабых ноутбуках , поменяли визуал что очень понравилось и не напоминает колобковатый Сониковский стиль. Бафнули Милу, за эту псину в первой части трудно было играть благо полет ушами спасал, а вот панда мне не очень зашла , мало домажущих атак , а если есть то надо подставляться под противника, ладно с робот боссами, а вот с бойцами по быстрее будет проблематично . Игра хорошая жду не терпением третью часть

author: {'steamid': '76561198192811355', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1678419165}
review:
Me encanta, voy a empezar la reseña de la manera obvia: Es un juego muy similar a Sonic 2D, y debo decir, que como alguien que prefiere el Sonic 3D al 2D, este juego me encanta. Combina la base de la formula 2D de Sonic con sus propios toques innovadores y mezcla de generos. La verdad que tiene todo muy bien hecho y pensado.

La animación y el pixel art es muy bueno, todos los escenarios se sienten lo suficientemente distintos pero todo parece al mismo tiempo pertenecer al mismo mundo. La escena de Bakunawa saliendo del oceano hacia la luna es genial, y me sorprendió mucho que el juego tenga ese nivel de animación.

Los personajes me gustaron mucho, cada uno tiene su personalidad bien definida y son muy entretenidos de ver interactuando. En cuanto a jugabilidad cada uno tiene su propio set de habilidades, pero son mas definidas que en el Sonic. En Sonic 3 como ejemplo, tails vuela, sonic va mas rapido y knuckles puede planear y escalar, y hasta ahi. Aquí cada personaje tiene su set de ataques y mecanicas especiales que los hacen muy unicos. Hasta ahora solo he jugado con Carol y Neera Li y me gustan mucho, se sienten muy distintas de jugar tambíen y los niveles se sienten muy diferentes jugando con cada personaje.

El juego me resultó desafiante con Carol, pero no imposible. Luego probé a Neera Li, y me resulto muy dificil. Sentía que todos sus ataques eran demasiado debiles para el riesgo en que la ponen. Los jefes pequeños tambien me costaron mucho al principio porque eran muy rapidos, pero una vez que te aprendes los patrones de ataque ya está. Un consejo: Las pociones de Milla no son consumibles, son permanentes, asi que a menos que quieran maximizar la cantidad de cristales que ganan en cada nivel, recomiendo siempre llevar al 5 alguna poción, yo cometí el error de creer que eran consumibles y entonces no las compraba con Neera Li, siento que me hubieran hecho el juego mucho mas sencillo.

La banda sonora es increiblemente buena, todos los temas son pegajosos y memorables, quiza no la primera partida pero la segunda de seguro que si, me recuerdan a los temas de mi juego favorito, hasta creí que era el mismo compositor pero resulta que no, simplemente es muy buena música.

Tuve solo dos problemas con el juego, en un momento se me bugeo y no me mostro una escena dandome a saber que debía hacer a continuación, y tuve que mirar una walkthrough. La otra es que es como si te castigara por ir muy rapido, los enemigos estan por todos lados y mas de uno tiene ataques enormes, o esta posicionado en el peor de los lugares, o tiene ataques teledirigidos, asi que no esperaria rangos S o A en su primer intento en los niveles, al menos ya avanzado en el juego.

Pero tiene poco que reprochar, lo compraria inmediatamente tenga oferta o no. 9.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165271820', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1688278033}
review:
玩完一輪，現在正在補其他角色的劇情，非常好玩的遊戲。

美術風格異於前作重陰影的黑暗色調，這代整體非常鮮豔可愛，加上類似RPG大地圖的設計整個世界觀變的非常鮮明活潑。
音樂方面我比較喜歡這次的風格，曲風變的比較輕快但在氣氛轉折下也下了功夫，特殊BOSS的曲風個性明顯。

劇情層面保留了前作主線全語音的優良傳統之外，妥善的情境分配讓每個角色有更多表現的機會，包括關卡途中都會發現角色對話會因主角色呈現差異，很有群像劇的感覺。

有玩過體驗版4個角色，前作比較嚴格的技能設計在這代有了不少改善，容錯率變高之外也更利於操作，可以做到很靈活的移動方式。
通關方式維持2關一組的關卡組合，關卡間主題差異巨大，體驗相當好，加上每階段不再是綁在一起，可以中間回去調整裝備，加快了重複挑戰的效率。

Beautiful visuals, amazing soundtrack, great characters, and excellent gameplay variety make up a solid title that anybody who loves 2D platformers should definitely check out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079443533', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 168, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1712409983}
review:
I usually don't write reviews on here that much because I usually don't like judging games just because of their ratings. But man this game has far exceeded from the first one and I'm blown away. The controls feel snappy as hell, the voice acting is WAY more crisp and clear then the it's predecessor, the level design is on a whole nother level compared to the first game and don't even get me started with the soundtrack. I've never heard a soundtrack this good in a game in a great while and man does it slap hard as fuck. I liked it so much that I bough the soundtrack.

If you want it too, you can get it from GalaxyTrail's bandcamp here: https://galaxytrail.bandcamp.com/album/freedom-planet-2-soundtrack-official-game-rip

Keep up the great work GalaxyTrail, I have my eyes out for ya and I will be watching real hard now when you guys release another game

My final rating is a definite 10/10, great job guys, really damn great job

author: {'steamid': '76561198126920085', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1707820003}
review:
I'd have to write a whole essay if I wanted to praise everything this game does right, everything I adore about it, and it's actually a challenge to find things I don't like about it. There are some issues I have with the game, but they are so small and insignificant that they're not even worth talking about. Now that's something to be proud of! This little review can't do this masterpiece proper justice, so please just go play it yourself. Give them your money, you won't regret it, but I will try to give you a mini-review of sorts (well, at least mini in comparison). This game is the perfect sequel, and a perfect evolution of an already established formula. It's mind-blowing just how good this game is, no joke. This beautiful title is way too underrated.

Wow. Just, wow. This game is absolutely fantastic! The first game was already pretty great, but this is just such a big improvement in every way. The graphics, art-style, sprite-work, gameplay, story, music, and voice acting are all great and better than before, and all of the additional features, such as hub worlds, a world map, updated movesets, a ranking system, a parry button, more collectables, a fourth playable character, an enhanced classic mode, a revive system, assist options and more just make this game feel very fleshed out. The difficulty is also more balanced and fair, and has a unique system that involves these new items called "Brave Stones", as well as other items and potions. It's also lovely that each character plays quite differently from each other, and gets some unique cutscenes, which helps make each playthrough feel fresh and varied. The boss battles are so intricately designed and perfectly challenging. Every single level in this game is fun and unique, and there's literally no bad parts. The story is delightful and engaging, and the characters all have strong personalities.

One thing I like about this series is that it feels like it has a good balance between upbeat and dark. It's not afraid to get mature and serious, but it's also often lighthearted and humorous. While to some this may seem to cause minor tonal issues, I personally believe that it never pushes it too far in either direction, and I enjoy this style. Like the first game, it's not just a Sonic-clone, and stands out as it's own thing, and in fact, it stands out even more this time. This series could blossom into something truly beautiful and unique, and honestly, if the Sonic series died tomorrow, this would be the perfect replacement (although I wouldn't actually want that to happen!). Despite this, the game still takes some inspiration from the Sonic series, among other sources. The main difference between Sonic and Freedom Planet is the heavy focus on combat in the latter. Plus, there's two main references to Sonic that I found. First of all, there's this one scene were they all say "long time no see", which made me chuckle (if you know, you know), and secondly, there are two NPCs named Sunny and Amelia, who are cute little hedgehogs who resemble Sonic and Amy, and make references to Sonic in their dialogue. I love these nods to this series' original inspiration.

Many things carry on from the first game, but pretty much every single thing was improved, even the things that didn't require improvement. There is just so much passion, care and polish oozing out of every crevice in this game. Playing this game feels like a warm embrace, it just feels so comforting and soothing, and it makes my heart sing. It's infinitely charming! It has a high level of replayablility too. And they're still updating the game and removing bugs, which is unnecessary yet much appreciated. Also, the soundtrack is absolutely one of the best I've ever heard! A big round of applause from me to every composer, but special shout-outs to Woofle, she knows what's up. This game in general is one of the best games I've ever played. I love how much this game respects, references and is connected to its predecessor, despite surpassing it so greatly. I just really love this dang game! Seriously though, this has become an easy contender for my favourite game of all time, if it isn't already, and it's absolutely amazing. I never expected to find a game I loved more than any Sonic game, but here we are. I'm pumped for the console release, will happily buy this game multiple more times. It's not a perfect game, but with just how much I have enjoyed it, I'd gladly give it a 9.5/10 score. 

One last thing that I want to mention is that I appreciate how the achievements (known as badges in-game) are set up for both games. At first, I looked at the achievement  list and it felt like an insurmountable task for me to accomplish, but here I am with only 6 achievements left, and I've never felt like any of them were too hard. Plus, I feel confident that I can get the last ones. A test of skill and patience for sure, but none of them crossed the line of being a big pain, and I am very happy about that. And by the looks of the first game, it appears that it will be a similar story, so I'm going to try and get the achievements in that one too. The achievements only made the game better and were quite fun to collect, and encouraged me to appreciate the game to the fullest. That's pretty cool, in my opinion. I also love the GalaxyTrail Exhibit in the gallery, that's a really nice addition.

Thank you very much, Sabrina DiDuro and everyone else at GalaxyTrail, for creating such a magical and amazing experience (twice), and I can't wait to see where this series goes in the future. This stuff is so good that I feel like I'm not paying you enough! Even if the next game costed $100, I'd still buy it in a heartbeat. Also, take as much time as you need if you plan on making another sequel, even if it takes another 7 years or more. Even if I'm married and have kids by the time it releases, I'd still drop everything to play the game on launch. Whatever you guys choose do with this series, know that you have my full support. Even if the series ended here, it's one that I'd never forget. I know that I've been gushing a lot, but I can't help it. Ciao!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287315774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 269, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1712264852}
review: A piece of art made into a game. Gameplay wise it's almost flawless. Great story, hype music and high replay value by having 4 characters with different mechanics each. It's just a blast to play this game. Clearly it had a lot of soul and effort put into it and it's obvious if you play it. The bosses are phenomenal. The coreography for the battles is astounding. Final boss has more than 5 phases. The Demo does a great job at giving a glimpse of the potential of the game. Again, the highlight of the game is the gameplay, for me, but it's great in all other areas as well. Truly, a gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263488207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2321, 'last_played': 1703810218}
review:
This game should be the poster child on what video game companies should do with their games. Freedom Planet one was good in of its own. However, GalaxyTrail took the formula from the first game and built upon and improved it. The game play is better, the graphics are improved vastly, you get more characters to play with, more bosses to fight, while at the same time ironing out the lower points in the first game.

I was very impressed by how much this series has grown. While it did take seven years to make the second game; it is better to make sure the game is ready for launch instead of rushing the game and having it be bad.

Who knows? Maybe Freedom Planet will rival Sonic in the far future.

Very well done GalaxyTrail. I only ask that you make use the full scope of this franchises potential, please do not let that go to waste as Sonic has done with some of his games.

Stay Classy

author: {'steamid': '76561198052163565', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1675393337}
review: A fantastic sequel that builds and improves on the mechanics and style of the previous game. Each character plays differently and to varying degrees of challenge learning to utilise their move-set, but by the end of four runs I can say that I enjoyed each one. Well worth the price for a game reminiscent of the 2D Sonic era with improvements that strikes out into being it's own thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199106090976', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1685115231}
review:
[b]THE CLASSIC IS BACK![/b]

Returning to Avalice hasn't felt any better. [b]THIS[/b] is how you do a proper video game sequel. The world built by the first game has returned, yet feels completely brand new. The environments are more lively, there is more depth and detail in every nook and cranny which is super fun to search for every hidden detail. The characters have evolved nicely, while they maintained their original traits this game expands upon their existing attributes and makes them even more lovable. [b]Lilac[/b] has grown up and evolved into a brilliant and caring leader, [b]Carol[/b] is nuttier and more lively, [b]Milla[/b] is cuter for no reason at all and she has more personality, and even [b]Neera[/b] went from an absolute asshole to somewhat likable. Most of the past characters have returned, [b]Mayor Zao[/b] is still the most enjoyable to me. He maintained his sleezy attitude and is now obsessed with finding a new something something for something I don't want to spoil. 

The only con that I have with the game is that Torque doesn't have any mentions or references in the game, I wish that he was mentioned vaguely, it would have been cool if Lilac kept in contact with him or something, just speculation.

If you like fast paced platformers and retro goodness, Freedom Planet 2 is hella worth the money. This is a game with so much love poured into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045056189', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1747, 'last_played': 1708491993}
review:
Y'ever wait six and a half years for a game to come out, and it's everything you ever wanted when it does? No disappointments, no missed potential, just a perfect grand slam of an experience from front to back that validated that years of desperate thirsting? Not everyone has, but Freedom Planet 2 was exactly that for me. I admit, I was not exactly the most patient person. Especially in the early years, I look back on some of my desperate pleading for the game to come out as kinda cringe, letting my hype get in the way of wanting Galaxy Trail to have all the time they needed to deliver in spades. But as I kept seeing previews, I not only realized that I needed to calm down and be patient, but that I was in for a delicious treat. And boy, was I right.

Freedom Planet 2 exemplifies the idea of what exactly a follow-up can do to truly succeed. Not just copy and paste the original with some fresh paint, not unnecessarily changing everything for the sake of "being different", and certainly not the modern, cynical AAA experience of a minimum-viable skinnerbox with a fancy cosmetic storefront. This is a [b]SEQUEL[/b]. It takes what made the first game great, compounded on those strengths, trimmed away the fattier issues, made logical improvements across the board, and did everything it could to validate its existence as a follow-up.

Gameplay is pretty familiar to those who played the original, but improvements are immediately noticeable. Every character's moveset feels fantastic with very little jank or redundancy. The camera's auto-zoom feels fantastic during high-speed sections. The new guard mechanic feels like something that was always meant to be there. The level designs feel just that much more distinct and tightened up. The social spaces in Adventure Mode feel so much better for the game's story than just having Adventure Mode only be a bunch of cutscenes like the first game. Brave Stones and Potions are a brilliant alternative to a conventional difficulty system. It's polished to a mirror sheen, and it's so fantastic to just sit back and enjoy thoroughly.

Another particular strength I have to point out is the art direction. The first game had an interesting art style, but sometimes felt just a little close to the Sonic fan game it started life as, particularly in regards to character design. Not only does Freedom Planet 2 heavily redesign most of its cast to great success, but proportions and details in the character designs truly make them feel as original as they could be. Additionally, with the work that went into the game's social spaces for Adventure Mode, as well as the genuinely fantastic-looking environments for the levels, Avalice feels fully realized as a setting. It's not just a vague mental map of where places could be, wondering how the level environments diegetically fit into the world. Everything fits together and looks organic. Shang Tu's beautiful ivory city among the water, Shang Mu's neon urban sprawl, Shuigang's humble snow-capped village look, Parusa's beautiful tropics... They all come together to make the levels you run through feel just that bit alive.

The story of Freedom Planet 1 was something I struggled with early in. It obviously wasn't the primary thing you were there for, but it often struggled to hold my attention. And in two specific cases, felt like sudden, polarizing tonal shifts that came out of nowhere. While I eventually embraced it for what it was, Adventure Mode was something I never really felt compelled to touch again after doing my first run with each character. Freedom Planet 2, though? Significant improvement. Not only does a vast majority of the voice acting feel much better with less of a Saturday morning cartoon vibe to it, with many actors ([i]particularly Morgan Berry and Edwyn Tiong[/i]) being able to fully carry an emotional moment, but there's just significantly better flow to story scenes, better lines for the script across the board, better charm and charisma for a lot of the cast... Better everything! Rather than impatiently waiting for a cutscene to end, I was always thoroughly engaged in seeing what was happening next. Going to the social spaces in Adventure Mode and talking to all the characters I could find was a treat I always relished. And with each new playthrough, I was excited to see the few character-exclusive scenes and moments that I didn't get to see from Lilac's perspective on my initial run. Just such an improvement.

I could keep going, especially on things like the music. Amazing soundtrack, by the way, grab a copy on Bandcamp! But I think my point is thoroughly made. I waited six and a half years to finally play this game. Not only did it come out in time to basically be a belated birthday present to myself, but it completely validated every year, every month, week, day I waited to find out just when I could finally play the sequel to my favourite indie game of all time. Having played it pretty extensively now, and getting VERY close to reaching 100% completion, I know that the sequel succeeds the original as my favourite indie of all time.

Play it. Right now. I'm serious. Open your wallet, pull out your credit card, and throw your money at the faces of Sabrina DiDuro and her team at GalaxyTrail. They deserve it so much, and I guarantee that if you even marginally kinda like platformers, you will love Freedom Planet 2 like I did.

review: Not as good as the first one in my honest opinion, but still a fun experience. Galaxytrail never lets me down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070704582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1677191131}
review: This game is such a steal for the price! Great gameplay, level design, sprites, animation, voice acting, and music! If you're looking for a game that is worth every dollar look no further!

author: {'steamid': '76561199210594163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1706848707}
review: Its wonderful to see this franchise grow and maybe even learn a few things from its inspiration, Sonic The Hedgehog. I love this franchise's story, characters, gameplay, its all perfect. How the game works really puts speed and combat to the test, and its pretty fun! I already liked its predecessor Freedom Planet, but this is just as good. This is one of those moments when a game has been baked long enough, and I highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198330105989', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1677960081}
review: Sonic with boobs 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198055005642', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1704236350}
review:
I've only played as Lilac in this so far, but godDANG did they hit this out of the park. I didn't like how you need to get 15 special records in order to get the True Ending, namely due to one challenge's glitch that HAS since been patched, but the extra stuff was so worth it. Merga has a motive that makes them able to be sympathized with, the Magister & co straight up come to terms about the situation and imho helps hammer home how much info can be lost when history is written largely by the winners(was told that wasn't the intention tho, iirc), and that extra cutscene with Merga just...I don't wanna spoil it cause I want you to see it for yourself, but it's so heart wrenching, she really loved her.

Will soon enough play as Carol, Milla, and Neera. I just like playing as Lilac more cause of the Cyclone attack that doubles as a double jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045800523', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1676865662}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092794572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1682143194}
review: After playing this for 50 hours and slowly approaching 100 % achievement clear, I would say its an excellent game that improves on the first game with no real downsides. Hubs,story, and character interactions might be a mixed bag for some , but I found their lightheartedness to fit well with the game's tone. Also, soundtrack is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010715702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1668544058}
review:
If you enjoyed the first game. This is a must.

The amount of content is huge. over 20 stages, 4 different characters to play with, so much art and charm, hub worlds, world map. cute sprites, cool sprites.

Very good 2d action platformer game. My biggest complain compared to the previous game is I feel the soundtrack isn't as amazing. (But its still great!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198147701755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1676754685}
review: Fantastic game. Good story, grapphics, music and controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044433657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 3374, 'last_played': 1712288663}
review:
Take everything from the first game and make it better. 
Fast game play, fantastic platforming, huge levels, good boss fights, epic music, improved voice acting and story. 
Almost every issue I had with the first game has been addressed here in the sequel. 
Each character feels fantastic to control and adds their own flavor the to the combat and mobility. It kept me invested though each separate playthough and I still plan to go back and do it all again. 
Anyone who enjoys fast paced 2D platformers should definitely give this a go. 
Its an absolute gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026595542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1709227392}
review:
오늘 밀리아로 프리덤 플래닛 2 클리어 했습니다.
소닉 매니아, 오리진에서도 느끼지 못한 희열을 저는 프리덤 플래닛에서 느끼네요.
1편도 상당히 만족스러웠지만 소닉의 팬 메이드 게임 같은 느낌을 지우지 못했는데

이번 2는 정말 정성들여서 만들었는지 진심으로 하나에서 열까지 플레이 하면서 발전했다 라는 느낌을 전체적으로 받았습니다. 무엇보다 캐릭터 도트가 너무 귀엽고 전작보다 스토리 음성 볼륨과 NPC 라인들도 생겨 '영어'만 된다면 세계관을 더 상세히 그리고 스토리를 보다 감명깊게 볼 수 있을 것 같아요.
아쉽게도 저는 캐릭터 대사 외에 NPC들의 대사의 독해는 어렵더라구요.

캐릭터는 전작에 비해 하나 더 추가되었고 기존 캐릭터들의 액션은 비슷하나 회피 기능이 추가되어 더 스타일리쉬한 플레이가 가능하게되었습니다.
그리고 밀리아란 캐릭터(1에서는 슈퍼마리오 2의 플레이 스타일 캐릭터)의 느낌이 완전히 바뀌어 이제는 더 이상 느린 플레이가 아닌 밀리아로도 빠른 플레이가 가능하네요.

밀리아 팬으로서 너무 좋았습니다.
음악도 전체적으로 발전했습니다! 1때도 음악은 좋았는데 그 느낌 그대로 2편도 완성도를 올렸네요.

다만 스테이지를 진행할 수록 난이도와 스테이지가...좀 악랄합니다.
물론 다크소울 정도는 아니지만 1편에 비하면 직선 적인 진행 방식만으로 해결이 안되게 만들어놔버려서 좀 개인적으로는 아이러니했네요.(게임에서 길찾기 쥐약이라서..)

전체적으로 대 만족했습니다!
소닉, 록맨 제로 같은 게임들을 좋아하신다면 꼭 즐겨보세요!
정말 만족하실 겁니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217972267', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 65, 'playtime_at_review': 3630, 'last_played': 1712377082}
review: Such a good game. The developers made an excellent sequel to the first game. Much more combat focused but still keeps the fast paced levels. Even though the game itself is short (I beat it the first time within 8 hours) I still can replay it over and over. There are some minor graphical issues that can be easily fixed with a steam guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561199465561107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1707621718}
review: This game is genuinely really good. I've played Freedom Planet 1 on my switch and i had a pretty good time there. But there was lots of flaws with it. I can happily admit that Freedom Planet 2 has fixed some of them. The store is really compelling so far and im not even done with Lilac's. I can't wait to play the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005953024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1702072918}
review:
Jugué el primero y me pareció una obra de arte. Tanto que años después también lo compre en otras plataformas. Ahora el dos me acabo de terminar la historia de Lilac. Me ha parecido sublime. Efectivamente que no este traducido es quizás algo negativo pero el resto me parece muy buen juego.

La historia, me parece muy buena y los personajes tienen muy buena personalidad. Y por supuesto no podemos olvidar al mejor personaje de todos; el guardia que dice Quack!!

author: {'steamid': '76561199230015737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 65, 'playtime_at_review': 5233, 'last_played': 1712265480}
review:
Okay, so I have finally played as all four of the characters and loved every moment of it. I enjoyed the story and I even think the voice acting is better than the first one. The game play is very nice, especially because every character plays a bit differently. I don't really know what else to say about Freedom Planet 2 without spoiling too much, so I'll just say it's AWESOME!


P.S. Be prepared for adorable Milla.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985327711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1694668546}
review:
The game is replayable. I'm having fun replaying the stage to find missing vinyl or brave stones or the big chest. So that's 3 things to find. Not every stage has three things to find, but every stage has a vinyl to hunt for. I like the story and the characters. The art is cute. Like the hedgehog couple that's a sonic and amy easter egg. The combat and bosses are amazing. The moment where you fight that mech and later when you controll it are epic moments in the story. Sorry to say I haven't actually played 60 hours, more like 20. Forgot i closed the laptop lip while it was plugged in while the game was running. Haha yes I have played this right until I started getting sleepy then I just closed to laptop lid. I have only done lilac story. Just enjoying the post game and trying to spend my currencies on the museum. There are so many achievements I will probably never unlock. After finding 3 brave stones. I've found replaying stages with the equipped make the game more fun and you get more gems so it's also rewarding. I think i'm going to play this for maybe 200 hours. I know I had so much fun with the first game years ago. I will admit the soundtrack of the first game is better and it seems there are less original tracks, as I have noticed clearly remixed tracks from the first game.

Well that's all. I'm so happy with this game and I'm glad this series got a sequel and I'm looking forward for the next one in a few years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051600476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1712239423}
review:
前作はPC版とSwitch版とパッケージ版を所持して100時間以上はプレイしたくらいには好きなタイトルです。

前作がMD風のソニックライクなアクションゲームなら、今作はSS風のようなグレードアップを果たしまさに理想の続編…だったんですが、デモの段階で不安だった新要素のガードアクション(ガードとありますが、要は緊急回避で昔のスマブラの空中緊急回避ばりに連打できます)前提の作りになりすぎてしまっている印象です。
これにより前作のようなボスの激しい攻撃の隙を見切って張り付いて殴っていく作りではなく、相変わらずボスは硬いままなのに決まった攻撃ターン以外はあまり攻撃できず、移動だけでは回避困難な弾幕をひたすらガードですり抜ける作りになってしまった為正直非常にダレるし、個人的に2Dプラットフォーマーのこの手の緊急回避が大嫌いなのも相まって後半でウンザリしてしまいました。
(前作で言う所のスカイバタリオンのボスをさらに攻撃当てにくくした物が大量に増えた印象)

ガードそのものは「攻撃していない時なら自動でガード発動」などのアシスト機能もあるんですが、そもそものこの作りが楽しくないので解決にはなってないです。そもそも緊急回避目的ならドラゴンブースト、ワイルドキックなどのゲージ技が既に存在していた為、さらにローリスクな行動を追加しなくても良かったし、あっても本当に救済位置で良かったと思います。咄嗟の回避手段としてではなくほぼ必須要素にされているので…。

また、ステージの「スイッチを全部押さないと進めない」とか「正しくギミックを操作しないと戻される」みたいな、ソニックライクとしては面倒なギミックも増えてしまっていて、前作のようなガンガン走ってナンボという作りが薄れてしまっているようにも感じました。デモの1面は散々プレイして最高に面白かったんですが…。

デザイン面とかBGMは本当に理想の続編だったんですが、残念ながら自分的には凄くNot for meなゲームになってしまった感じです。前作が好み過ぎたからそう感じてるだけで、純粋にソニックライクな2Dプラットフォーマーとしては非常に高品質だと思いますし、上で言ってる事が気にならないなら問題なく楽しめると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043602621', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1686534077}
review: Freedom Planet 2 is such an improvement over the first game in every way it blows my mind how I was able to tell it would be from the moment I started the first level and saw how jawdropingly gorgeous the game's spritework is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155956775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4647, 'last_played': 1702028174}
review:
This game is definitely a massive step up from the original game, with way more content as well as introducing their own very unique art style yet the gameplay still feels familiar to the first one (with some quality of life improvements on the playable characters too).

The game controls wonderfully well and the levels/bosses are very well designed and memorable. The game also features many items and potions that can make the game easier or harder so there's something in it for everyone.

If you have interest in classic style Sonic games, then you definitely don't want to miss out on this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970939444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1675238973}
review: This game is fantastic. It takes everything about the sonic formula and turns it up to 11 adding a ton of it's own beautiful flourishes. I love Sonic Mania to death, but this game is undeniably better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118820910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1676696635}
review: This game is a step up from the first game in a lot of ways. With the exploration being bumped up by miles and 4 playable characters, you will definitely get a lot of bang for your buck with this sequel. With the development hell that this game went through hopefully this review will get people to at least consider looking into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080580783', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1700442813}
review:
Espere muchos años y puedo decir que cada segundo valio la pena <3

Si la primera entrega te gusto, esta segunda parte te fascinara. Y si nunca llegaste a jugar Freedom Planet, no lo dudes un segundo mas, que esperas para tenerlo?. Team Milla Basset reportando!

author: {'steamid': '76561199122236096', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1709450240}
review:
SOME SPOILERS AHEAD IF THAT MATTERS TO YOU.

Freedom Planet 2 is probably my favourite platformer i've played in the last few years. Being a mix of speed and action with the occasional precise sections, the game reminds me a lot of S3&K with a dash of Shantae, which is a great mix if you ask me.

To start this off; the first thing I always look for in a game: music. 
It's great. All of it. Go listen to the soundtrack if you haven't, you wont regret it.

The levels are all designed well with multiple routes through most of them.

The 4 characters all control near perfectly. every issue I had with the control in the first game is gone (Milla is fun to play and wildkick is gone)

boss fights are all very fun both the first time and the 5th. they're simple and can be cheesed but are fun no less, and the music is great. (Vs. Corazon my beloved)

The story is engaging with a near perfect length. if you want more, each character experiences it from their own point of view and are all fairly different. It's essentially 4 for the price of 1.
Merga is a great villain, and her motive is understandable and hell, even justified.
the twist supporting antagonists were all great. (and one of them is Vegetable which is an automatic +1(5?) from me)

As for the side content, it's there but not needed which in my opinion, is exactly how side content should be made. and the extra boss and ending for completing the battlesphere is a great incentive to complete it.

TL;DR: If you like platformers, action games, or are just looking for something casual to play for a few hours every now and then, Freedom Planet 2 is a near-perfect experience that you're bound to love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002148595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1727, 'last_played': 1675561751}
review: Awesome 2D Platformer made in the spirit of classic Sonic the Hedgehog games. Freedom Planet goes beyond this by adding a combat system and a vibrant world full of it's own characters. Clearly a labor of love this game is full of big and small details that delight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799711538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 35, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1712246307}
review:
[h1]| SHITE REVIEW 101 |[/h1]

Sequel is finally here after 7 million years and I love it.

[b][PROS][/b]

 - 10/10 sprite work. A major improvement from the first game. 
 
 - Gameplay is vastly improved. (Another one...) Featuring an ability to dodge enemies attacks which came very useful.

 - Voice acting is done more better in comparison to the melodramatic acting from the first. (Jesus Christ...)

 - Story is also better! (Fuck me..) Merga, in my opinion, is more interesting than Lord Brevon. (That, and also Merga looks more badass.)

 - Tyson Tan did an excellent work of revitalising the characters of Freedom Planet. They've look better than ever. (No offence to the creator of Lilac, Carol, and Milla, but fuck, his art is cool.)

[b][CONS][/b]

 - The game ends.

 - Barely any easter eggs. (Like the unique save file icons from the first)

 - Stages are a tad too long. Some of them feel like chores like that cave level where you have to find keys to open a door.
 
 - Would have to probably wait for another addition until the heat-death of the universe.

[b][OVERALL][/b]

Everything have been improved from the original, and I love it. God bless, GalaxyTrail for taking their time to craft a quality plat-former that will easily rival any recent 2D Sonic The Hedgehog game. (Origins... Superstars...)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985174390', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1726, 'last_played': 1680516245}
review: A Sonic inspired game that doesn't just learn from that franchise, but builds on it to become something brand new and arguably even better than the classic Sonic games. Vast improvement in gameplay design over Freedom Planet 1. Great soundtrack, voice acting, incredible sprite work, immaculate level design. For anyone who ever loved speed based platforming games, Freedom Planet 2 may be the pinnacle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107246719', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1675387978}
review: A fantastic follow up to the first game, Freedom Planet 2 is an exhilarating 2D action platformer.  There are 4 vastly different playable characters to choose from, but all of them in their own way allow for controllable high speed acrobatics and fluid combat.  The story is quite serious and introspective too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069856843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 68, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1712385119}
review:
Amazing game and one of the best games that I have played. Carol controls better during stages compared to the first game because of the added Jump Disc attack and it is also fun to use against bosses (Can't say much of the others because I currently only did a run as Carol). Also, the graphics got improved a lot. It is probably the best looking pixel art game that I have played. The music, story, characters and the humor were also great.
I only really have 2 main criticisms. First, the music against bosses are mostly weaker compared to the first game. Second, you have to pay with crystals to go back to the last checkpoint if you die. Luckily I had that problem of running out of crystals and having to punch the punching bag to get enough crystals only once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070435883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 66, 'playtime_at_review': 4583, 'last_played': 1712257249}
review:
Literally my favorite game of 2022 now
The characters, writing, music, and gameplay was solid the whole way through! Such an amazing sequel that I could easily recommend to anyone looking for a unique fast paced platformer! 4 different characters to play as and I love each and every one of them and had a great time with all of their different movesets and playstyles. 
100% completion was a blast to accomplish and I would do it again when it comes to console!

author: {'steamid': '76561199224788785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 2218, 'last_played': 1712363435}
review:
This game is just.. AMAZING such a masterpiece, a big improvement over the last title. This is a must play for ppl who love 2d platformers this is the best one i ever played, the sprite work is amazing, the soundtrack is spectacular, the story engaging and thrilling and the gameplay is satisfactory and rewarding. If you have the money, definitely buy this game, I'm proud to be a Freedom Planet fan ^w^
 I just can't think of anything else to say just how much I've loved every single second of this, I like to keep things short and not write an entire essay xDDD but if you're thinking about getting into Freedom Planet, go ahead! You won't regret it! Freedom Planet 1 is a incredible experience and Freedom Planet 2 just perfects everything and offers you something you won't forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062908675', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1663731835}
review:
The gameplay was fun, but the story was a massive step-down from the first game for me. The dialogue delivery is cheesy, but I love cheesy dialogue. I eat that stuff up. That's not anything that bothered me about the first game or this one. It has a very teenage drama feel to it.

I was not a big fan of the direction the story went in, though, to the point that it made me second-guess my enjoyment of the games. I think I'll take a pass from future entries

author: {'steamid': '76561198046208175', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1708368471}
review: It's been 7 years since the original release of the first Freedom Planet and that game in itself is one of the best platformers of all time. Now they introduce the 2nd in the series and everything has been improved from aesthetics to presentation to gameplay to the story even the options. At the time of this review I've only done Lilac's campaign on the hard difficulty and done the first two levels with Neera and Milla and gotten to Captain Kalaw for Carol. If you are a fan of action platformers, actually no, if you are a fan of VIDEO GAMES in general. You should play this game. If you haven't played the first Freedom Planet I would recommend that to see where the cog turns from that game into here.

author: {'steamid': '76561199112734129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1822, 'last_played': 1678660567}
review: Where do i start? I'm gonna keep it short, I can't find one thing I dislike about this game. I remember playing the first trying to 100% it or at least finish all the main characters' stories but I lost interest, however with this game I can't put it down. This game has its own unique identity like the first, but it feels like they've pretty much perfected it. also, the water levels, how the hell did you make water levels so fun and not frustrating in the slightest? There is just so much to praise this game for and I'm, not even the biggest 2d fan when it comes to games. Also, the music is a 10/10 for me fitting every area perfectly, even the difficulty is reasonable if your not using items and is down to your own skill, never once did I feel the game was being cheap or unreasonable. i highly recommend this game and would give it max scores, just a brilliant game all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078317925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1694565303}
review:
Gameplay is great, story is god awful. If you played first one, its a good time and you know what to expect, but I was really happy seeing milla's gameplay fully realized.

The story has more unbearable scenes than the first. I gotta say, I will take the cringy torture scene in the first game over any single scene with the screeching monkey character any day of the week. I was typing a laundry list of negative crap to say about the story and at some point it just deleted it all because its too long...for this childrens platformer game. lol. I swear to god whatever they wanted to accomplish with the horrible monkey it was not worth it guys, jesus christ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048295196', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2215, 'last_played': 1674004060}
review:
Freedom Planet 2 is without a doubt an amazing game. It shows that a sequel can truly top what the first game brought to the table.
With four playable characters, each with their own unique cut scenes and story elements, tons of collectibles in each stage, and additional side quests, there's a lot to unpack in this game, some of which I've yet to experience as of writing this.
Sash Lilac is as enjoyable a hero as always, looking out for those she cares for instead of her own needs.
Carol Tea with her improved move set and motorcycle game play, being as hilarious as ever.
Milla Basset with her familiar shield and phantom cube, now improved to spawn instantly and float alongside her instead of being held.
and Neera Li, while busted in terms of platforming, being the powerhouse with her vast set of moves and speed.
And let's not forget our star villain: Merga, who goes up and beyond to achieve her goal, only to end up failing, or realizing her mistake before facing the secret boss if you get all the Time Capsules.
And while I still hold the first game fondly with great love and memories, this game has taken it's place as my all time favorite Indie Game.
Solid 10/10. Seriously, play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011978520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1663769179}
review:
Great game. Each of the characters play great, the level variety is surprisingly fantastic, game loves to throw new and interesting mechanics at you. You'll definitely get a bang for your buck.

Only downside is the music. It's pretty forgetable, a couple stand out tracks. A shame since the first games OST was an absolute banger. 

Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076407660', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4356, 'last_played': 1678034428}
review:
Внимание, анекдот!
Ушла на отдых Лайлак. Сидит себе в домике на дереве с Миллой и читает:
— …В мифологии Авалиса, Мерга — выведенный из пробирки древний водный дракон воин. С рыбьей мордой… Которая хочет отомстить за геноцид своего народа.
Тут Милла:
— ГАВ!
Лайлак всполошилась, только решилась сделать драгон буст. А кругом всё…ТИХО.
Она к Милле:
— Ты чего?
А она:
— Гав-гав. Гав-но ваша мифология!

author: {'steamid': '76561198158975716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1675123720}
review:
It's been over 6 years since I played the original Freedom Planet, and since then, I've been waiting for what seemed like forever for Freedom Planet 2. Now, here we are. I've beaten the game for the first time, and I have to say, the wait was worth it--and then some.

Freedom Planet 2 is something that I like in a sequel: one that is bigger and better than what came before it. The game took everything from the first game--from gameplay, to story, to bosses, to outright spectacle--and gave them a massive upgrade that is welcome to see.

The world of Avalice is expanded upon with a brand new country. A fourth playable character joins the three from the first game. The story is bigger as it is darker. Nearly everyone from the first game returns, alongside some new faces. New revelations shake up what we know about our favorite characters, and set up what's to come in the franchise's future. There is a LOT that I enjoy about this game.

As for who I began the game with, I chose Carol as my first character. She was my favorite character in the first game, due to her tomboyish charm, hilarious personality, adorable appearance, cool ride, and the fact that she's a cat (I am admittedly a cat person myself). And yep--Freedom Planet 2 made me love her even more. Her comedic charm is put on full display during her story, and the ending of Avian Museum reminded me why I love her in the first place.

That being said, the fact that I played as Carol first instead of Lilac may not have been the intended path, in hindsight. Some story elements were clearly meant to be shown if you were playing as Lilac as your first character; because of that, some twists either don't have that wham to it or just come out of left-field unless you were playing as Lilac. Of course, this could be chalked up to my love for Carol; if I played as Lilac first, then these hidden plot points could have that same gravitas they were meant to have.

But even with that in mind, it was still worth it playing as Carol and enjoying her hilarious antics. And as of this writing, I am indeed playing as Lilac, meaning that I'll see the plot twists the way they were meant to be shown soon enough.

Regardless, Freedom Planet 2 is a game that makes the eight years of waiting worth it. And I want to tell GalaxyTrail, and in particular Sabrina DiDuro, something. You stated your intentions to make Freedom Planet a franchise with the release of this game. And I think--I hope--I bet you've succeeded. As long as people want to see the further adventures of Lilac and her friends, the Freedom Planet series should never end.

I encourage you to create countless more games in this wonderful series, each one even bigger than the last in all facets. And it make take years for the next game to come out (I hope not), but remember: we've waited 8 years for Freedom Planet 2 (6 for me), so we're used to it.

Which is to say, here's to Freedom Planet 3. Here's to more adventures in Avalice and beyond. Here's to the future of this incredible series: Freedom Planet!

Weh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029285554', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1699658049}
review:
A huge step-up from the first [i]Freedom Planet[/i] in almost every category.The animations and spritework are phenomenal. Levels are more than "just hold right and keep on going," and you can tell when you're supposed to take things slow vs. speeding ahead. Characters control better and have expanded movepools.  The music (so far) has been great, as well. 
There are still some cutscenes that are "Saturday morning cartoon" cheesy, but those can be skipped.

Definitely in my top 5 highest-rated Sanic games. Highly-recommended!
