author: {'steamid': '76561198128754656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1452, 'last_played': 1711241254}
review:
Freedom planet 2 exceeds the first game in every aspect. From charterer control, adjustments, level design, art and everything else. (But maybe except the story) 

The four different playable characters you play as have their own unique set of powers that vastly different from one another. Depending on who you play as, it may change the way you play the stage and how you interact with foes and bosses along the way. It creates great replay value and experimentation in each play-trough you do. From Lilac ability to speed trough the stage, or Milla's exploration and ranged kit. (My personal favorite is the newcomer, Neera. With her double jump and power moves, you can defeat foes and move around quickly if you know the stage well.)

The stages in this game are wonderful design from art, to level layout. Each level having their own set of gimmicks as well to keep the pacing consistently fresh every time. Whenever it's climbing up an tower needed power throughout or a gauntlet of challenge rooms of tricks. The levels in this game are awesome! This also applies to the hub worlds throughout the game. Each having their own neat details and lore of that part of the world. You can also buy items from these hub worlds to help you out in the main adventure if things get tough.

The story of this game is the only thing I kinda don't like about it. Compared to the first game, it doesn't have the same impact, from story beats, to the characters , it's watered down. It still has it's moments in the middle and all, but most of the time it remains flat and never evolves the new heights. ( If that made sense) Though I do very like the additions of the new side characters and the expanded world building. They are fun, cool to the world, and bounce of the main ones very well. If you want to see more of the same characters you like in the first one, you will probably like the story just okay. 

Overall, if you are looking for a platformer with plenty of  speed and awesome level design, and or liked the first game, this one is for you in my opinion. It has beautiful art design, music that suits the mood of each moment, and plenty of replay value as well. Outside the main game and unique playable characters, there's also a side challenge gauntlet mode that I have not played yet, but will get to. This game is well made and has plenty of love poured into it and it shows.  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198017790975', 'num_games_owned': 2160, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1666531064}
review:
The only good things I have to say about this game are the music is spectacular, and if this game didn't offer infinite lives as an option, I wouldn't have bothered finishing it until years later likely.

I came here for a Sonic platformer, not Mega Man precision boss fighting.
I have a 15 minute break, I'm not trying to learn the 6 combo hit pattern of some boss.

I play Dark Souls for that.

You can't have me doing easy platforming levels then demand I engage in a combat system with utmost level of precision when I've spen the entire game just running past all the enemies...

author: {'steamid': '76561198082098352', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 2033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1669477435}
review:
Well. I beat this game as 1 character Ash Kencorp's panda girl. I thought she looked cute and cool. Little did I know that I picked hardest one to control. It felt really awkward trying to fight enemies with her. Bosses were even harder. Till I turned on auto guard, it helped a lot. It is my personal weak side, I neglect block/parry button  harder then any black dad neglecting his kids or responsibilites. Well as I said auto-guard made it comfortable enough to play till the end. 

 What else. About exploration. To me it felt like game tries  to make opposite saides of a magnet to stay together. All because this game wanted to be Sonic 3 but also wanted for you to explore. And it would work for me if I still was a 10yo kid high on corn syrup. But as I got older I noticed I liked more and more to look at scenery and trying to visit every corner of a stage. Hard to do in game like this, well as Neera it is quite hard.  And that stage near the end where you get teleported here and there via telepot beams and arrows. Hated it.

 Combat. Sucked mostly. Hard to avoid being hit. Had to wait till energy bar refill to throw 1 ice lasso. Extra hard when game wanted be Sonic but also wanted to have more than basic combat system. Felt very awkward wanted to shoot my ice spear, nope not shooting... ah now it is shooting. Wanted to hit an enemy but the tip of my spear decided that hit box will appear just behind a monster. In the end I felt discomfort every time I needed to choose either to ignore and run or stay and fight. But combat moves looks cool. But once again I only played as one character, who wasn't playable in the first game and I didn't play first game. 

 Story. Okay nothing special, didn't make me tingle but was not cringy. Maybe a little cringe, every time I had listen to Carol the green cat I cringed. And that time I had to witness Lilac's "teen angst". Neera felt to me edgy and angsty but only very slightly. If I had to desribe the plot I say 90's saturday morning cartoon with 2017 sjw soy sauce on top of it.

 Did i liked the game? Yes. Graphics are good, though i had a bit of a problem with some levels trying to figure out which platform is solid and which is a part of the background. Quite a common problem with indie platformers. Voce acting was good. I know I said Carol sounded cringy but I still liked it and she's cute, I love cat's ears and big eyes. Should you play? Yeah of course.  I'll probably play through it one more time just to feel the diffirence.

Two last thing. Some stages are way to bloody long. Whoever thought designed boss areas that don't zoom out and 80% time you have no idea what boss is doing and instead get bombarded bya barrage of warning signs that are often counter productive and not helping. I wish your vision becomes a boss arena that doesn't zoom out.

UPDATE. Beat the game with Carol. She is more suited for level exploration and boss fights appart from Final boss. I'm very angry at the final boss (Merga not weapon core).

UPDATE Milla fucking sucks.
UPDATE Milla sucks but she's cute. And Lilac is not an instant win easy mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298299932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1698533666}
review:
This is a game that I had been waiting for those whole 7 years it took to finish it and dammit, was it time well spent waiting. The story and characters are refreshing and bring back the memories of the previous game. It's really great to see the genuine care in revamping in game mechanics to feel more responsive and controllable. 
The characters, backgrounds, and music are all visually stunning and it was great to have the chance to see the creative thought process of the team's character design. You may complete the game once on Lilac's character save but there is plenty more to see and experience with the other characters different story line and abilities as well. 
It still has the feel of old 2D sonic but now this game really took what made the first FP so special and cranked its uniqueness all the way. 
I highly recommend playing this game and immersing yourself in this amazing story and game play which continues to amaze me while I play. 

-SDS

author: {'steamid': '76561198001737357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1668057936}
review: This game is a faithful callback to the glory days of Sonic the Hedgehog on the Sega Genesis, and in many ways surpasses its inspiration. Lovable characters, excellent music, creative levels, delightful pacing and visuals. A must-play for platformer fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026673593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 4412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 631, 'playtime_at_review': 2533, 'last_played': 1711841946}
review:
Basically everything there was to love about the first Freedom Planet, refined and built up for an even bigger, better, gayer experience. If you liked the first one, you'll find plenty to like here too. If you didn't, well, this one might not change your mind either. Shikata ga nai and such.
On the whole it feels more balanced than the previous one, so no more having to stockpile extra lives for an endgame meat grinder. However, there's a lot more boss fights with multiple phases/enemies that can prove frustrating. There's also a new system of held items and potions that can be confusing at first, but useful for boosting your characters or providing different, additional challenges. It's completely optional too, so you can just play how you like.
The soundtrack is as great as ever, sprites are detailed and well animated and backgrounds beautifully rendered, and the voice work is lively (admittedly some of it's pretty cringe but by now that comes with the territory. I accept and am at peace). This sequel isn't breaking a lot of new ground, but it's a solid and fun game regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065211844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1691478819}
review:
A perfect sequel to an amazing game!!

Freedom Planet 2 took everything that made the first game great and MADE IT EVEN BETTER!!  Lots of homages to the original game, voice actors reprising their roles, amazing (and difficult) boss fights, a considerably longer journey than the first game AND the ability to play as Neera as well!!  Not to mention the music...THE MUSIC IS S+ TIER.  If you loved the music from the first game, this one is even better...I know that's impossible to believe, but it's true.  I truly hope that this game gets the love and appreciation it deserves so we can see another sequel from Galaxy Trail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202849486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1417, 'last_played': 1704340802}
review:
This game’s story is an allegory for the importance of critical race theory using lesbian furry dragons. 

Ok now that I’ve got your attention, please enjoy this wonderful game. I was a big fan of the first game and remember back when this one was announced. It’s been 6 years since then. I bought this game the moment it went live on Steam and after all this time I can say it was worth the wait. This game is an improvement on the original in every possible way. I’ve already beaten it twice as 2 different characters and plan to finish the other two stories soon. 

 Pretty much every quality of life aspect has been improved. The gameplay is still simple to learn and fun. Characters have new moves which make the game even more fast paced and fun (Milla can attack while moving and from a distance now!) You can revive if you’re just about to kill a boss but then die. Potions and items can give your character attributes to make the game easier (or harder). Every character feels unique. There’s even sub games! For a cheap indie game you will get more than what you pay for. This game isn’t super short like a lot of indie games tend to be so it is a worthwhile investment that’ll take you more than one sitting to beat (especially if you go for the true ending and beat the game as every character).

Even outside of gameplay this game is wonderful. Every NPC is unique and the art is beautiful which allows the world to feel truly alive. The music is amazing. The story is fun and clears up some questions left unanswered with the first game. The animations are smooth and pretty and you can tell every pixel of this game was crafted with love. 
The only real cons I can think of are that some levels might drag on (ha) a bit too long - some on my first try took me more than a half hour on normal mode. The final boss has 6 (!!) phases and that’s not even including the optional secret true final boss after. I was exhausted by the end of it. The devs really didn’t need to make it 6 entire phases. 

Anyway this game is definitely worth the money. So back to my very first sentence. Get all of the optional time capsules and get the true ending and you’ll see what I mean.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979837228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1667700953}
review:
Uma continuação maravilhosa do primeiro jogo, Freedom Planet 2 acerta em tudo que seu antecessor acertou, e ainda traz novas adições à jogabilidade, como Hub Maps, itens e poções compráveis, um museu precisando ser restaurado, chefões especiais, a adição de Neera Li à lista de personagens jogáveis, entre outras coisas.

Desafio: Tente achar, no jogo, a referência à "Shantae" e a "Kamen Rider", depois responda meu comentário onde elas estão ;-)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A wonderful sequel of the first game, Freedom Planet 2 gets everything its predecessor got right once more, plus adding new gameplay features such as Hub Maps, purchasable items and potions, a museum in need of restoration, special bosses, the addition of Neera Li as a playable characters, among other things.

Challenge: Try to find, in the game, the "Shantae" and "Kamen Rider" easter eggs, then answer, on my comment, where they are ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999438028', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2448, 'last_played': 1696481983}
review: If you want an amazing 2D Sonic game that can hang with the classics, but with some fresh characters, combat elements and multi-stage bosses, this one is it. So much content, creativity and polish have gone into this game that put it on par with Mania. After Origins Sega has definitely passed the torch on to Galaxytrail.

author: {'steamid': '76561199389866015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1678668372}
review:
In this spoiler-free discussion, I talk about why Freedom Planet 2 is the greatest indie game ever made! It's the best indie game of all time!

This is a game where you control four anthropomorphic animals who have to fight off the robots, criminals, and invaders of Avalice by beating the crap out of them. It's basically a character action game similar in vain to Sonic the Hedgehog and Gunstar Heroes. The game is divided up into levels where players are tasked with fighting off enemies in close off encounters and then players are then ranked at the end of the level based off their performance. How ever unlike most speedrun action games where you play as a blue hedgehog fighting against robots by jumping into them, Freedom Planet 2 task the player to fight robots in combat by using a bunch of unique special moves. Lilac can speed boost and a spin attack, Carol can do claw attacks and rides a motorcycle, Milla can create cubes and use a shield burst, and Neera uses a spear and make some ice attacks. Unlike the first game where it's just a speed platformer, the sequel itself have put into more into that, like hub worlds, shops, and even battlesphere challenges. Not only that, but this game also added in some collectibles and secrets where you can find in the game like brave stones, power ups, music vinyls, and tons of other items which I don't want to spoil. The game takes the speed combat pushes it to it's absolute limits and creates some of the most unique gameplay mechanics to a video game I've ever seen, and while I can't spoil everything about this game in order to entice everyone to play it, it's best just to discover all of this stuff while you're playing the game yourself. I mean it's one thing to watch a let's play of Freedom Planet 2, but it's a completely different experience while you're controlling the game in motion. Now let's not to say that the gameplay is the only great thing about this game because the story and the cutscenes are really amazing. Even if you're playing the game on the lowest difficulty setting and fumbling your way through the combat system, you'll still be able to enjoy the colorful cast of characters and all the crazy set pieces. The entire game is heavily inspired by Dragon Ball Z and Sonic Adventure, it's like this crazy saturday morning cartoon where the stakes constantly scale up to borderline ridiculous scenarios. The boss fights are these mecha animal creatures where you need to fight a week point to fight off the boss itself, and the game just constantly one-ups itself until it escalates into one of the most over-the-top mind-blowing hype as hell endings to a video game I've ever seen. And you're just sitting there watching the end credits feeling incredibly happy, and exhausted like getting screwed. Still for the majority of players who will most likely put the game down once they've reached to the end credits, it's still a completely fantastic game that anyone can enjoy, and I highly recommend it to everyone. It's one of the greatest indie games I have ever played! In conclusion, Freedom Planet 2 was the best indie game on Steam, it's easily the best game of the year, and possibly most likely the greatest game ever made of all time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198863997445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4281, 'last_played': 1669324280}

If choose to play the Scene “Diamond Point: Intro” in the cutscene gallery, I only get a very brief display of the characters being upset at each other's presence with no dialogue, even tho in Adventure mode, there is dialogue in that scene. Please fix this, if this game is gonna archive it’s cutscenes please archive them from adventure mode since that is the reason we see these cutscenes. 
And at lest for Neera, the “Robot Graveyard: Boss Intro” won’t play properly, it puts me in a boss fight and then tells me after all that said scene is not found.

P.S. I highly recommend this game, these are just small bugs, but I felt the need to report them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249374514', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1664607259}
review:
This game might as well be called Amazing Planet:

AMAZING gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198095503393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1707579513}
review:
I had high expectations for Freedom Planet 2, but the game somehow still managed to dragon boost itself past them! The game is full of little details that makes everything feel alive. You can really tell that a lot of love has been poured into it. Even just dashing around in the tutorial level is a lot of fun since the controls are so spot on! While it would have been nice with a native Linux build, the game runs great in Proton Experimental.

The only issue I had was the frame rate of the final stages. I play using an iGPU on a rather old machine (Ivy Bridge, fourth generation i5). The game ran perfectly up until the final stages where it dropped to just a couple of frames per second. Changing the graphics form 1080p to 360p for these parts brought the frame rate back to more-than-playable levels. This probably had something to do with the combination of my old GPU and Proton, but it might be worth keeping in mind if you use an older machine as well.

I found everything about this game to be top-notch. The gameplay, the artwork, the music, and the way the story brings everything together. The things I wrote in the first paragraph after a couple of hours still stand after having finished my initial play-through. The game kept raising the quality slowly all the way through. I don't think I've ever had such an intense adrenaline rush before this, even if Freedom Planet 2 felt easier than its predecessor!

I strongly recommend both Freedom Planet and Freedom Planet 2 for everyone who enjoys side-scrollers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080716743', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1704978615}
review:
从小时候玩了自由星球1，当年就在14年玩了1代，我也只有15岁，这个游戏类似于索尼克又和洛克人相似，跑酷以及战斗的那些方式。等了8年左右的时间，官方终于出了2代。
  来说说这个游戏的游玩感想吧，和1代一样在ost真的很棒，这些音乐，真的很带感很带感，极力推荐这种音乐用在跑酷游戏中。你可能觉得2代音乐没1代有压迫感，因为2代打的也不是1代那种绝对的大恶人，也是很有代入感的BGM。
音乐：9/10分
  剧情上虽然没有1代那种绝望那种对付真正的坏人BOSS了，因为2代对付的BOSS并非全是坏人，甚至最终BOSS也不是坏人  ，剧情比1代稍微复杂些，4个角色可供使用，对话以及cg比1代更丰富多样，如果是有汉化就好了，可以让CN玩家更能快速融入游戏的魅力（剧情故事情感）中。当然这个不排除制作组没钱了，请翻译还是很难的........
剧情：8/10分
  新的设定，增加了自由一点儿的机制，例如你可以随意自主选择去任何地图场景，在解锁前，甚至可以提前准备好打下一关的药物，1代没有这个设定，只有1关1关闯那样按着顺序，就像小时候玩的街机游戏那样只能一条固定的路走，休息点还是挺多的，这也是村庄那种歇息机制以及整备。
玩法：8/10分
  流程跟1代相比，2代也就稍微长了，也不是长很多，增加了很多路人NPC，这些NPC也不是那种随随便便设计出来的外貌，都是特好看的动物们，也是都有名字的，至少这方面上是很用心也挺辛苦的，NPC如果做的都一个样的话那也很省力，这一代NPC都是独立的样子并非应付的做，玩一下就知道了。
流程和新元素：9/10分
好像也没什么了，还有的就是画风上，和1代不一样的是，2代画师是钛山，他的作品机械化非常棒，是我喜欢的类型，画师的画风真的敲可爱，以及角色可以在各种场景里摆pose照相（截图）的娱乐设计，[spoiler]还有在博物馆解锁所有的BOSS组件可以进入角色设计长廊房间（gallery's door），稍微肝一下就好，进去后里面有各种NPC的名字也会介绍，还有没用上的设定以及模型（看样子应该是）[/spoiler]
个人认为的游戏鉴定分数：8-10分 （满10）

author: {'steamid': '76561199111353017', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1669644177}
review: Так, ну скажу сразу. Первая часть оставила на мне положительное впечатление об игре с неплохим сюжетом, хорошим графоном, крутой озвучкой и офигенными боссами. Вторая часть берет все это и делает в 2 раза лучше и круче, если не в 3. У меня не возникало пока особых проблем со сложностью, хотя я и играю на эксперте. Долго проходился только босс Serpentine - это тот еще душнила (Поэтому чтобы не мучатся играйте за Миллу). Все остальное шедеврально. Если сравнивать с соником (или боже упаси Spark the Electric Jester) то игра выделяется всем кроме музыки. Она средненькая. Но в целом эта игра богоподобна среди платформеров. Кстати всем советую пройти игру за Миллу, за нее геймплей довольно сильно отличается, легче исследовать уровни, а также гораздо легче убивать некоторых боссов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041265653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1663626209}
review:
It's not that the game isn't good
It just that it's not as good as the first one.
Specially on the music side, which I was really dissapointed !

For the rest of its, the enemies in this game are less memorable than the first one and the level design is still as chaotic as ever.

There is to me, only 2 or 3 real good level in the whole game and after all of the others level, you will get through it with the exact same tactics.

Just dashing forward and upward and going as fast as you can. I even have the feeling sometime to cheat over it but no, it's how the game ask you to play.

So 90% of the level, you will dash everywhere and skip the level design and platform part to just be focus to land somewhere safe, then guessing where you must go, and then dashing there and you repeat the same process all over again.

This is too repetitive and only few level of the game actually force you to not play that way, and guess what ? They are actually the best levels of the whole game !

The bosses overall are fun but mostly too easy or sometime too confuse on what to do but overall, it's the best part of the game.

I can't say I didn't enjoyed it, but I felt a let down playing it and I think the game is way way overhyped and over estimate.
It truly doesn't deserve the "extremenly positive" review.
But hey, if peoples like it's good for them.
Heck, I wish I could have enjoyed it too more xD

author: {'steamid': '76561197993107352', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1665310720}
review:
Hard to find anything Freedom Planet 2 doesn't do that greatly improves over the first game.

Everything about the sequel is DAMN good, from the gameplay and visuals to the music. Mix that all together, throwing in a fourth playable character while also enhancing upon the pre-existing trio from FP1, and you got yourself an extremely solid platformer that'll bring back those ol' Treasure vibes.

I'll always be thankful to Sabrina and the team over at GalaxyTrail for not only gracing us with an absolute banger of an indie title, but also bringing this wonderful game to fruition at a particularly rough point in my life and indirectly helping me push my way into a better spot. 

Much love to you guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072406942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1665420676}

author: {'steamid': '76561198415857594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1692685754}
review:
FINAL REVIEW, 50 Hours In - Ive completed ALL FOUR STORY ARCS. GET THIS GAME!!
FANTASTIC!!  Most games have a very, very difficult time being on par with their predecessor. NOT FP2! This game smashes almost all expectations! Let's go through it --
STORY - 12/10  Holy Sh... Hoooollyyyy HellsBells! They HAMMERED this one out of the park! Lilac's story? Daaaammnnn. Absolutely stunningly done. And when you unlock her secret level? Thats where the bonus marks come in. You Will NOT Regret It!  ALL FOUR Stories, while much more related to each other than FP1, Do a fantastic job expanding on each character; Poor Neela has a hell of a hard go but at the end earns her place.  Each of the four Story arcs had me stunned.
Graphics - 10/10  They pulled off stuff with the medium that no way in hell even a Saturn could do. The love and lavish they poured into this is very clear. Perfection!
Audio - 8.5/10 For the most part, the music is glorious.  Sound effects are clear, VA is Dead On. Level tracks are GORGEOUS!  My only real complaint is the boss battle tracks - some are remixes, but most with maybe two exceptions - thankfully the final bosses - tend to fall rather flat, IMHO. The boss battle tracks could of hit harder; but thats subjective. The explosions also need a bass boost, but again, extremely minor.
Gameplay - 8.5/10 NOW THAT IVE DONE ALL FOUR ARCS - Lilac's combat capabilities are only slightly improved over the original. At times, it doesnt feel improved at all. I even went and did a boss rush back to back vs FP1, and while her charge attack DOES charge faster, it still feels damn slow, especially for someone thats supposed to be fast. If you are a dedicated old school Rocket Knight Adventures fan, Lilac is still going to be frustrating to play, but a bit of a slight improvement from FP1.   Carol's attack, once you master it? MUCH better than it initially seems. A step up.  Milla? Holy shit she got buffed!  Neela? She IS the hardest to get the hang of, but once you do, she's a solid fighter; and im pretty sure they buffed her guarding. Im certain it wasnt working in the previous patch; now it works just as well as the rest of the crew.
ALL IN ALL? ABSOLUTELY WORTH EVERY PENNY.  Quite frankly My complaints are more subjective, most certainly not game breaking.  Most people wont notice the issues with Lilac, and all the gals gameplay is master-able. Hopefully, after the team rests for a bit, they go for a Trilogy.  They did drop the hints that a trilogy is on the table. GO FOR IT GALAXY QUEST! This game is worth DOUBLE what they are charging for it! Im dead serious; I virtually never say something like this, but this time? They absolutely EARNED it. 

BRAVO! This game is a MASTERPIECE!  Not only is it a Masterpiece? IT absolutely SHATTERS all expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025173537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1665366225}
review:
Possibly my most favorite platformer of all time; everything has been expanded and improved over Freedom Planet 1. Stages are faster and more varied. Characters are more refined and a new character that's fun and fits the gameplay well. Combat is smoother, with a new guard ability adding more depth at the same time. A lovely artstyle overhaul, and the music is honestly even better than the already great OST of FP1.

The story is much better. Merga is a more interesting and deep villain than Brevon, and has reasons for her actions instead of just a crashed ship (even if misplaced). The writing is more mature and the tone is more consistent than FP1. Humor is aplenty and personally lands much better.

Replayability is extremely high. Each Character is different enough from each other to feel fun in their own ways. Stages now have rankings, encouraging you to play fast and play well. There are hubs where you can soak in lore and details of the world of Avalice. You can buy items in these hubs to customize your gameplay experience (like starting with a certain barrier, or a potion that fine-tunes your character), or make it harder with brave stones for a better rank and more crystals (or masochism).

I've beaten FP1 many times and has always been a great experience. I see myself beating FP2 much, much more. And I will love every second of it.

+5 Respect

author: {'steamid': '76561198221775792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 88, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1712296862}
review: I only played the game as Lilac so far. But in all in all I give it a good 9.8 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198791998370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1692389005}
review:
Ok I'm gonna start with one sentence:
Freedom Planet 2 is the best game I've played this year and I could easily give it a 10/10

Could end the review with that, but if you're thinking I'm joking or something or you're not convinced, well sit down, relax and let me explain why this game is so important to me:

INTRODUCTION:
Let's start with this: there is just no compareson with the first Freedom Planet, yes it's still a good game, but the sequel just overshadowed it completly in every feature. I need to remind you that the firts game was after all a solid Sonic fan game that gained his own identity and you can't deny that. This formula of taking inspirations from bigger franchises or creating spiritual sucsessors of our favourite games when the original creators are not willing to, as been used now more than ever to preserve good game design and artistic freedom and (when done well) can create true masterpieces and fix the hissues of the original proprietys.
What FP2 did was cleaning up the dust from it's firts game and rebuild a totally new and original experience, detatching itself from the Sonic series wile still mantaining what made the game so good in the first place and did so much more.

GAMEPLAY:
The gameplay is fast, clean and fun! Every stage has it's own mechanics and all the 4 playable characters can provide new game experiences and the replay value is at his core!
First thing they did was cleaning up the annoying parts of the firts game. The movement for Lilac for example feels much more fun, now the spin attack does not cost power so you can use it in combo with the charge attack and the collectibles are no longer like... 10 per level?! But just 1 or 2, because the devs understand that in a game where you need to go fast, the SLOW exploration can feel lame at some point. But don't get me wrong you still have a lot to collect in other fun ways.
The first game was linear, a simple experience, this game have an overworld map, towns, NPCs, minigames, challenge modes and FINALLY a ranching sistem so you can have fun getting rank S for every stage in game. There are also items to equip, but I rarely use them cuz they take a way a bit of the final reward, but you can equip an hourglass to race against time and hearn extra cash for finishing the level before the timer runs out, super fun to play.

STORY:
Will be short to avoid spoilers, the first game got an average story that tryed to get cool at the end, but was nothing more than... the power of friendship against evil alien dude, that was good for a game like that, but the sequel got REAL!!
You got world bulding, drama, relationships, betrayal, fun shenes, very sad shenes and jsut something that will make you feel so fulfilled at the end of it, plus a secret ending if you can get it (it's worth it).

ART:
Yeah the art in the first game was good, but a bit silly and I wasn't really convinced about any character that wasn't Lilac or Carol and yeah was still too similar to Sonic...
This game owever changed the art completly and it's one of the amin reason why it feels so original. Every character EVEN THE NPC are fully animated and every stage filled with detail. Really nailed it this tme!

MUSIC:
The music is just great, not much to say about it, not an expert in music, but it fit the stages very well soooo yeah!

DUBBING:
Now the cherry on the top, the first game was already dubbed and that was impressive for an indie game like that, but with this? GOD! It is so well done! Every characters they played at was perfectly delivered expecially Lilac, Merga and Cordelia.
I can say in some shenes I was at the edge of crying for that and you guys get all my respect for it.

IN CONCLUSION:
FP2 is how you make a good sequel, and I mean sequel! Not like we call it XXXXX 2 and then is a prequel or some kind of AU or whatever, I mean sequel sequel and all game devs big and small should take example. Can't wait for FP3, IF there's gonna be one (I hope so).

wait... I should add some cons as well or people will think I'm just being a fanboy... OK

CONS:
That mech stage was trash why did you guys think that was a good idea!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271940896', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1697755674}
review: If you are a fan of 2D platformers, this game is an absolute MUST-PLAY. One of the most polished 32-bit-style platformers I've ever seen, and just like the first game, it blends the playstyles of classic Sonic and Mega Man X beautifully, with its own bit of flair thrown in there- something ever more present in this game. The story is a HUGE step up from the first game, the music is as solid as ever, the sprites are gorgeous, and the gameplay takes everything that worked in Freedom Planet and improves it to near-perfection. I CANNOT recommend this game ENOUGH.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147143760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1690251229}
review: Recomendo muito o jogo! É uma evolução em todos os aspectos do primeiro. Um prato cheio pra quem é fã de jogos de plataforma e é bem amigável pra novatos também, com muitas opções pra facilitar o jogo (e dificultar também, pra quem quiser mais desafios).

author: {'steamid': '76561198165932697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1710317142}
review: It may have taken a while, but the end product is well-deserving of praise. I'm still going through the game at the time of writing this (I'm about 3/4 of the way through if I'm understanding things rightly), and honestly, I'd rank Freedom Planet 2 up with the Klonoa games as one of the best platformers of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207760696', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1688165064}
review:
Freedom Planet 2 is, in pretty much every conceivable way, a superior game to Freedom Planet 1. It took 8 years to develop, and it shows.

FP2 is a speedy platformer with diverging paths and lots to explore. It draws heavily on influence from both Sonic and Megaman in pretty much all aspects. Combat is snappy--you never spend too long on a single enemy in the field--with just a pinch of depth that makes conquering boss fights feel rewarding. The stages are beautiful, with powerups and secrets to find. Difficulty in this game is easily modulated with helpful and hurtful items, so you can find that perfect balance of a playthrough or mess with fun, wacky combinations.

The story itself is pretty middle of the road, which is fine. FP2, like it's predecessor, is dedicated to easy-breezy saturday morning cartoon vibes, and the story beats fit perfectly in line with that. The tone gives way for some moments of drama and tension which I personally appreciated.

Like with FP1, the thing this game excels the most with is its visual story telling. There's a ton of dialogue to be had in FP2, but I found myself most engaged in the story and stakes in many of the later stages where GalaxyTrails' spark for visuals comes to life. There is a lot of care poured into each stage that tells its own story, so much that playing in classic mode with barebones story still contains the same sense of motion and tension.

10/10 Best unexpected game of 2022

author: {'steamid': '76561198255430296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1689802963}
review:
Overall, this is an better game than the first Freedom Planet. Levels are very funny to play, much better designed, and each one of them has some unique quirk to it, most of the bosses are memorable, music - absolutely gorgeous, although I miss the two-level stages with music variations from the first game a bit. New art style is also a definite winner!

Lilac is not the easiest to play character anymore, Carol and Milla in this game are totally bonkers - especially Milla, who easily decimates some of the bosses you can have problems with another characters. Neera is a bit boring though, she also doesn't have much of unique story elements other characters have. The story itself is a bit more lighthearted compared to the first game. Voice acting - absolutely enjoyable.

New villain is not Brevon, you can't top evil "just because he can" alien with a sinister voice, but I still really like her. If you do everything right and head for the True Ending, you'll get one hell of a fight as a final reward, comparable with Brevon's from the first game, if not worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114736966', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2551, 'last_played': 1704800468}
review:
Amazing game, nearly everything feels better than the first one. I really recommend it, and it was a fun time for at least 75% of my playtime.
Some pros and cons:

PROS:
- Amazing OST filled with catchy and groovy songs. It might not be as consistently strong as the first game's but it's nearly there. Ancestral Forge's BGM is incredible.
- Lilac, Carol and Milla play better than in the previous game, especially Carol (she's actually fun now).
- A LOT of very different levels, each with its unique gimmick.
- The story is definitely better in many regards. The true ending was pretty satisfying. Overall the story feels less like a saturday morning cartoon and more serious (except for the whole Battlesphere arc).
- I'm on the minority here but I greatly prefer this game's villain compared to the previous. On a regular playthrough you might miss why she's interesting, but getting the required items for the true end gives you a lot of backstory on her.


CONS:
- The endgame takes a nosedive in quality and the challenge feels really cheap in a few levels, especially with the gimmick of the final proper level (Lunar Cannon) and the extra level (Weapon's Core). Both the final and extra bosses have way too many forms (well, in the case of the extra boss, you have to get it's health under 50% at least twice before you actually get a chance to beat it.) The devs definitely didn't have any restraint here, for the worse.
- Playing as Neera is a miserable time, both if you want to go fast or battle. She has some strong moves, except that they're so hard to hit fast targets with that it balances out, but her speed is flat out horrible compared to all other characters.
- I feel the difficulty of the bosses is programmed around the ability to shield\dodge\parry attacks, but this mechanic is very hard to master, and sometimes feels like it doesn't mesh with the rest of the game.
- The time capsules really shouldn't have been rewards for the Battlesphere challenges. It doesn't compute why they're there instead of scattered throughout Parusa or even the whole game.


While I had more to say about the negatives, I'd say this game is extremely good overall and still recommend it. I just hope my criticisms are taken to heart by the devs. I wouldn't mind seeing balance patches to iron out the issues with the final levels and bosses and maybe even buffing Neera to be on par with the rest of the girls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798205729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1666561267}
review:
Recomiendo este juego, sin duda, es digno de tener el 2 en el título. Mejora en muchas cosas en comparación al original, la jugabilidad es más dinámica y veloz, pero a la vez familiar si vienes tras jugar al primero. Y si no has jugado al primero aún,  podrás aprender las mecánicas con el primer nivel de tutorial que existe al principio del juego, pero aún así recomiendo que empecéis por el primer Freedom Planet si no estáis familiarizados con la historia, personajes, etc y luego volváis a este. Añaden muchísimas más cosas, ya no es una sucesión de niveles que al superar uno vas directamente al siguiente, te ofrece mayor libertad con un hubworld que se expande a medida que avanzas por los niveles. Han introducido la posibilidad de equipar items a tu personaje para darle ventajas. Los jefes son bastante retantes. De momento estoy jugando con Lilac y supongo que la historia variará dependiendo del personaje que seleccione como ocurría con el primer Freedom Planet.

En conclusión: No esperéis más, compradlo ya porque merece mucho la pena.

PD: Me encantó la referencia a Sonic y Amy

author: {'steamid': '76561198078288775', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 61, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1712450067}
review:
I already enjoyed the original Freedom Planet enough and was definitely looking forward to the sequel for the past several years, but this game seriously blew my expectations out of the water. [b]Everything[/b] has been improved from before! Characters feel better to play, the level design is far more polished, the visuals look incredible, the voice acting, dialogue and story pacing are much better. Heck, the story itself is actually pretty good this time around! Plus, the amount of content you get here is genuinely impressive, with several collectibles and side activities to try. I could go on here!

The team at GalaxyTrail definitely took the feedback from the first game and went all in. This game has long since passed its original Sonic-esque roots, and is very much its own thing now.

I'm very happy to say this was well worth the six year wait, and definitely worth the price of admission. Even if you never played the original, I'd still recommend checking this out. One of my favorite games of 2022.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157484112', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1702348723}
review: I have been waiting for this game since the announcement on Christmas day, 2015. I cannot believe it has been almost 7 WHOLE YEARS since then! I'm so glad this is finally out, and I'm very happy with the polish and the willingness of the devs to continue polishing it and squashing out the bugs! I can't wait to experience all there is to experience in this game, I can't wait to get obsessed over speedrunning my favourite levels, and I can't wait for the inevitable soundtrack to drop!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011888811', 'num_games_owned': 964, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1659, 'last_played': 1703653417}
review:
I want to preface this with a little story
I loved freedom planet 1, and I beat it on the hardest difficulty on every character simply because it was really fun, and I have always enjoyed a good platforming challenge. The OST was incredible and the story even pulled me in a little bit (I was interested in the larger world they lived in.) However, it did have some frustrating moments, and I never did find every star card. But I did always remember my time in the game fondly.
After freedom planet 2 was announced, I was excited. And that excitement was burning for years, as I figured the development might take a while. But after the demo drop, I became discouraged as months of waiting became a year. And another. And another...I began to lose hope, to worry the project was secretly abandoned and nobody wanted to say anything, as other games released (Petal Crash in particular) in the interim. It got to the point where I just...stopped checking.
Last month, my passion reignited with a burning vengeance as I found out that not only had development continued, IT RELEASED! I was beyond ecstatic, but I had to wait for the funds to get the game. I thought 25 was a hefty price tag, but I was willing to give it a shot. I set aside a weekend, got the game, and I dived in.
I was blown away. The story, the world, the new controls, the characters, the sprite work, the levels, the OST, everything hit me like a truck. I started my play on the hard setting, and I was blown away by how even that worked, and the menus assist settings to help newer platformer players get into it! (I love settings that help new players enjoy the genre, as I enjoy seeing new players succeed and get better!)
I'm going to be honest, I have never had a game make me feel like a kid again before, and I don't know if I ever will, but this is a thank you to the devs for allowing me to relive those kid-like feelings of wonder and amazement, and even accomplishment at achieving victory. Even the final boss theme hit me different. It made the fight intense and sad at the same time, gave me the feeling of "this is IT, all or nothing" as I fought my hardest, using every trick I'd been taught to win.
A satisfying ending to a seven year wait, this most definitely was.

My list of Pros:
-Difficulty customization is unique, and I think it's a great addition to the game. You can choose the way you want to S rank a level if that's your goal, or you can choose the best items to achieve your victory, or even to help you beat a level faster than ever before.
-Level Designs are great. I never really felt like I had to slow down too much in a level. There were a couple puzzle segments that upset me a bit, but since I'm biased against most puzzles, I will abstain from judging that as a negative.
-Boss Designs are incredible. All of the bosses felt unique to fight, and all had their own patterns of movement and attack, No boss really felt too frustrating for me, save one, It's mostly because the boss is frequently off-screen and that makes it hard to tell where the boss is. I had to use particles to guess the buss location and hope I aimed right. If the camera in that fight zoomed out a little bit to accommodate the boss's size, I think that would easily fix my negative view of that particular fight.
-Lots of levels! There are an incredible number of stages, and thus content, in the game. I have put in about 20 hours on Lilac's story alone, and there are four versions, one for each character and their particular journey in the world.
-The Sprites are very fun! I enjoyed the large variety of characters and sprites, and if I recall correctly, almost all were unique sprites, giving each character their own life and appearance! In addition, the stages are GORGEOUS. they look incredible, and the backgrounds are no different. Everything just feels and looks so good, I was never bored by the appearance of a level!
-The story is good. They actually explain a lot more of the world's lore, and dive into the history of their planet. I had been curious about this since the first game, and I finally got some of what I wanted. Excellent execution and very good characters (especially the voice acting improvement! Great job!) help make the world come to life.
-The OST is bangin'. I love almost all the music in this game, there was never a time where I wanted to mute the music. Sometimes I boot the game just to play some of the OST collectibles in the jukebox because they are so good. A certain boss theme really does it for me and hits me in the emotions.

The Cons
-There are still some bugs in the game. I've been thrown out of the level in a few maps and either got soft locked or just...arbitrarily cleared the stage by hitting some unseen flag. I'm unsure if this is an intentional "recovery" feature (no matter how good your programming and testing might be, someone is still gonna find somewhere to break your game! Hello, speedrunning community!) but it was a tad confusing/frustrating when it happened.
-Some hitboxes are not obvious that they are hitboxes until you've died a few times to it. One particular attack that got on my nerves with this was an attack with a dagger that had shockwave clouds around it. Little did I know, not only did the line the dagger traveled hit you, but the cloud shockwaves would hit you too! (cost me my rainbow s rank a couple times and believe me, I was heated)
-Some spawn checkpoints are a tad far, from bosses enough to be annoying, but not enough to constitute a game design sin. As someone who likes to go fast when I get good at something, having that delay every time I go to fight them was definitely something I found zero fun in.
-some items are able to be selected even though they do nothing for you in that stage. I think the items should have a clear warning if you can't use them in the stage, or be locked. (Final stage Timer Badge is one I can think of immediately)

TL'DR
Game's really good, got a couple minor gripes but nothing too major, definitely worth your time for players of all skill levels. And I think the overall quality justifies your money expenditure, as well.

Final Score: 9/10

Very good job, devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997431275', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1369, 'last_played': 1689632103}
review:
One of the best games I've played on a long time. Tight controls, great game play, tons of replay value, and a pretty awesome story to boot!

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057634319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1668815382}
review: It's been a loooooong wait for this game, but boy was it worth it. This game is 100% a sequel done right, it completely blows the original out of the water. Not to say Freedom Planet 1 was a bad game, far from it actually, but FP2 improves on the original in every way. Every character's moveset has been improved to make up for their shortcomings either in combat or platforming while still retaining what made them unique. There are more than double the stages of the first game and they all have distinct gimmicks/setpieces that set them apart from each other. The spritework is better than ever, I could go on and on. If you liked the first game or other fast-paced platformers like Sonic or Megaman X/Zero I absolutely recommend you pick this up. This might be my GOTY, gonna have to see how MW2 and Sonic Frontiers turn out too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048804798', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1668965220}
review:
Now, while i do recommend the game because first off it's just as beautiful of a game as the first, sadly there are a few negative points i MUST bring to light.

Now this is merely my personal opinion, so anyone can disagree with me as they wish, but i personally think the first fight with Serpentine Phase 2 is not balanced properly, first off, his double slash attack you can not block it completely impossible you ALWAYS get hit on the follow up attack 100% of the time, 2 his projectiles he spams during phase 2, i honestly can't count how many times ive been fully in the clear where the projectiles do not reach you, and i still get clipped even when the space between the projectile and my character is half the width of my finger.

Now onto Final Boss Merga, oh boy this one is a doozy and probably the biggest grievance.

To put it lightly, she is completely BS and unfair, especially with her Final phase after you take out all her moon forms her attacks are far too fast, Far too frequent, every projectile she does has multiple hit frames so guarding isn't even useful, you literally have to run away avoid her like a plague, and using anything you have that can deal damage and give you an iframe in the process. 

Her fight literally forces you to play like a complete coward, which is a complete contrast too the first game, the first game you actually have to engage with the boss, rather than disengage with the boss.

A boss that forces cowardly play to have a chance, is a poorly designed boss, and that sums up my opinions with Merga, she needs to be reworked entirely she is not an enjoyable fight, not because she actually hard, shes not fun because she was intentionally designed to enforce Cowardice during the fight, that is not how you want you final big bad to be remembered as.

And this is why i would rather fight Brevon in the first game on highest difficulty despite the fact he basically 1 shot kills you with multiple attacks, but he has a rhythm too his fight and if i died it was because i didn't time my attacks or iframes correctly and died as a result.

With Merga you can have perfect timing for all of your dodges but you ALWAYS take damage.

So while i do recommend this game, be aware of those 2 boss fights, as they aren't really fair, or made with much thought in mind.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197995306216', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1708700988}
review:
The most addictive game I've played yet, possibly.

Is the game entirely combat-focused ? The answer is: No.

This is definitely one of those games where fast running stays important, just like in the original Freedom Planet. Controls have just gotten considerably more difficult to master, especially on levels like ancestral forge and merga (many people's favorites). Nevertheless, it is NOT a hard game to beat imo, well, merga maybe a little bit yes, the first times. 

Only thing that changed is there is indeed a lot of combat at the end of the game. This may be different from freedom planet 1, and certain parts of sonic games that people are used to.

The replayability is definitely high, and you will have some very fond memories of your entire journey you made once you're finished.

The game already earns back its money with half the stages done, let alone in full, and is underpriced actually, in that department, explaining perhaps the sales rate.

Please give it a chance if you have some time to spare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023578718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1665097304}
review: A great game despite not having a torture scene or down escalators to go up in this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027774242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1664429663}
review:
It was worth the wait.
It's like shigeru (or whoever at nintendo) said: "I would rather finish a game late, than release a buggy one early"

To say they stepped up their game doesn't do it justice.  They put a lot of elbow grease into this one.  It's far more dynamic in game controls.  The Art and actions has various sprites to grant strong immersion and break the monotony a game can often exhibit.  Plus it runs smoothly, really actiony platformer to say the least.  Artwork is breathtaking, gameplay is replayable, and has ample length for a good amount of gameplay time.

As for the story, it's my own opinion, not a strong one, but certainly not a weak story either.  I admit i can kinda be a little picky with storytelling but it works for this game well enough.

The worst i could give this game is an 8 out of ten, and that's only if i go full automatic Sheldon Cooper, Hero of Neckbeardia on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169651682', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1666375517}
review:
Much better gamefeel than the first one. The basic gameplay was already great, and now it's fantastic.

It no longer feels like the other characters are lagging behind Lilac. All the characters have cool kits and the game is just super fun and fast paced.

The presentation is INCREDIBLE. Tyson Tan is a great artist and his new character designs really make the game's cast look better, meanwhile the music is incredible just like the last game, as are the graphics. If you are a fan of anthro character design and/or beautiful pixel graphics you're in for a top of the line treat for both.

Edit: One thing I can criticize is the game's story. It's better acted, but if you aren't a fan of stories about victims of genocide going too far because they are written to be bad guys, you might have a problem. Don't know who thought that trope was needed or why, but it's here and it's dumb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812910012', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6294, 'last_played': 1685415398}
review: MEU DEUS QUE JOGO PERFEITO (ou melhor quase):Um jogo que demorou anos e anos para lançar, mas garanto que não foi um Cyberpunk 2077, muito pelo contrário! Se você jogou o primeiro, não hesite em comprar o segundo porque não vai se arrepender. Se não jogou o primeiro e/ou não se sente atraído a jogar, não se preocupe, a história do jogo é compreensível mesmo jogando só o segundo.Gameplay: É tão rápida e frenética como a do primeiro, acho que é até mais na verdade. O fator dificuldade em relação ao FP1 quintuplicou, e isso não é uma coisa ruim, é ótimo ter um desafio! Jogo extremamente divertido, personagens com play style diferentes, e aqui temos além da Lilac, Carol e Milla, Neera, e todas são extremamente divertidas de se jogar com o clássico slogan "fácil de aprender, difícil de masterizar", uma excelente mecânica inserida foi o botão de "guard", que se você pegar o timming certo do ataque, e é possível dar um "parry" evitando dano (na minha opinião é algo extremamente satisfatório kkkk) a Lilac tem basicamente os mesmos ataque de antes, mas ela pode cancelar o dragon boost no meio e criar uma estrela de energia, além disso ela tem o blink dash junto do "guard", a Carol tem quase os mesmos ataques e graças a Deus melhoraram o especial dela, que ao invés de ser o chatíssimo wild kick agora é um disco que ela joga e se joga junto dele se segurar o especial apertado (muito melhor), Carol sendo a mais forte nos combos agora é muito mais divertida de se jogar do que no primeiro, a Milla teve grandes mudaças e a playstyle dela pode ser bem rápido e não pecisa ser tão lento como no primeiro, Milla ja era legal agora melhorou ainda mais, a Neera entre as 4 tem a gameplay mais lenta de todas, não sou grande fã do playstyle da Neera já que a movimentação dela é meio precária, mas ela tem foco em saber administrar timming, combos e improvisar na hora certa. Infelizmente as vidas agora não fazem nenhum sentido, você naturalmente começa com 2 e vão sendo acumuladas só para a fase que está jogando. Em compensação agora temos uma barra que podemos equipar até 2 itens que podem ser comprados ou encontrados durante a gameplay, dependendo do item equipado ele pode facilitar ou dificultar sua vida no jogo, sendo que dificultando você ganha uma porcentagem bônus de cristais e uma nota melhor ao concluir as fases e facilitando você ganha menos cristais bônus e nota menor. Tem poções também que te dão buffs e não influenciam no bônus ou nota, então só lucro. Os leveis estão perfeitos! (conseguiram fazer um level inteiro subaquático bom, sim por incrível que pareça) Divertidíssimos e únicos, desde mecânicas criativas em cada level até level design. Bossfights desse jogo me deixou sem palavras, todas são muito boas (e difíceis também). Bugs? pisca que chega um novo patch corrigindo-os.Nota: 10/10História: A história se passa 3 anos depois do FP1, e é muito melhor do que a do primeiro. Eles pegaram e consertaram muitas das partes que tinha furos e colocaram uma baita lore top no FP2 e mais a própria história do jogo com acontecimentos, revelações, personagens novos e antigos aparecendo, uma história realmente emocionante e mais complexa, ficou impecável... Bom quase, tem uma parte do jogo que a história fica péssima e perde total sentido, mas se não fosse por isso daria 10, se quiser saber qual parte, um spoiler aí ---> [spoiler] é o final verdadeiro, não faz sentido nenhum [/spoiler] fico com dó mas...Nota: 8/10Trilha sonora: AAA Woofle (principal produtora das músicas) não decepciona, pega a qualidade da do primeiro e multiplica por 2, é cada bomba de OST com várias referências ao FP1 são muito cativante, harmônicas e ambientadas que trazem alma pra cada parte, seja estágio, luta, conquista, personagem, cutscene, é bão aaaaaa é bão de mais!Nota:10/10Personagens: HA! Personagens? Mais uma vez FP traz os antigos personagens com aquele carisma que só quem jogou o primeiro sabe, personagens únicos e memoráveis, muito mais do que apenas "furries" todos tem seus próprios objetivos, motivos, desejos, ambições e moralidade. O triozinho da alegria (Lilac, Milla e Carol) com aquela energia contagiante que anima qualquer um! Os antigos personagens são ótimos, uns mudaram, outros nem tanto. A maioria dos novos personagens são muito bem escritos, inseridos no contexto certo e alguns bem memoráveis, a Corazon (ou Cory pros chegados) é uma ótima personagem por exemplo (acho legal ela não surgiu só pra encher linguiça na história, já que teria uma citação no FP1 mas infelizmente não teve). mini spoiler: [spoiler] Senti um pouco da falta do Torque, ele é um bom personagem [/spoiler].Nota: 9999 goldNota final: 10/10 (foi mal mas é a verdade, bglh é bão mesmo)Vale a pena comprar sem promoção? Sim, vale e muito.FP2 pra mim foi um sonho realizado! Espero que esse jogo ganhe a fama que ele merece pq a dedicação colocada nele é outro nível.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225570696', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3272, 'last_played': 1665952886}
review:
The game's genuinely fantastic. It's a pure joy to play, evolving the gameplay and stepping up the level design present in its action platforming inspirations, like Sonic, and continues taking only the best parts from FP1. It's fresh, fast and fun!

The graphics are more detailed and prettier than FP1, and are impressive in motion with how well-animated every single one is. The sound and music quality is AAA.
Overworld map design is SMB3-like and therefore great. It's great how city hubs were implemented, and the NPCs therin were all funny, witty or both.
Story mission being available in almost any order does wonders for replayability, and was a genius addition. Story pacing, along with tonal consistency, was an improvemnt over FP1, and the optional lore collectibles were a nice side quest.
The difficulty curve is very finely tuned in the second half. The bosses stage bosses becoming cuphead-levels of hard near the end made me very nostalgic for the first game.

(Don't know if the devs've said for how long these updates currently being released twice a week will continue for. But I hope they eventually include fixes for some some nit-picky details like:[list]
[*]adding running/talking and attacking/talking sprites for the cutscenes,
[*]multiple character portraits for the file select like in FP1,
[*]handlebars often getting misaligned visually to the characters when lifted up and down...[/list]
Remains to be seen, but at this pace they'll surely be done polishing this up before the summer 2023 console ports.)

[strike]Also, can't wait for Freedom Planet 3 in 2030![/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198077532168', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 5737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2946, 'last_played': 1707078241}
review:
Я из тех "счастливчиков" кто ждал эту игру не семь лет, а всего пять. За это время интерес успевал и угасать, так и заново загораться. Мне даже было пофиг первую неделю после её релиза, но стоило запустить на выходных и понеслась. 

Первое что бросается в глаза – это новые дизайны наших трех персонажей. После событий первой игры прошло три года, наши героини подросли и повзрослели, особенно выделяется Милла – из плаксы она стала самостоятельной супергероиней). Tyson Tan очень постарался, теперь главных героинь можно с уверенностью называть вайфу. В основной ростер присоединилась Ниира Ли, четвертый играбельный персонаж, новый редизайн пошел больше всего ей на пользу.

По сюжету нашим девочкам будет противостоять новая злодейка водяная дракониха Мерга с личными мотивами - [spoiler] отомстить земляным драконам за истребление её вида и потерю близкого человека [/spoiler]. Концовка на выбранном персонаже зависит от всех собранных капсул времени, в которых можно узнать побольше о прошлом нашей злодейки, их 13. Видно заметный рост, от военного диктатора до мстительницы с плазма-резаком. Был приятно удивлен, что вернется часть старых злодеев. Сюжетные повороты бывают очень предсказуемые, но это не портит игру, а под конец я начал ловить вайбы сониковских сюжеток. В зависимости от выбранной героини, будут встречаться уникальные ролики, больше всего разнообразия получила Кэрол - [spoiler] в середине игры она отделяется от нашей группы [/spoiler]. Эх, а вот какой-нибудь Спэйд и Принц Дэйл(который, теперь в этой части король) стали максимально вторичными персонажами и учавствуют мало в сюжете, даже мелкий мэр Зао имеет больше экранного времени, хотя более комедийный. А ведь когда-то Спэйд планировался играбельным персонажем… да и его редизайн выглядит неудачно – белая панда в белых штанах, это что, сатира…

Геймплейно игра выросла, девочки получили новые фишки для себя, у каждой на отдельную кнопку появилось парирование атак, оно активно используется в игровом процессе на каждой героине.

Лайлак – наша дракониха научилась делать апперкот в воздухе, а циклон теперь не требует полоску и можно спокойно после него делать буст в любом направлении. Изначально казалось, что её понерфили – дамажил по старинке “всасываясь бустом” в босса и урон был небольшой. С мной сыграло злую шутку обучение, ведь в нем не была показана новая фишка и мой первый ран был без нее. Новая отмена буста позволяет сэкономить полоску и раздамажить сильнее босса, оставляя в нем заряд-звездочку. Имеет дополнительный дэш на кнопку парирования.

Кэрол – котейка освоила новые приемчики, такие как вертухан с коротким подлетом (можно совершать два подряд, где второй будет еще короче) и комбинацию с ногами заменили на метательный диск в любом направлении. Второй очень удобный для перемещения, так и для нападения – на место брошенного диска можно спиндешуться как Соник – эффект схож с бустом Лайлак. Если найти мотоцикл на уровне, больше он не потеряется от получения урона – его можно удобно складывать и раскладывать, сочетая диск и кнопку парирования. С мотоциклом можно развивать скорость выше чем у Лайлак и атаковать когтями.

Милла – собакин получила самую глобальную переделку. Она осталось медленным персонажем, но это не мешает ей с новой системой дальнего боя. Освоила рукопашный бой и свои зеленые желехи, причем движения похожи на танцы Чун-ли из стрит файтера. Научилась стрелять в любом направлении, а полет на ушах стал умилительным зрелищем. Щиток отбивающий вражеские снаряды остался и применим теперь в воздухе. Создается большой кубик теперь на кнопку парирования – используется по старинке для усиленного выстрела или для обычных, на уровне можно найти усилок сразу с тремя кубами. Какие-же у неё красивые и смешные анимации, все сделано с душой.

Ниира Ли – суровая панда-брюнетка) Новый персонаж показалась самой сложной, из-за ее медленных атак и бафа на урон. Желательно Баф применять, когда босс открыт для атак, а активируется он на кнопку парирования если полная шкала. Спешл запускает диск, который заморозит врага – можно использовать как платформу, но на гигантских противниках эффекта заморозки не будет, некоторые боссы ей подвержены, но это сможет сработать во вред, например, в спарринге против генерала Гонга. Полоска копится медленней, чем у остальных персов, для пополнения нужно использовать верхнюю атаку. У Нииры есть выстрелы с копья (стоя и сидя), медленная атака с замахом вниз и оба приема ускоряются под бафом, что тоже нужно учитывать. В наличии двойной прыжок и при активации бафа полоска тоже начинает тратиться, на верхний и нижний прием тоже есть два спешала, которые тратят ману. Нижний разбрасывает “Мины”, на которые можно запрыгнуть и сочетается с двойным прыжком, а верхний пускает волну. Ну и дополнительные атаки с меделенным дэшем в воздухе есть, против летающих роботов. Панда требует знаний игры и начинать на ней будет сложно, не видитесь на её красивый дизайн) Но, если её освоить, она способна выдавать самый высокий урон, проблема в том, что Лайлак гораздо легче с её отменой буста в звездочку.

За прохождение уровней теперь начисляется ранг от С до S. В получении рангов или упрощении игры может помочь новая система модификаторов. Можно ставить до двух, на упрощение или усложнение, за второе дают больше кристаллов. Теперь камешки есть куда потратить, на возрождение у чекпоинта при потери всех жизней или на обмен золотых кристаллов. Они нужны в магазинах, можно покупать упрощалки или снадобья. Вторым можно немного улучшить персонажа и тоже упростить себе игру: поднять урон, увеличить дальность прыжка и т. д. Предметы на усложнение также нужно искать на самих уровнях.

Сиквел стал глобальнее оригинала, уровней и боссов больше. Уникальных лвлов как в прошлой части для персонажей тут нет, но и без этого контента хватает. Есть колизей с испытаниями и возможностью рефайта с боссами, даже пару уникальных для арены завезли. Реиграбельность за счет уникальных роликов и геймплея на 4 персонажах высокая, всех подогнали под уровни, нет таких проблем как в оригинале, что все сделано под Лайлак. Есть схожие элементы с sonic advance 2, такие как рельсы и ускоряющие кольца. OST стал более сдержанным, но местами попадаются шикарные треки, например на последних уровнях в космосе. Уровней разраб наклепал от души, мои любимый Inversion Dynamo.

Продолжение оказалось таким же качественным как и оригинал, даже выше. Личность, отвечающая за обе игры очень экстравагантная (и походу очень любит птиц, судя по количеству боссов) , поэтому играя в продолжение чувствуется глоток свежего воздуха и новый “сониковский” экспиренс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336472121', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1675971504}
review:
[h1] Depois de 4 anos espera... FINALMENTE, o jogo lançou. [/h1]

[b] Em comparação ao primeiro jogo está uma delícia, as artes, as animações e trilha sonoras conseguiu superar o antecessor de uma forma surpreendentemente incrível. Esse novo sistema de itens e compras ficou sensacional , com as interações com os civis faz com que o jogo tenha mais vida. Fiquei encantado como o jogo ta fluido e os sprites bem trabalhado... admiro a dedicação e carinho que fizeram pelos fãs. O que me decepcionou um pouco, é que foi muito fácil deparar com alguns bugs. MAS... por favor deem uma chance para esse game, ele merece ser jogado e amado. <3 [/b] 

[spoiler] Carol >>> Lilac, Milla e Neera [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198057826545', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1705366052}
review:
Второй глоток свободы? Ну что ж, погнали.

Во-первых, матерь божья, обнимаю TysonTan-a и других художников за такой обалденный пиксельный дизайн. Не понимаю, почему на странице в Steam-e показывают какие-то рандомные углы, едва-ли отражающие те красоты которые игрок встретит на хабах и уровнях. Нет, я не прошу выкладывать спойлерные моменты, но покажите незнакомым игрокам чуть больше разнообразия, чем первые три уровня. А-то складывается ощущение, что это очередной GreenHill.

Во-вторых, боёвка стала динамичнее и легче. Появился блок, железная воля, дополнительные сильные атаки, эффекты от зелий и предметы с уникальными способностями. С таким набором и возможностью выбрать сложность, я не понимаю, как кто-то может жаловаться на то, что он не может пройти игру. (исключая баги, о которых все писали в первые дни выхода игры)

Боссов в игре много, и не все из них являются шариками, теперь в ассортименте есть детализированные призмы. :D 
Много паттернов атак перекочевало из первой части, и не скажу, что в новых я заметил сильное разнообразие, но и на том спасибо, инноваций я не требую.

С музыкой не всё-так однозначно. Первая часть серии пестрила яркими композициями под совершенно разные антуражи. Эти треки мне запомнились за счёт интересных последовательностей нот которые я могу расслышать ЧЁТКО. Нет, я не говорю, что половина треков в игре являются кашей, но в плейлист я себе такое не добавлю. Как на зло, лучшие треки чаще всего слышны на мировой карте и хабах.

Четвёртый момент с сюжетом и конфликтом. Как так вышло, что подручному злодея первой части серии прописали мотивацию и харизму лучше, чем главному злодею во второй? Диалоги в целом, стали по приятнее, и персонажи перестали постоянно вопить о всякой рандомной бытовой херне. Спасибо и за то, что на этот раз без вступительного урока по [i]минералогии[/i].

Стоит-ли игра своих денег и вложенных лет разработки? Определённо. Поскольку основная аудитория игры состоит из [i]соникофанов[/i] (и не нужно этого отрицать), на фоне той дичи что сейчас творит SEGA, [i]Freedom Planet 2[/i] презентует себя как нельзя лучше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063839112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2165, 'last_played': 1670150919}
review: This is a game I've been waiting for a long time to play and it was worth the wait! My only wish, which is just a pipe dream since Freedom Planet, is that one day we'll be able to play as Spade. For a character that doesn't get much screen time, he became my favorite ever since FP1. I was upset when Neera Li was the 4th character but I did enjoy playing as her too. And that goes for everyone else. I highly recommend ppl try this FP2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077500117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1701210229}
review:
The attention to detail and love this game was given really shows. Level design is especially inspired. Sometimes the levels seem as though you are missing a lot of content as you go through, but that makes total sense: you are indeed missing content because the levels are designed to be navigable by four different characters with different move sets. Freedom Planet really moves into its own with this game. 
The con I would have to mention is the sense of difficulty spikes, especially on some boss bottles. It can be almost Soulsian, where the fight is very mechanically doable once you figure it out, but you breeze through the stage and then get junk-slapped so hard you wanna throw the controller for the next seven attempts until the fight finally clicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427272513', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 6129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1695469491}
review:
最高に可愛くって強いケモミミガールズがパワーアップして帰ってきた！　頭身が上がって画面が広くなり、緻密に描かれたステージや背景のドット絵は美しさのあまりため息が出るほど。ステージは普通に走ると5分かかるくらいで仕掛けも豊富。ステージ数は前作の倍近く、さらにそれが4キャラ分とボリュームたっぷり。前作のアレンジを取り入れた曲は懐かしさが込み上げてきます。良いとこ尽くしで大満足。
なんですけど、ボス戦だけは少し辛かったです。

[h1]ハイスピードアクションが色々強化[/h1]
絵が前作と比較にならないくらい綺麗です。フルHDで表示させてもドットサイズが等倍で画面が崩れません。4人の操作キャラクターはモーションが滑らかでしかも撮影機能付き。好きなだけドット絵を鑑賞できます。
ステージは長すぎず短すぎずちょうどいい感じ。「気合が入ったステージは最初の方だけ」なんてことはなく、最後までみっちり詰め込まれています。走るルートは1周では把握しきれないくらい分岐が多数。ステージに隠されたアイテムを探すために色々なルートを試したりショートカットできたりで探索の甲斐があります。初見でも大体道なりに沿って進めばゴールに辿り着けますし、ステージに特色ある仕掛けが満載で画面の移り変わりを見るだけでも楽しめます。
画面外からの攻撃は警告表示で位置を知らせてくれることや、頻繁に自動チェックポイントが入ってくれること、各種アシスト設定が可能で走りやすさにも気を使われています。

成長した主人公たちの姿はより凛々しく可愛くなりました。相変わらずスタンピーくんを大事にしているMillaとか見ると心が温かくなります。マップ制になって街を散策できるのですが、住人の種類が多くておっきいのもちっさいのももうみんな癒されます。
敵味方が入り乱れる怒涛のストーリーも目が離せません。ステージクリアするたびにフルボイスでキャラクターの掛け合いがあるのも前作通り。あとは台詞の自動送りが任意で選べればよかったです。

[h1]ボスに慣れるまでは辛め[/h1]
進めるうえでネックになったのがボス戦でした。図体は大きいのにやたらと当たり判定が小さく、しかも空中を高速で移動しまくります。ひたすらジャンプしてなんとか攻撃をヒットさせるの繰り返しで時間がかかりました。ステージを駆け抜けるのと比較するとボス戦は爽快感に欠ける、というか若干ストレスも感じるくらいでした。各ステージのラストは大抵ボスが待ち構えていますし。ついでに言うと一部のザコ敵にも硬い・当てにくいという傾向が見られます。
ボスの行動パターンは一定の繰り返しでほぼ決まっている辺りは温情です。行動順を覚え、いつどの攻撃を入れれば効率よく削れるかがわかれば戦いにくさも変わってくるかと。「ガード」で被弾を無効化する、アイテムを適切に装着するのも忘れずに。

動作については今更言うべきではないかもしれません。発売直後は数々の動作不良に見舞われましたが、開発者の迅速な修正対応により解決しつつあります。もしかしたらボス戦にも今後バランス調整が入る可能性も。
キーコンフィグは今のところ攻撃、ジャンプといったキャラクターの動作に関する部分だけなので、決定やキャンセルも個別に設定できればありがたいです。

[h1]まとめ[/h1]
前作の流れを汲みつつ、新キャラクターやアクションを追加して走りやすくなり画面は高品質化。しかもぬるぬる動くドット絵で。続編として期待以上でした。ステージは数が多くて仕掛けもあれこれ、ボスは戦いづらさはあるけどこれも沢山います。そのせいか個人的にちょっとカロリーというか気力というか、消耗していっぺんには進めにくい感じはありました。これはその分濃密であることの裏付けとも言えるのかな。
キャラクターの外見が優れているだけではなく、ステージを駆けるアクションの中身もやり込みたくなる。そんな素敵さが溢れています。

author: {'steamid': '76561199215721271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1680123688}
