Love the new potion system as well, with the ability to mix and match bonus health, speed, jump power, and other extra abilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159528022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2228, 'last_played': 1684637780}
review:
After playing and loving the first Freedom Planet back in 2015, I've waited years for this sequel to release, and I can happily say this game was WELL worth both the wait and the price. Many improvements and QoL changes have been made to gameplay, art, and presentation compared to its predecessor; the whole experience feels very streamlined and engaging the whole way through, every character feels very action-packed and fun to play (not to mention REALLY entertaining to watch in cutscenes as well), there are a whole bunch of levels with great variety to both explore and speed through, and it runs fast and smooth on my piece of junk laptop which is a miracle in and of itself!

I'm nearly 40 hours in and still have 1 and a half campaigns left to finish, and that's not even including completionist tasks and additional challenge playthroughs. This is easily my favorite indy game ever, as well as top 10 video games in general. $25 is such a steal; I'll need to buy this game again when it comes out on console just so I can pay closer to what I think it's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072963717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1688842690}
review:
It's taken me quite some time to find how I want to say the praise I want to say, as It's easy to gush so much your feelings come off as insincere.

This game.... is so freaking good it [i]is borderline unreal.[/i] It took 7 years to make, and it shows in just about every aspect of the game. Every. Single. Aspect. Sometimes, such a long dev cycle is a death sentence for a project, and this is THE POLAR OPPOSITE of the case here. I have 11 hours in and I'm not even 2/3 of the way through the first campaign, and have only done a few sidequests and battlesphere missions. THAT is how much content we have here. We have collectibles, a minigame zone in the battlesphere, the achievments.... $25 is a freaking steal for how much there is to do here.

I have not tried the new character Neera as of writing, but the three other characters are an absolute delight, not just in fun gameplay and mechanics, and character design, but in POLISH. The game feels as snappy and fluid as something like Rayman Legends.  While the game is fully its own thing, I've noticed several other elements that feel born from criticisms of the same sonic series it's inspired by as well as a bunch of other things. Too many reused levels? Each level is vibrantly crafted to a T and visually distinct; the pixel art feeling less like pixel art and more like the effort Studio MDHR put into Cuphead. Can't see where you're going when you go fast? The screen has an adjustable zoom. "Souls" -like difficulty getting jack.d off to no end? The Game has a casual mode to get you adjusted, as well as a slew of items and settings to truly make your play experience your own, with really the only penalty being fewer rewards at the end of a stage. Story too long, inconsistent and not engaging? The game is much more well-paced, with a MUCH stronger narrative which was confirmed to be inspired by Zootopia and Black Panther. In other words, it explores some darker themes but does not have something like the torture scene from the first game. Some Dialogue still feels off, but that is a nitpick. Even the hub worlds are small, compact, and [i]right to the point[/i].

Even if you are not a fan of 2D action platformers, I'm willing to bet you know someone who does, and I'll say it once I'll say it again - This game is a worthy inclusion to your library. To list negatives, sometimes the difficulty does not feel balanced, and the aforementioned dialogue feeling off, but really, THAT'S IT. 

There is no other way to say it. To Miss Diduro, the Galaxytrail team, and contributors like Christian Whitehead, Chris Sabat, and anyone else not mentioned, your game absolutely ROCKS.

EDIT: Also behaves quite nicely on steam deck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042772509', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4206, 'last_played': 1702686192}
review:
100시간 이상 플레이 하고 도전과제 올클, 밀라로 스테이지 올 레인보우 S 찍은 후 적는 팁.

이 게임은 난이도를 직접 커스텀 할 수 있으니 어려운 분들은
Crystals To Petals 와 No Petals를 장비하고 포션은 Healing Strike로 맞추고 가보도록하자

Crystals To Petals 와 No Petals를 같이 장착하면 모든 라이프 페탈과 크리스탈이 붉은 크리스탈로 바뀐다(체력을 채워줌) + Chain Reaction도전과제는 덤이다.

Healing Strike는 적 공격시 체력을 채워준다.

No Petals는 에비안 뮤지엄에서 획득 할 수 있다.

브레이브 스톤과 바이닐 공략은 

https://youtu.be/s0e0KEtSCdQ

위에 영상으로 올려두었다.

노멀 이하의 난이도를 선택한 분들은 위 영상에서 녹화 못하고 넘어간 더블 데미지하고 노 리바이벌즈까지 챙겨야 한다
https://youtu.be/dkPo3pXUACw

나머지는 상점에서 구하면 된다.

아래는 밀라 플레이 가이드
https://youtu.be/c2qu9SGIz00

------

2편까지 무려 7년을 기다렸다
발매 초기라 그런지 버그가 조금 보이지만 업데이트로 조금씩 패치해가는중..
게임성은 두말할 것 없고 영혼을 갈아넣은듯한 도트 그래픽과 BGM, 스토리 또한 좋았다 
보스 패턴 하나하나까지 공들인 흔적이 보인다.
기다림이 아깝지 않았다.

다만 결국 끝끝내 기간안에 못 맞췄는지 보스로 나왔을 예정으로 보이는 스페이드는 갤러리에 전시되는 것으로 마무리된듯 싶어 아쉬움이 남는다

끝으로 역시 밀라는 긔엽다

+

2023/ 4.7 밀라로 올 스테이지 하프타임 달성!

review:
More Freedom Planet means more fun!

This game is really good. It's fast, it's smooth, the bosses are cool. Even the few glitches that exist don't kill me like they do in Sonic games... and they are getting fixed consistently. Absolutely worth your money.

EDIT: 8 more hours in, having a great time. Music really bops. Sky Bridge is probably my favorite stage so far. Think I'm about to beat the game for the first time.

Freedom Planet 1 is still tied for my favourite 2D Sonic Game (with Sonic Mania), but dang, this gives S3&K a run for it's money for  second place.

author: {'steamid': '76561199173992232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1665117119}
review: Upon completion of Lilac's story, my thoughts of the game have changed entirely from when I first played it.  At first, I thought Freedom Planet 1 was the better game, however, with more experience with this game, that was clearly wrong.  The only things I can say are better in the original are the level-to-level gameplay rather than a small hubworld, even though it doesn't really hurt the game, and theme song, which in my opinion is still better than this game's theme, but that is subjective.  In terms of story, this game takes what the first game did and amplifies it by adding more character drama, more intensity to the character interactions, and genuinely helping to make the villain more connected to the main characters, something that Brevon lacked.  In terms of gameplay, nothing bad to say, takes everything the original did and amplifies it ten fold.  The Sonic influence is still very much present in this game, even down to adding grinding as a mechanic, and I am truthfully a huge fan of this aspect of the game.  Sonic is my favorite franchise of all time, and to see those who understand the reasons why the classic 90s Sonic games' levels worked so well and apply them with a unique and fresh touch that not even Sonic Mania has.  Well Sonic Mania suffers from originality issues in terms of level themes, this game does not, which is awesome to see.  Bosses in this game are fun as well, retaining that classic sense of timing and waiting for an opening.  Music is fantastic, no complaints there.  Overall, this game takes everything that was fantastic about the first game and amplifies it.  The first game used to be my favorite indie game of all time, ever since I first played it 7 years ago, but now I am happy to say this game lived up to all of my expectations and is now my favorite indie game of all time.  I have huge nostalgia for this franchise and I really do hope GalaxyTrail continues with another sequel.  This game is not just a fantastic treat for Sonic fans, but fans of classic platformers as well.  Classic platformers in the vain of Sonic and Mario are my favorite genre and this game knocks it out of the park in that category.  Exquisite work GalaxyTrail, here's to hoping for more successes in your future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198180073911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1679555232}

author: {'steamid': '76561198183649198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1687407081}
review:
I've played a good amount of 2D platformers, so I'd confidently say that this game is great. If you liked the first Freedom Planet you'll probably love this one. It's a fast-paced, momentum based action-platformer with excellent music, visuals, and level design. There's some really fun boss fights, a surprising amount of fully-voiced cutscenes, and a good amount of replay value.

First playthrough took about 9 hours, but I redid a few levels, finished the Battlesphere mode and just generally screwed around a bit. If you're just gunning it the entire time I would say a decent player would finish in 5-6 hours. I'll probably come back and rewrite this after I finish a playthrough with all 4 characters to see what's in store. You can also get a lot of replay value redoing levels to improve your time or get a better ranking if you're into that. Stages are typically under 10 minutes, so you can run through them multiple times pretty fast.

So yeah, if you're a fan of action-platformers, or if you're not and just looking for a good game to try out, definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100324035', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1705969736}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025618299', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1529, 'last_played': 1676491763}
review:
I was a Sonic fan for nearly twenty years, almost from the very beginning. The first Freedom Planet managed to impress the hell out of me by out-Sonic-ing Sonic (not that that was hard at the time) and throwing in a perfect blend of elements from classic Treasure games like Gunstar Heroes, and even a bit from my beloved Rocket Knight games.

Now, eight years later, here's the sequel... and not only does it out-Sonic Sonic again, I'd go so far as to say it out-Treasures Treasure. This is hands down one of the most impressive platformers I've played in years. It looks and sounds gorgeous, it plays like a dream, its story is wonderfully deep, its mechanics are brilliant, its boss fights are spectacular, and its setpieces keep getting more and more hype, topping themselves with every new level. Everything done well in the first game isn't just done better here, it's given a shot of pure adrenaline and turned up to eleven.

If you are or were a fan of classic Sonic or if you like 2D, sprite-based platformers at all, buy this game right now. It's a blast from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000654213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1791, 'last_played': 1703004325}
review:
A lot of people are going to compare the Freedom Planet games to just Sonic, but at this point it's more doing its own thing with an eclectic mix of inspirations from all across Sonic, Treasure's game library and more classic retro platformers besides that. Which is absolutely a good thing.

This game is a huge work of passion and you can feel the effort coming from every little detail, to the gorgeous sprite work, the remarkably expansive level design and the great story told through the games main adventure mode.

I did definitely get my face beat in by several of the bosses on my first playthrough, and each time I got better- only to get floored by another tougher key boss fight later on in the game (before improving again), which if anything is a sign of a good difficulty curve considering I was constantly improving. But if the difficulty every gets too much at a particular point, there are good assist options in the menus such as infinite revivals (the ability to get up for free after losing a life) and more. To make sure you don't get stuck and unable to continue if platformers aren't your usual game genre.

Overall, really, this rules. Loved almost every moment of it, currently on my third playthrough. Sometimes video games can be good it turns out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070332389', 'num_games_owned': 3399, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2534, 'last_played': 1674904233}
review:
Took me a solid 42 Hours to complete the 4 characters campaigns

Carol was played first
Milla second
Neera Li Third 
Lilac 4th

Will challenge the rest of the 17 achievements left (mostly speedruns and collectathons.) in which I will update this review.

At the time I would say this.

Its a decent game but it feels a little cut around the edges for some parts of the game especially art materials revealed in the past 7 years since the Freedom Planet 1 release (July 21st 2014). *A photo of Lilac's gang + Spade/Dail alongside Carozon Tea on a airship. Probably just for promotional sake to stir hype. Sadly the same event doesn't happen in the game.  

Majority of the music is solid for the most part but it does not leave much of an impact as the first game. Sadly only 7 stages has leitmotifs from the first game. While the Soundtrack is indeed weaker then the first game, it makes up for it with nearly 17 more songs of the song-list (FP1:72 tracks / FP2-89 tracks) from the first game which is quite nice.

Story Mode of Carol Tea is quite endearing but it leaves more to be desired with interactions to her and her sister. Only a few instances are just her meeting her sister and her sister just jets with a warning. I feel Corazon could've been made to be a more integral part of the game itself. But it be how it be I suppose. Not much of her past is revealed. Only references of her previous occupation before teaming with Lilac.

Milla the Hound while her past is mysterious since the first game being adopted to Carol and Lilacs' care, it comes to light in this game. Which I believe is to be the most impactful of all 4 Plots within Freedom Planet 2.

Story mode for Neera Li left more to be desired, hardly put nothing is revealed about her past, mostly a soldier through and through being quite focused and tempermental.

Lilac story basically gives more depth to what Lilacs' motives are especially with her kind. But it falls a bit short somewhat as it just makes her more of a worry-wort instead of the determined and focused character from the first game. Though it is questionable of the *Past* of Lilac of how she became to be considering how the ages are. 

The new antagonist while the initial reveal shows them to be capable, gets a bit lamp-shaded being behind the scenes for majority of the game until 3/4ths of the way through the campaign. Brevon from the first game had more of a existent threat than she was as he was making loud moves between the three kingdoms of Shang Tu, Shang Mu and Shuigang. Not until the reveal of the antagonist of the second game to the cast did it felt that the world was coming undone.

Strengths

4 different styles of play

A expansive world map that expands around world-building of planet Avalice.

Bigger soundtrack

Some characters backstory is revealed but not fully.

Weakness

Classic Mode locked after first completion of Adventure Mode which can be a bit of a slow-going but I'd feel after first playthrough Classic Mode would be a must to play for a streamlined exp. without the padding inbetween stages.

Soundtrack is less memorable than the first game with some tracks placed in, however there are quite a few bangers within the game.  

Game feels a bit straightforward this time around which is quite weird. After you play through the stages first time around or so, you start to feel that the stages are quite easy to memorize and quite very so you can breeze through them quickly as possible. (Even one of the achievements is to beat the game in under 4 hours time from total time of the stages.) Still, longer than the first game which *CAN* be completed in under a hour or two if focused.

Story seems a bit cut out. Some moments seems to be omitted out to make the game much more flow through. I prefer the first game story overall to be straight blunt with you. But personal preferences aside. Its serviceable somewhat.

You will notice that the further you get into the game, the more enemy spam placement there will be. In most cases they are merely hindrances that you can ignore (however upon defeating some enemies you get Energy Cores in which you can redeem for Gold Gems to unlock items/potions to enrich gameplay.)

Serpentine isn't a jobber anymore? Maybe? Maybe not? You decide.

The new characters (outside of Carol sister) are questionable at best for their purpose and being in the game. They feel out of place and out of sorts compared to the other cast. At least talking to some of the NPCs is quite nice for the first romp through the game however on subsequent playthroughs I just wanted to blitz through the game to complete it. Would be nice to implement some additional effects from chatting with the NPCs such as quests and what-nots. Mayhaps for future implementations there would be a reward to enhance the game with more content? Who knows.

For under $22 its a good game to get. $25+ unless it has further updates and DLC included within would be more appetizing. I feel the game is lacking quite a bit. Need more story implementations for the characters.

But I recommend it if Spark 3 being 3D isn't good for you. Then the old 2D-platforming Razzle Dazzle would be perfect for you.


*Update*
70 Hours upon completion and I got my time in the game 100% with every achievement managed to unlock.

My entire playthrough can be watched here. 13 Videos chronicled for the game. Mistakes were made, improvements were done, and shortcuts were taken. Regardless I had fun. Here's hoping you do the same if you purchase this title for its full amount that it is worth.

https://www.twitch.tv/collections/VKhbgXE5FRel0w
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4qRm56odipE4R2c3INV754X8jxQyR9Ue

author: {'steamid': '76561198056195426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1663773607}
review:
This is a case where it's hard to choose between recomending on not, but Steam doesn't have a mixed option.
This is mostly a first impressions review, so I might change my recomendation depending on how I feel after finishing the game, if I even finish it.

First the good:
- The pixel art is gorgeous. Truly outstanding work and a huge improvement compared to the previous game. And the low-poly 3D models used are great as well.
- The music is equally good, really each track really fits the stage.
- The voice acting is miles better than the first game.
- Boss fights are really fun! The combat really works for that, except the guard timing being a bit too easy, but that's not a big deal.

But now here's the bad:
- The writing is still as bad as the fist game. It's like an early 90's Saturday morning cartoon, and not of the good ones. Wouldn't be a big deal if you could just play Classic mode from the start, but you have to do the story first.
- The platforming is... ok. I probably would have liked it more if this game came out shortly after the first one, but after playing Sonic Mania and even more recently playing Curse Crackers, the platforming isn't nearly as satisfying as those two other fast-paced platformers, or even the first Freedom Planet. It's hard to explain, but it doesn't really feel like any part of the stage really flows naturally into the next.
- While the combat really works for the bosses, I can't say the same about the levels. 99.9% of the time it's better to just ignore enemies instead of attacking them, and engaging them with melee attacks is just asking to get damaged since you can get stunlocked by their attacks but they barely flinch at yours. That stuff is not a problem during bosses, where you're in a confined arena and you can carefully dodge and learn the patters to know when to attack, but when you're speeding through a stage the enemies are nothing more than annoying stage hazards.
- Considering the speeds you go and how the levels are designed, the game is too zoomed in by default and even with the warning signs it's not uncommon to just run or fall into enemies before you have the time to react.

In short, it's decent, but not a worthy successor for the first game, I'd suggest to play that instead if you haven't.

But if you really want to play this game, I'd suggest editing your save file to play Classic mode from the start. I'm playing like that mostly because I just want to see all the bosses the game has to offer since so far it's the one part I found consistently fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194511142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1704407349}
review:
[h1] Вновь на Авалис навалилось куча всего! [/h1]
То небесные пираты бушуют, то уцелевшие прихвостни Брейвона строят свои козни, пробуждается древний [strike] обезумевший протосс из StarCraft-а [/strike]  дракон и пытается уничтожить мир! И всё это придётся разруливать нашей знакомой четвёрке героинь.
[h1] В главных ролях [/h1] [hr][/hr]
[b] Саш Лайлак [/b] — [strike] это тот самый Соник с сись... [/strike] водяной дракон с обострённым чувством справедливости, в прошлом член преступной банды «Red Scarves». Носиться аки Форрест Гамп, бустит круче одного известного синего ежа и рикошетит от стен аки Ristar.
[b] Мила Бассет [/b] — няша стесняша, объект для умиления. Летатель ушами и копатель лапами, одним словом - «эксплорер тайп», но может неплохо так навалять, если приловчится играть.
[b] Кэрол Ти [/b] — кiшка-ниндзя с взрывным характером и не менее вызывающем поведением, всех руками побивает и ногами добавляет. Умеет цепляться за стены соответственно может выполнять роль эксплорера, так и пулей пролетать уровни, ибо гоняет на мотоцикле аки Безумный Макс.
[b] Нирра Ли [/b] - пубертатная язва... панда-ледяной рыцарь, лейтенант стражи Шаньг Ту, которая гонялась за героинями в 1 части. Чисто силовой персонаж, наносит много урона, умеет замораживать противников, но уступает в мобильности.
[h1] Сложность [/h1] [hr][/hr]
Вы можете смело ставить хард, т.к. фактически это ни на что влияет, кроме прохождения самого первого уровня. Сложность в игре из разряда "я сам себе придумываю проблемы и героически с ними борюсь" и зависит от выбранных модификаторов, которые можно найти на уровнях или купить у торговцев за «золотые кристаллы» (их тоже можно найти в сундуках на уровнях или конвертировать у торговцев за синие кристаллы или металлолом) т.е. вы сами себе можете как облегчить жизнь, увеличить скорость, высоту прыжка, накрутить урон, превратить все кристаллы на уровне в лепестки с жизнями и так далее в том-же духе. Так наоборот - усложнить, сделать так что бы по вам проходил двойной урон, отключить блок, поставить тайм-лимит, отключить конты или превратить все капсулы с айтемами в бомбы.
[h1] Недочёты [/h1] [hr][/hr]
Да в игре встречаются мелкие баги, типа неверно отображающихся кнопок геймпада, так же персонаж пару раз застревал/проваливался в текстурах, но это так мелочи и они не сильно мешают прохождению.
А вот некий импутлаг мешает, причём случается так когда ты к примеру нажимаешь "вправо/влево" или "блок" и персонаж реагирует не сразу, а только со второго нажатия, не смотря на то что этот недочёт проявляется не так часто, зато в самый неподходящий момент, как говориться: «редко, но очень метко». Недаром разработчики в темпе выпустили патч улучшающий совместимость с игровыми контроллерами.
[h1] Итог [/h1] [hr][/hr]
Перед нами вполне добротный сиквел, который во многих аспектах дополняет и расширяет предыдущую часть, игра стала намного ярче и разнообразнее, а так-же не лишена нововведений и своей изюминки, даже 2 концовки есть. Так что игру настоятельно рекомендую, особенно тем кто знаком с первой частью!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034239285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1673584579}
review:
There's more than enough content in this game to keep your sonic itch scratched, and if you were a fan of the first game I would wholly recommend this sequel as it improves much of what has been done before. The story itself will build on a lot of the same characters you've seen before and introduce new ones who are equally intriguing and have a lot of personality. It answers a few questions while still keeping and introducing more.
And there's an emphasis on either plunging the levels' depths to get the most possible out of your run or going as fast as you can, to reach the end and to beat the bosses quickly. And hoo boy, they have a LOT of boss fights in this one, there's at least one per stage and the toughest encounters have their own stages so you won't have to worry about getting sent too far back for dying too much.

If it's the only few critiques I can give it's that changing the lives into "stocks" and not providing much opportunity to gain more outside of crystals, potions, and items can put a lot of pressure on the player to avoid restarting the stage once encountering the boss. There is an easy mode, but if that's for new players then they'll have to treat this game as a self-contained adventure rather than a continuation in the world of the previous one.
Speaking of the story, for as much as I like the foreshadowing and buildup to the reveal of Merga's plans, I do admit she feels like she gets left on the backburner of the first act a bit long.
But these aren't to any detriment of the game itself. If you want the challenge, it's there for you and it's welcomed with open arms.

All in all, 11/10 this is a Must-Buy for those that enjoy 2D Sonic and Freedom Planet 1 or other skill and speed-based platformer games as well as people who enjoy the art and style of many genesis classics, fantasy and space sci fi mixed together, and pretty pixel art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262999368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1678318026}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065424111', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1664307873}
review:
Freedom Planet 2.
E mo' cos'è, vi chiederete?

Beh, molto semplice:
Freedom Planet 2 è il sequel di Freedom Planet, e segue le avventure di Lilac, Carol e Milla, più Neera, tre anni dopo gli eventi del primo gioco.
Da dove cominciare?

[h1] Quattro personaggi? Non male per iniziare il punto del Gameplay [/h1]
Il gameplay è simile al primo Freedom Planet, ma con cambiamenti.
In primis, il gioco ad alcuni punti chiederà quale punto della storia scegliere (e completate tutte e tre, si continua).
Secondo, sono i personaggi:

[b] Sash Lilac [/b]

Il gameplay di Lilac non è cambiato molto. Tuttavia, il dragon boost è cancellabile, il che apre nuove opportunità per combattere i nemici (ed anche per fare qualche manovre).

[b] Carol Tea [/b]

Carol ha ricevuto diversi cambiamenti. In primis, al posto del Wild Kick, ora Carol possiede un Jump Disc, che gli permette di andare in punti dove non ci sono muri. Il Jump Disc inoltre permetterà a Carol di conservare la sua motocicletta, così da poterla sfoderare in certe situazione dove è necessario.

[b] Milla Basset [/b]

Rispetto alle altre due eroine, Milla ha ricevuto cambiamenti utili. Non più si dovrà caricare per un Phantom Cube: ora Milla è capace di attacchi corpo a corpo, e sparare proiettili se si ha un phantom cube (che appare premendo il tasto per il "Guard"). Inoltre, Milla ha ora due punti vita in più rispetto al gioco originale. 

[b] Neera Li [/b]

Ebbene sì: il miniboss del primo gioco è diventato un personaggio giocabile. Neera è leggermente più lenta rispetto al trio, ma fa danni abbastanza forti, e possiede un doppio salto. Oltre a ciò, difendersi permette a Neera di entrare in uno stato di Focus, il che aumenta la velocità dei suoi attacchi.

Tutti e quattro i personaggi di gioco possiedono inoltre la possibilità di alzare la guardia, in modo da poter parare, riflettere o schivare gli attacchi nemici (Milla genererà anche un Phantom Cube, Neera entrerà in stato di Focus, e Lilac farà un dash corto se la schivata ha successo)

[h1] Grafica e soundtrack di gioco... Tutto qui [/h1]

La grafica del gioco è migliorata un sacco, rispetto al primo Freedom Planet. Più dettagli e scenari migliorati. Inoltre la soundtrack del gioco è molto buona.

[h1] Momento Spoileroso [/h1]

Rispetto al primo gioco, gli eventi di questo gioco cambiano leggermente a seconda del personaggio scelto. Tuttavia, in sintesi, e qui spoiler pesanti:
[spoiler] Merga, il cattivo del gioco, vuole vendicare il genocidio che gli earth dragon hanno causato contro i water dragon; Aaa, Askal, Corazon Tea e Captain Kalaw lavorano per conto di Merga, per un motivo diverso tra loro (Aaa vuole amici, Askal vuole aiutare Merga per rimediare ai crimini commessi dagli earth dragon, Corazon vuole che Merga risparmi la vita di Carol, e Captain Kalaw vuole essere un vero eroe); Serpentine vuole che Milla tradisca i suoi amici, in quanto essa proviene dallo stesso pianeta di Brevon; e si scopre che Magister è un'earth dragon. [/spoiler]

[h1] Note Dolenti [/h1]

Il gioco ha qualche bug e glitch, e gli sviluppatori sono al corrente di ciò. Tuttavia, un fattore pesante, è il fatto che la modalità classica non è disponibile, fino a che non si completa la modalità avventura. Per molti non è un problema, ma per il resto che preferisce non sorbirsi la storia, è abbastanza significante.

[h1] è tempo di stampare la conclusione [/h1]

In conclusione: Freedom Planet 2 è un buon gioco. Abbastanza solido, ma buono comunque. Consiglio anche il primo gioco, per capire meglio alcuni punti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000370556', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 613, 'playtime_at_review': 2087, 'last_played': 1712430267}
review:
I've waited for this game for 7 years - and it did not disappoint.

This really takes the concept of the original game and ramps it up by a hundred times. With a good mixture of stages ranging from fast-paced ones to more a bit puzzle oriented. The combat also feels more fluid and satisfying compared to the first game, and the Guarding and Revive mechanics are much welcomed additions. The fact that you can change the item loadouts before every stage, and thus alter the difficulty level also makes things more flexible.

The visuals on this game are so beautiful, and there's so many attention of details I like (it's so nice that the game also has a Photo Mode for capturing those moments). That's some of the best looking pixel art I've seen for a while.
The soundtrack is so kickass, that it might even rival the original Freedom Planet at a times. The fans of the original game should recognize some of the familiar beats on some of the tracks. ;)

The Adventure Mode on this game feels much better than on the original game. The pacing has been improved vastly, and it definitely helps that there are Hub areas now, which the original Freedom Planet lacked due of the engine used for it being... not so good.
The Classic Mode is still there (which is unlocked by clearing the game for the first time), but for me it kinda feels more negligible than in the first FP, due of how much improved the Adventure Mode is in this game. But it's still there in case you wanna speedrun through the game or something.

The story feels more serious this time, given that there's been more than one writer this time around. The voice acting also sounds more clearer, although I did notice certain voice clips being more lower in volume, but other than that it's pretty good.
It was also nice to see that the charm from the first game carried over to this, and that there's been certain scenes which just made me smile - and even laugh sometimes. XD

This game also has been pretty stable (for me at least) since Day One. There are some minor bugs, but they don't hamper the whole experience much, and I'm pretty sure they'll be fixed over time - this game already received several patches in just one week.

Overall, this game is a real blast to play - the better sequel I could've ever asked for. Definitely worth the long wait, and just happened to become one of my all-time favorites.

If you'd like to play some fast-paced action platform goodness, then I'll definitely recommend this with a heartbeat. (As long as you don't have a furro phobia or something. XP)

P.S. Lilac is a real bab, you can't change my mind.

This is a SPECIAL GAME!!! Please BUY IT!!! If you like 2D PLATFORMERS with INSANELY FUN ACTION and ENJOYABLE CHARACTERS it'll be RIGHT UP YOUR ALLEY!!! GWAR!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980706643', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1664375819}
review:
A great and proper sequel to expand upon the world and gameplay of the first one.

I played through as Lilac, and the gameplay felt very familiar with improvements. Particularly, the added guard button and the ability to cancel Dragon Boost into an explosion just made my favorite character feel even better.

The later boss fights certainly take the player's new moves into account with more intense attack patterns of their own. With that in mind, I also want to mention that the game offers greatly flexible difficulty settings, ranging from 1-hit death conditions to infinite revives, so that anyone can experience the whole story.

The soundtrack is again [b]full of fantastic music[/b], but unfortunately the boss tunes don't hit anywhere near as good as in the first game. They're either not as exciting or memorable, or they just don't manage to stand out amidst the noise of combat.

The game feels like it has the right amount of ambition, with maybe one notable stumble (a vehicle section of sorts, looked janky but didn't play that badly). They've fleshed things out a lot with increased worldbuilding and there are some stunning set piece moments. I was often impressed and am happy for the devs for nailing this sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024781614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1663839399}
review:
8 Jahre ist es her und nun ist endlich der Nachfolger erschienen. =D
Verglichen zum Vorgänger ist das Spiel ist eine allgemeine Verbesserung in allen Bereichen.
Hier und da gibt es kleinere Probleme wie. z.B. das an wenigen Stellen der Hintergrund vom Level mit dem Vordergrund verschmilzt und man nicht genau weiß ob man dort lang gehen kann. Oder das man Collectables, wie z.B. die Vinyl Platten, für jeden der 4 Charaktere alle einzeln aufsammeln muss. (Für die Achievements reicht aber 1 Charakter aus.)
Aber alles im allem ist das Spiel sehr gelungen und wieder extrem spaßig und sehr zu empfehlen.

review:
Almost 8 years since the original Announcement, and 5 years after the Demo of the first stage...

After all these years, Freedom Planet 2 has released!
It has improved lots of stuff from the first game, specially it's artstyle and OST, wich are pretty!

And most stuff here are much more based on MegaMan Zero instead of the old MegaMan games like on the first game, like the areas you'll enter just to talk with people, and the stages looks more like Sonic 1, but the story is much more based on MegaMan X franchise.

[spoiler] The game ends up with a myster that it may be answered on a 3rd game of the franchise, wish I hope it happens, since this game has more story telling the first one [/spoiler]

Overall, a awesome and incredible game, way much better than the first one!
All the waiting was worth it :>

author: {'steamid': '76561198112844512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1684984892}
review:
Warning: This review contains major spoilers for the story of Freedom Planet 2. If you do not want to be spoiled, please avoid this review until you finish the game. 

Howdy! Player of the original Freedom Planet here. Cracking good game, that. And after getting the sequel, I can conclusively say it's a drastic improvement in a lot of ways. 

+Characters got a lot more moves and rebalanced mechanics
+Soundtrack SLAPS
+Story has a better time balancing the tone
+Voice acting is better. My man Alejandro Saab still shines!
+The art is gorgeous. Which art? Pretty much all of it. Sprites, backgrounds, you name it
+There are a lot of levels.
+Lot more stuff to do, such as the Battlesphere and purchasing items.

And a downgrade in others. Allow me to elaborate:
-A lot of the game makes callbacks to the first game, Freedom Planet 1. It's not detrimental to gameplay at all, but noticeable from even a casual glance during cutscenes and dialogue.
-Difficulty spikes, the level where you [spoiler]first encounter Serpentine in this game[/spoiler] being a particularly bad offender. The enemies take ludicrous amounts of damage on Normal. The game is practically screaming at you to use the new parry/dodge system when this isn't normally the kind of game that has that and its predecessor didn't.
-The levels are longer. That's subjective, but some levels were simply wayyyyy too long. Cripes, one took me upwards of 20 minutes because I just kept getting lost!
-The items you can buy are uninteresting for the most part. Playing as Milla, the life-steal item is practically useless because her hardest hitting attacks are ranged or non-physical.
-The characters are fun, but often are written pretty wonkily. There's also a distinct disconnect between how some characters are described (*cough*Astal*cough*) and how they actually act. The character dialogue is fun but can sometimes fall flat. Milla's dialogue is the biggest offender. I get she's a young girl, but she is older now. She doesn't have to speak like a five-year old all the time now. And now you're saying she's some kind of science genius? Please. I approve her character growth but this dialogue is just way too childish.
-There's a hub now and that's great, but 99% of the NPCs don't offer much of value other than odd chatter. One may call it world building, but there should be some mechanics built in somewhere. Such as side quests or something. There's shops yeah, but you put a "quick shop" option up there to skip walking to the shopkeeper. Also kind of hard to tell who the shopkeepers even are.

-Distinct lack of character growth over the course of this game.

-The Story itself and how the characters act. Wow. Ok, that's really subjective, but let me explain. This game does a lot good in terms of story. Heck it doesn't even commit the cardinal sin of "gameplay and story are segregated". Seriously I absolutely LOVE how Freedom Planet 2 merges story and gameplay. Other characters helping you out in cutscenes? There's a good chance they show up in levels [spoiler] and some boss fights.[/spoiler] All the playable characters have aged several years and are a lot tougher, represented by expanded move pools compared to the first game. All that is awesome. 

This is the biggest critique I have of the game--plot holes and the characters sometimes act or talk like complete morons, and the general disconnect between the background fluff and what happens in game. Massive spoilers ahead. 

[spoiler] One of the earliest examples is Askal's betrayal. First impressions are key, and this guy acts aloof and kind of  a jerk to the player character when you first meet him. You can spar with him and optionally talk to him inside the tavern for some more fluff and it's still more aloof small talk. Askal joins you for one mission and a boss fight (where he doesn't really help, go figure) and then *gasp* he betrays the party! Oh no he was working for the villain this whole time! It's a shocking act of treachery.

Except....not really. Not been given much of a reason to care about Askal. Going by purely story-required material, he acts dismissive of the player character and distant and that's it. Neera Li speaks of Askal like he was everyone's FRIEND and a trusted ally but we're never shown that that was ever the case. We worked with him very sporadically and somehow he's our friend? Sorry, not buying it. When encountered as a boss later at the volcano and defeated, Askal accuses the playable character as being the "bad guys". Mind you, we are at the volcano TO STOP IT FROM ERUPTING AND DESTROYING A MAJOR CITY AND SAVE THE PEOPLE INSIDE IT. Very not bad-guy thing to do. Naturally, the person you are playing as never points this out. Milla sure didn't.

 That Askal is ok with blowing the moon up with Bakugawa until we beat the snot out of him makes it worse. To me, Askal was never a good guy or a good man torn between what he thinks is right and what is right. Waste of a character. And as for Corazon.....

And that's just one of the complaints I have about how the game is written. Don't even get me started on the whole Earth Dragon vs. Water Dragon thing. Make no mistake, I'm genuinely hype for the sequel hook.[/spoiler]

Sorry that got lengthy but felt it had to be said. Overall this game is great and a definite must for anyone who played the first game or wants to play a hearty side-scrolling platformer action game. And at its current price? A steal. An absolute steal. Bless GalaxyTrail for being so generous. I mean it. 

8/10

Edit: Spelled Askal's name wrong and removed unnecessary ranting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389396697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1712185521}
review: Freedom Planet 2 is what I call a fantastic sequel. This game is packed with so much content than its predecessor and that is a good thing I wasn't expecting 24 levels in this entire game. My first play through of the game with Lilac which was really fun and i still enjoy playing as her because she's a faster paced Zero from the Mega man games mixed with Sonic's speed. The graphics look like a polished Sega Saturn game and to me it looks timeless and the boss fights just like the first game were pure adrenaline rush and make you learn their patterns  My flaws with the game would only have to be the later levels being a bit too long taking about 10-15 minutes to complete. All in all Freedom Planet 2 is a really great game and I think more people should support games like these ever since I played the demo back in 2017 it made me excited to see what Galaxy trail was making due to the delays I can't believe the development was all the way back in 2015 and it was worth the wait

author: {'steamid': '76561198041184915', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1667419795}
review:
I have been waiting for this game a long time.

As an enthusiastic fan of platformers, given my gaming career began with Sonic 1, I have played many from various different subgenres in my time - all of the Sonics, more technical/precision based ones like The End is Nigh and Wings of Vi, and then I found a little game named Freedom Planet many years ago... and fell in love.

The first Freedom Planet was easily one of, if not the best platformer I've played. Out of so many. I adored that game, and couldn't wait for a sequel. Now, after many years, avidly looking for news of it, it finally emerged.

Is it a worthy sequel?

I would say that while Freedom Planet 1 felt like a new team finding its feet, Freedom Planet 2 is handled with a lot more confidence - storytelling is more streamlined and well-paced, with no very long cutscenes breaking the pacing, while simultaneously telling a surprisingly good story. It feels much wider in scale than the previous game, and makes you think of aspects to the world of Avalice that are not solely related to the current conflict (in comparison, in the first game, everything was against Brevon).

The music, unfortunately, I must say is not as good as the first - there are some standout tracks (first Dragon Valley is incredible), but overall I'd say they feel a bit more generic than before. The power of the first game was that each stage had separate music tracks, where the first part would establish some musical theme and the second would develop it - things like Aqua Tunnel, Relic Maze, and Jade Creek from the first game were incredibly beautiful and exciting tracks, and I still listen to them on a regular basis.

The game's level structure in the second one no longer has "split acts", and thus the music mostly remains constant throughout - still good to listen to, but I feel that levels generally don't have a distinct theme to them.

Gameplay-wise, it's like a smoother and more varied version of the first game. I've only played as Lilac so far, but the change they made to her Cyclone means she's considerably smoother to play. There was no level that frustrated me or that I felt was unfair, and all of the bosses felt good (even if there are some significant difficulty spikes, but only on really climactic bosses, so I thought this was fine - the first game also had big spikes on key bosses, and I think it elevates the moment). I've seen some people complain about the boss design, but I thought they were all fine on Lilac - the true final boss required me to exploit the invincibility of her Dragon Dash, but again - this is a design feature, and in the previous game using it was also baked into my strategy.

Overall, if you have any interest in platformers whatsoever, you should buy this game without a shadow of a doubt. It's a more mature story, with very likeable characters and fantastic platforming gameplay. The second-to-last boss (as in, non-True ending boss) may be one of the best fights I've seen in a platformer, period.

My only problem with this game is that there will likely be a very long time to wait until the third!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054843357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1709490906}

review:
Solid platformer with amusing dialog and a very large variety of stage mechanics.  This could've been released on the Sega Saturn during its heyday and would've gotten significant praise and high scores all around.

Only caveat is the dialog audio mixing during cutscenes could be improved but it's a minor gripe in an otherwise fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027415982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1702428163}
review:
Freedom Planet 2 is a big improvement over the original game.  Better graphics, more mechanics, more stages, and a new playable character.  Also has a fantastic soundtrack.

The biggest change of them all is adding items and assist options to make the game easier for those who struggle with the game's difficulty, especially the later bosses.  This is certainly easier than the first game but still has some challenging bosses later on so these features allow more casual players to still experience the whole game.

Overall, if you enjoy fast paced platformers then you will almost certainly enjoy this game.

review: Absolutely astoundingly good platformer from start to finish. The music, art, animation, gameplay mechanics and level design are all top notch. This game's predecessor was already one of the best games i'd ever played, and this improves on it so much - and in every possible regard - that it isn't even funny. There is no praise adequate for this absolute masterpiece. Play. Now.

author: {'steamid': '76561199017329378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1664268457}
review:
Giving it a positive review for absolutely no reason other than feeling like a bad ass speeding through the misery.
Tbh, I kind of have a love and hate relationship with this game, I think its a good game and definitely an improvement over FP1 but I changed my opinion drastically and I think FP games for the most part are good but have baffling flaws in terms of difficulty that doesn't come just from skill issues but technical and design issues. Resulting in a far more frustrating experience that demands way too much from you and throw crap at you like its no tomorrow, so for these reasons I can hardly recommend this game for those either unfamiliar with fp1 or simply can't get past the difficulty curve.


That was a similar case with me whose experience initially was, awful to say at least.
But I did play it more and more and that drastically improved.
Games usually become better with the second playthrough, games like megaman and bass are the ones that I usually thought were either meh or awful but with the second and then third playthrough, you get adjust to their design so its fine for the most part for you the experienced player, but for new comers to the game itself it would be a far more unpleasent experience despite having the accessability options which should not be used to cover up poor design choices.
Overall, freedom planet 2 was a frustrating but a good time nonetheless. But it is NOT for everyone and all the criticism this game and the first one get should be valid and not ignored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010288292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1664684384}
review:
This game blows the first game out of the water. It's soooo good! If you liked Freedom Planet 1 or Sonic Mania, you will LOVE this game. It feels like a passion project from the heart and you can tell the developers put their heart and soul into this game.

Buy it! You will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069945022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1674798287}
review: Absolute banger top to bottom! The music, art, story, it's all there! Definitely feels like a step up from the first game, a bit more well rounded across the board. Be warned, though, if you want the full story you'll want to get every time capsule and play every character. That's okay though, because every character is fun to play in their own unique way. And the levels, oh the levels! They're just so beautiful, ESPECIALLY Tidal Gate, probably one of my favorite levels, just... ever... PLAY IT!!

author: {'steamid': '76561199066562619', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1679952814}
review:
Acabo de terminar mi primera partida jugando con Lilac y puedo decir sin ninguna duda que esta secuela ha merecido la espera. No solo el juego tiene el doble de fases que el original sino que hay montones de contenido extra para completar. Me gusta todas las pequeñas mejoras que han hecho como introducir un botón de Guard o poder comprar y equiparte objetos, hace que las fases sean más rejugables.

En cuanto a la dificultad siento que es mejor que Freedom Planet, el cual en ocasiones siento que tenía algunos saltos de dificultad inesperados especialmente en los jefes. Aquí hubo alguna parte que me costó pasarme, especialmente al final, pero no tuve los mismo momentos de frustración que a veces tuve en el original.

Si te gustó Freedom Planet sin duda te gustará su secuela pues es mucho más y mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195424587', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1672596892}

Our protagonist alongside her entourage formed by the Mad Dog of Avalice (Carol Tea), a formarly ex-idol and now scientist (Milla Basset) and the lieutenant of Avalice Metropolitan Police Department (Neera Li) will have to face their biggest threat yet in this new adventure...

author: {'steamid': '76561198389386086', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1663547950}
review: watched every cutscene as a kid back when in 2015, god damn. its been worth the wait. amazing improvement to combat and level design, and the ost's production is a bit higher than before. great job to all of galaxy trail, y'all outdid yourselves again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 3451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1677642289}
review:
Just like the first game, but even more of it. Fast paced gameplay, varied levels, great visuals+music, and a ridiculous amount of content.

The level design is still top-tier, with huge sprawling levels full of fun stage gimmicks. Levels are fun whether you're exploring for gems and secrets, trying to beat the par times, or just trying to survive at all. There's around twice as many levels as the first game but they're substantially shorter, but that's fine since the first game's levels all felt like they should have been split in two.

The returning characters each got a rework to their moveset, for the better. Lilac only got minor additions, but Carol and Milla got substantial reworks which make them much more fun (Milla is a lot more aggressive, Carol has a more interesting special attack which also provides more moevment). There's also a new fourth character, with her own extremely varied moveset.

There's more bosses this time, and more variety to the bosses (lots of 1-on-1 duels with other human-sized characters, in addition to the giant robots with obvious weakpoints). An unfortunate number of them tend to spend most of the fight offscreen in the large arenas, but otherwise their design is quite good. Regular enemy design is good too.

Overall, there's lots to love. If you liked the first game, you'll like the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117429907', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1705771301}

author: {'steamid': '76561198208457084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1664846357}
review:
It's been a long 7 years but it was worth the wait! I love the revamped artstyle, the plethora of stages (haven't even finished it yet and holy crap), and while I can see how the hub areas might be a nuisance for some I personally love exploring them and getting all the little tidbits from NPCs. And hey, if that's not up your alley it's easy and quick enough to go straight to your objective and skip cutscenes if you're really itching to just scoot on through. Rather enjoying the fleshed-out world map as well; since the geography of Avalice was really only suggested in snippets in the first game (from what I remember, at least) it's nice to now see where everything is in relation to each other. And the music, not surprisingly, is wonderful. If the OST is released like the first game I'll be all over it!

Thanks so much to the team for sticking with it over so many years, much love to all.

Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get back to hanging out in Adventure Square vibing with that music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001952461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1712187257}
review: Hecking great time! The gameplay is much better in this one, many actions don't break up momentum when you're trying to blow through levels fast, the characters all play differently and feel there was a lot of time committed to making them play well. Levels are often awesome, think my one complaint [spoiler]came with a mech stage where the layout of the stage looked very bad when zoomed completely out and I had a few walls I couldn't push through.[/spoiler] The returning cast is even better in this game, one of the antagonists chews up the scene whenever they appear! I did like this story more too, even though Merga didn't have the same presence as Brevon (guy was a menace) I did like her. Some of the boss fights were also amazing, over the top, spectacles. Play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099229872', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1691110791}
review:
AMEM lançaram o jogo rsrsrs mas tudo bem pq ele é bonito

aliás, NÃO tive problemas distinguindo o cenário do level que eu tô, então bjs!! e também não entendi como tem gente reclamando de níveis grandes sendo que no primeiro jogo lá pro final tinha fase que demorava 20min lolololol, (e MUITO MAIS se vc se perdesse nelas) mas ok! quanto a se perder nas fases... não sei se é um problema de verdade já que as poucas vezes que me perdi eu conseguia voltar pro caminho original em uns 30~40s, e depois quando fui nos níveis dnv pra tirar S não sofri com esse problema (sim eu falo sobre o fator replay depois)

a música do jogo é muito boa e é cheia de referências de músicas do primeiro jogo e acho k eles implementam elas de um jeito bom (e q faz sentido: um remix de sky batallion toca no mapa de shang tu e no primeiro jogo sky batallion é a fase q te leva pra shang tu, o tema do brevon toca de leve no level com um lixão cheio dos robôs dele, um pedaço do tema da thermal base toca em outra fase relacionada ao brevon etc)-- enfim assim como no primeiro jogo a música é boa.. não passam exatamente a MESMA vibe mas osh, não eh pq é diferente q é ruim -_-

quanto ao combate até agora só joguei com a Milla e não consigo ver motivo pra tentar usar o vortex dela, mas de resto ok
o jogo não é necessariamente fácil então não esperem sair rulando tirando nota alta na primeira jogatina (digo mais nos níveis finais)

vi gente reclamando de ter q ver a história do jogo antes de jogar o modo clássico tbm mas sobre isso não sei exatamente oq dizer..

o jogo tem QUATRO personagens, oq significa q ele espera q vc jogue ele mais de uma vez, tipo, umas 3... e isso eu assumo que COM A ESPERANÇA de q vc leve oq vc aprendeu da ultima gameplay pra próxima

e quanto aos bugs favor arrumar

obviamente essa eh minha experiência com o jogo, se eu não achei uma merda bom pra mim, mas se vc achou ai eh contigo né

author: {'steamid': '76561197972392543', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 9776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 179, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1711939244}
review:
Freedom Planet 2. I mean, it's Freedom Planet, more refined, with better and more interesting stages, full support for 2 more playable characters, and a new item and revive system. Also they found a way to make lives work as an interesting system without them just being this thing you hoard across the game so that's good! The only major flaw I'd say is that the first few story cutscenes are a bit awkward, like they were a rough draft or wasn't fully polished. They had the issue in the first game, and like the first game, it all gets a lot better as the game goes on. The whole thing is an uphill road in terms of quality. Level design, writing, encounters, bosses. 

Heartily recommended! Also an hour of my playtime is just me vibing to the final overworld screens music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094399352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1708192524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118501594', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1683744875}
review:
Here we have the long-awaited sequel to the original Freedom Planet, and all I can say is that they did a damn good job with this game! Everything here feels like an improvement over the first game and I'm glad it turned out to be this good and enjoyable.

Anyone who's looking for an amazing fast-paced action 2D platformer with very smooth gameplay, a banger of a soundtrack, tons of bosses, beautiful pixel art, incredible level design and multiple playable characters (each having their own storyline and moveset) can't go wrong with this game!

I can hardly think of any negative thing to say about this game and I was impressed by the sheer quality it has!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049070279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1665429268}
review:
I remember when Freedom Planet 2 was announced. I was 17, and hyped out of my mind, as I adored the first game.

I am 24 now, and so very glad this game lived up to the hype. An absolutely massive amount of stages, each different and distinct from the last. Tough as nails boss fights that made me tear my hair out in the best way. Better controls and combat. Banger music. Absolutely *gorgeous* pixel art, like goddamn. Really clever callbacks to the first game that show the impacts it had; without indulging in Sonic's brand of "hey, remember this old game? Be nostalgic!" I've only played as Lilac but am so excited to jump back in and do the rest of the girls' campaigns.

The story is a big step up from the first game too. I appreciate how it balances tone better, and how the presentation and voice acting is much improved. Galaxy Trail could've just lightened up on the plot, or made it just goofy and silly, but no. They kept it genuine and sincere, no fear of people screaming about the story being "cringe" for daring to actually tell a story that tries in a mascot platformer. Hell, in order to get the true ending you literally have to collect a bunch of lore time capsules. You can tell the story and hub worlds had a massive influence on the game, and I think you're robbing yourself of the full experience if you don't give the plot a chance at least once.

Also the villain is, I shit you not, basically lesbian water dragon Shadow The Hedgehog, which kinda rules. Shout out to Sabrina DiDuro and all the folks at Galaxy Trail for making such a cool game, can't wait to see what y'all work on next after you give yourselves the biggest vacation; seven years of dev time sounds exhausting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325490451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1694229616}
review:
Gotta say, this impressed me. I feel like every aspect has been expanded on in a positive manner, although the length and story are called into question.
It feels a little longer than I expected but it was very satisfying, I enjoyed it amply and I never encountered any issues.
Combat is engaging, although I don't feel very comfortable with the new dodge move it feels very strange for a platformer but it's something that doesn't feel mandatory at least.
The returning characters all have expanded plots which feels great though the game very visibly has a problem with juggling so many new antagonists. Askal and Kalaw especially. But Serpentine is great, Syntax is great, Merga is great and all the returning characters feel wonderful to play along with the new character Neera Li.

They took a character I very much disliked and made me feel pride when I completed her story. That takes a lot of heart. And I respect that. You should buy it if you like platformers and support galaxytrail for their hard work on all fronts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355564127', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1684422848}
review:
오로지 라일락으로 모든 컨텐츠, 진 최종보스까지 클리어 한 후기
※ 스포일러가 될만한 사항은 가능한 배제하고 작성하였읍니다



장점

1. 전작에 비해 약 3배 이상 늘어난 컨텐츠
> 단순히 스테이지 갯수만 따져도 약 30개 정도로 전작에 비해 월등히 많아졌다
> 진행도에 따라 지금까지 격파한 보스의 구조, 디자인, 세부사항을 보면서 시각적 즐거움을 감상할 수 있는 박물관
> 특수 미션, 보스 재대결, 야구 미니게임 등 다양한 어트랙션을 경험해 볼 수 있는 스타디움
> 단순히 스테이지만 주파하던 전작에 비해서 즐길거리의 폭이 넓어졌다

2. 고전 2D 플랫포머를 기반으로 한 스테이지 기믹
> 소닉 더 헤지혹 시리즈에서 대표적으로 볼 수 있는 루프 기믹부터 클래식 소닉 팬이라면 '아, 이거!' 할만한 요소가 엄청 많다
> 또한, 소닉 더 헤지혹에서 볼 수 있었던 기믹 말고도 고전 2D 플랫포머라면 충분히 나올만한 요소는 알차게, 스테이지마다 테마에 알맞게 적재적소에 배치해 놓은 것이 보인다
> 그 악명 높은 '원통' 같은건 안 나오니 안심하세요

3. 수려한 도트 그래픽, UI와 그에 맞는 환상적인 BGM
> 배경, 플랫폼, 월드맵의 그래픽이 따로 놀지 않을 정도로 통일되어 있으면서 스테이지마다 고유의 분위기를 잘 살렸다
> 전작의 UI는 다소 난잡한 모습이었으나 이걸 완전히 갈아엎고 정말 깔끔하고, 중요한 사항은 명확하게 디자인 했다
> 개개인마다 평가는 다르겠지만 어느 하나 모날 정도로 수준 낮은 BGM은 없었던 것 같다



단점

1. 엔딩을 보기까지 거쳐야 할 난관이 많음
> 노멀 모드로 플레이 했으나 수십 번 재시도를 해야할 정도로 보스전이 어렵다
> 짜증나고, '무서울' 정도로 어렵다

2. 지원하는 언어가 영어만 존재
> 스토리의 범위가 넓어짐에 따라 한국인 입장에서는 어렵고 난해한 문장이 많아 스토리를 제대로 이해하기 힘들 수도 있다
> 추후 업데이트를 통해 지원 언어가 넓어졌으면 하는 바램이 있다

3. 전작에 비해 민감해진 피격 판정, 일부 스테이지의 구조가 복잡해 짜증을 유발할 수도 있음
> 플레이어블 캐릭터가 2등신에서 3등신으로 커짐에 따라 피격이 인정되는 범위가 넓어졌다
> 스테이지 중에서 물량 공세와 함께 일직선이 아닌 광활한 장소에서 길을 헤매게 되는 스테이지가 있어 애를 먹은 기억이 있다

4. 자잘한 버그
> 루프 기믹에서 캐릭터의 행동이 멈춰진다거나, 스테이지 클리어 후 맵의 경계를 벗어나 사망하게 되는 구간 등의 버그가 있다
> 심하게는 특정 인물과 대화했을 때 어떤 선택지를 고르면 게임 진행이 되지 않아 재시작해야 하는 버그도 겪었다



알아두면 유용한 사항

1. 포션은 소모품으로 착각하기 쉽지만 그렇지 않고, 포션마다 위 아래 키로 최대 5칸까지 넣을 분량을 조절할 수 있다
> 본인은 이 시스템을 모르고 있다가 진 최종보스를 클리어 하기 직전에 알게 되었다

2. S 랭크를 쉽게 받고자 한다면 No Revival(부활 없음) + Time Limit(시간 제한) 아이템을 장착하자
> 어떤 아이템 없이, 단 한 번이라도 대미지를 입게 되면 S 랭크를 달성할 수 없다
> 적당히 피해를 감수하며 빠르게, S 랭크로 클리어 하고 싶으면 위 조합을 사용하자
> No Revival(부활 없음) 대신 One Hit KO(일격 사망) 아이템을 넣는다면 S 랭크가 무지갯빛이 된다

3. 나타났다 사라지는 블럭에 주인공 4인방을 가둬두고 상상의 나래를 펼쳐보자
> tag:stuck_in_block



7년이면 게임 하나 엎어지고 사람들에게서 잊혀질 만도 한데 그 노고에 감탄했습니다
정말 갓겜입니다

author: {'steamid': '76561198144689031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1712251557}
review:
The original 'Freedom Planet' was always going to be a hard act to follow, but 'Freedom Planet 2' somehow manages it. The controls are tight, with an interesting and diverse move-set for each of the four playable characters. Thoughtful level design makes for a varied gameplay experience that never loses its lustre - and with the sheer size of this game, that is quite an achievement. The difficulty curve is a little smoother this time around, simply owing to that increased scope - later levels present a suitable challenge. At two junctions, the player is provided with multiple branching pathways to choose between, determining which levels they will tackle next. While all paths must be explored in time, this does help provide a visible structure to the game; meanwhile, the inclusion of an arena area with a wide selection of challenges ensures that the player is not bound to a single path of progression for most of the game's runtime. While many of the game's (over thirty!) boss encounters refuse to pull their punches, I never found myself stuck on any one boss for too long - echoing the first game, they remain a real highlight of 'Freedom Planet 2', providing a number of jaw-dropping moments of paired spectacle and peril.

The story has the same cosy nineties Saturday morning kids' TV vibe that the first game nailed, complete with the shockingly dark elements that characterised many examples of that genre. The hub areas are a sensible choice to help dispense with the long cut-scenes of the first game - here, players can more easily choose how much of the story they engage with. Some of these hub areas feel underutilised - while some offer secrets and mini-games, others are little more than vehicles for dialogue. The voice acting is, on the whole, enjoyable to listen to - it is clear that the cast are having a lot of fun with their roles. The dialogue is somewhat uneven, occasionally lapsing into clunky pop-culture references that suggest a lack of confidence in the franchise's own charms - at its best, however, it by turns warmly humorous, engagingly dramatic, and genuinely affecting. It is a pity that the tension only really starts to build towards the end of the first half of the game - the story might have benefited from a few more early hooks.

This is a beautiful game - it is often tempting to pause just to admire the backdrop of a stage, or to appreciate the fluidity of characters' idle animations. While all character sprites receive a greater level of detail this time around, some have changed significantly - Lilac in particular has received a notable makeover, and while others have debated the relative merits of her old and new sprites, I did not find that such changes distracted from gameplay. Perhaps the most impressive graphical assets belong to the game's bosses, each of which is intricately created out of sets of moving parts that are fittingly displayed in a gallery in one of the hub areas. Sound design greatly enhances the game's aesthetic pleasures - well-chosen crashes, splashes, buzzes and booms help make each level feel more concrete. The soundtrack is huge and wide-ranging, although its forays between disparate musical genres never lose it its coherence. You'll encounter several remixes of tracks from the first game, each of which manages to innovate and build upon its parent track; meanwhile, there is a lot to like among the wholly new musical content - I look forward to listening to the soundtrack a decent amount in the coming weeks.

Overall, 'Freedom Planet 2' stands as an impressive achievement, a sequel that outshines its rightly celebrated predecessor. While occasionally frustrating, it is perpetually enjoyable, with strong replay value and deft game design that leaves it practically unmatched among high-speed platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042643953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1669782927}
review:
It may have taken seven years since this game was announced, but the payoff's pretty damn great.
It's a lot of what a sequel should be, bigger and bolder.

Featuring a new playable character, larger skill set for all cast members, more stages, a good chunk of side content.
Rankings, par times, accessories, potions, tons of good additions.

Only major complaints I have is that the physics are still kind of jank, best way I can describe it is unnecessarily sticky and could benefit from a bigger focus on momentum, but what we have isn't bad, shame the rail sections ain't faster though.
Bosses aswell have some camera issues I find, they're fun but some of them could really benefit from having the camera zoomed out way more.

Besides that, it is just a joy to go as fast as possible, finding new ways to cut off seconds and get better and better at mastering each stage, it's exactly why I loved the original and why I loved this game.

Really hoping we get DLC or a third entry.
Game's great, well worth your money, easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205755563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1663714422}
review:
Just finished my first playthrough (Milla!), and, stones, that was tough. Maybe because I'm a fool who didn't use items until the final boss, but anyway!

Freedom Planet 2 is an excellent sequel, building on what the first game did well while at the same time making the series into much more its own thing. It definitely needs some polishing here and there, as I ran into a few bugs, but that's mostly detail work.
Waited years for the game's release, and it did not disappoint. Very creative level designs, tough and engaging bosses, and after completing just the first few levels I was already wanting to buy the soundtrack. Gorgeous stuff.

10/10 Would Recommend

review: A fantastic sequel to one of my favorite games. It's even taken my top spot as my favorite game on Steam at this point. author: {'steamid': '76561198028326815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1700170409}
review:
I haven't beaten the game yet, but feel the need to leave something after getting halfway through the game, since I already know what lies ahead of me. I'm a huge fan of the original Freedom Planet, I might not have a ton of hours logged into it on Steam, but on Switch I've played it more. I truly believe this was worth the wait, granted the wait was agonizing, I can't remember the last time I waited almost 10 years for a game and walked away satisfied after playing it. It is clear that there was effort here to make Freedom Planet something other than a Sonic homage; in fact I learned the hard way that you shouldn't be rushing through these stages, take your time and explore. 

What I truly think gives this game replay value is the stage gimmicks, I say gimmicks in the best way possible since most levels bring some platforming twist to the table, I won't spoil them, but it is satisfying to memorize a level layout and flawlessly reach the end of the stage. Lives are contained to their level and acquiring an extra life isn't as easy like the first game, lives only exist so you can chase those perfect rankings.

In the original game if you timed your dragon boost, you could cheese the game; I'm happy to say those moments aren't in this game as much, bosses screen filling attack patterns punishes reckless play. I know I might be made fun of for saying this, I find some of these bosses harder than Hollow Knight's Galaxy Trail really went above and beyond with the challenging boss fights. 

If there are some negatives I can list, I'm adjusting to navigating the map, I would have preferred a linear point A to point B like the original; but then you wouldn't see these amazing hub worlds that are do detailed I end up hanging out in them anyways( preference I guess). I find healing items a little unnecessary, I believe you should fail to master the game; I welcome the items that handicap the player for extra bonus points. 

Lastly the pixel work is breathtaking, I would say the 8 year development cycle has paid off. I've been tired of indie pixel games for a long time, I can make an exception in this case since this might be the best sprite work I've seen in a side scroller; it really shows the jump from the original game which used multimedia fusion and this game uses Unity. What really impresses me more than character animations are the background HD sprites, it truly feels like Avalice is a living breathing world. 

I'm currently on my default Lilac run, I'm itching to get to Milla since she is my favorite character and it looks like she's received the most improvements as a fighter.

I would highly recommend this game, it is currently in my game of the year list alongside Bayonetta 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045707731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1701395449}
review: Finalmente ha salido después de 7 largos años. Freedom Planet 2 es la secuela del primer Freedom Planet, para aquellos que no la conocen, es un plataformero que combina velocidad y beat em up. Puedes manejar a tres protagonistas mujeres que tienen diferentes habilidades (Lilac, Carol y Milla) más un nuevo agregado para esta secuela que sería Neera, que a su vez también varian los niveles que vas jugando con ellas y el modo historia también. Esta secuela ofrece una historia más larga que la anterior con recorridos que te harán jugar los niveles varias veces. También tienes la posibilidad de comprar ítems para darle una mejor performance a tu jugada. Además de una galería bastante extensa para completar que te hará rejugarlo varias veces. Tiene gráficos en pixel art estilo retro, con animaciones bastante fluidas, diseños del artista Tyson Tan (también promotor del software de pintura libre Krita) y una actuación de voces bastante buena. En mi opinión personal siento que la música me gustó más en el anterior, y algunos enemigos son bastante adorables cuando se suponen que deberían ser intimidantes (nota Tyson Tan es uno de mis artistas favoritos asi que no lo culpo por esto, solo mi perspectiva personal en la estética), al conectar el joystick se juega bien, pero requiere un poco configurarlo porque el menú pausa lo manejo desde el teclado y el botón saltar está hacia un costado en vez de ser el botón de abajo, pero es totalmente configurable y solo una preferencia mía. Otra desventaja que tiene es que de momentos no está disponible en español, pero supongo que pagar traductores ahora mismo alargaría los costos del juego. Déjalo en pantalla completa porque a modo ventana tiene un glitch donde cambia de tamaño seguido. En resumen es una digna secuela del anterior que vale la pena seas fan o no del título. Y me pone muy feliz que por fin lo podamos jugar, el cariño y dedicación al juego se nota en cada parte de este mismo.
