author: {'steamid': '76561197969378273', 'num_games_owned': 4890, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1663691444}
review:
If Freedom Planet was the game to answer 'What If Treasure made a Sonic competitor?', then Freedom Planet 2 asks 'And what would the Sega Saturn sequel be like?'.

The answer is 'very good' by the way. Surprisingly beefy, replayable and with lots of granular difficulty options. The writing is tighter, the levels are bigger, the bosses just have way too many sprite segments and the artists are just showing off.

Good stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071684560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1693453995}
review: The wait seemed so long but was well worth it. One campaign feels as long as the entirety of fp1. The graphical upgrade is like going from 16bit to 32bit. Encountered like 2 bugs but nothing serious. So glad I took a day of vacation to play this as soon as it released. The ost is an absolute banger. But need to listen to it more before I'd say how it compares to fp1. Can't wait to play more after the slog that is work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006904748', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1663713663}
review:
An awesome sequel with great improvements all around! Highly recommended buy to fans of action platformers.

Compared to the sequel it has a ton of new features, modes and content. There are many challenges and the achievements are really fun to complete. The engine is different from the original and thus more robust and stable, I had only very minor technical issues with setting my controller and nearly getting stuck in an area but these are easy fixes and to be expected from a project of this size on release day. I had no major technical or gameplay related issues otherwise which is a lot more than you can say from some AAA titles.

There is a ton of character variety and replayability, tons of music that all sounds great. The artwork is beatiful and if it interests you there's many cutscenes and hubworlds with NPC's that are almost entirely voice acted. If that's not your thing it can be skipped more or less in its entirety.

I'm singing the game's praises here because it's really just that good and I think there's something here to enjoy for everyone as long as they enjoy platformers at least. The game also has a very good difficulty curve but if you find it too hard there are items you can use and game settings you can enable.

If I had to give it a score I'd give it a 9/10 so far. It's engaging, challenging and just plain fun. Definitely a must-buy from me.

EDIT: I have now finished the game and it definitely changed character in the end-game. The quality of the level design fell sharply after the first 2/3rds of the levels and even with 7 years of work the later levels feel like they are padded and they lose their sense of direction in a few places. The first game had much better end game both in design and story and the last boss left me feeling quite unfulfilled. The game as a whole is still a definite recommend from me and there are plenty of great parts to enjoy in the mix but I'd probably drop my score to a 7/10.

The voice acting is great, the jokes are funny, gameplay is smooth as butter, music is godtier, bosses so far are fun to fight and each stages gimmicks have been fun to mess with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020569126', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 10908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1712255462}
review: Probably one of the best action platformer titles I've ever played. Pretty hefty amount of content with lots of memorable bosses, locations, NPCs, and lore. Every single level has at least one thing unique to it that makes it stand out, and there are some moments and mechanics in the game that I've never seen done in any other game ever. I had an awesome time with this playing through as just Carol so far, and I'm looking forward to returning to get all of the achievements in the coming days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170413821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1664262601}
review: just finished lilac's story. let me get the good things out of the way first. this game is great. probably the best 2d platformer mechanically speaking i have ever played. the massive levels, coupled with the great physics, and updated combat is just great all around. as for the bad however....this game for having 7 years of development looks like its held together with we paper. i had more than a few instances of getting stuck in the floor, and having to restart a section. also had quite a few softlocks from just doing nothing. at times i would talk to an npc and then everything would stop working. also the game looked like it was falling apart by the last few levels, with every death or reset melting the screen together (tho this did make the last level add to the horror element. nothing makes everything look more grim with a what looks like blood covered lilac sitting at the bottom corner of the screen) the last negative is the story. first off, retcons. while not bad to have them, it feels really off playing the first game having dragons be pretty generalized and then everyone stars calling lilac a water dragon. speaking of, the world itself feels like its playing tug of war as to what it wants to be, one hand people think water dragons dont exist any more and are savages, on the other, nobody bats an eye at lilac and calls her a water dragon. actually character development is another. huge missed opportunity at the games mid point where def not vegita has a philosophical talk with lilac, i first saw this and thought, oh cool we are going to have a thought provoking plot line, where lilac will see other paths, reflect on herself, and grow. but no we get none of that. actually every fight she gets into that is very gray to say the least, she just gets proven right, and thats just not good writing at all, and it hurts to see. last thing to mention about the story is that the entire end of the game feels super rushed and slapped together, and even the game's final boss feels very anti-climatic, and the end just leaves us with a few too many questions as to say "wtf did i just play" but despite all the shortcomings the game has right now (which is mostly the story, the rest can be patched out) i still think this game is great, and it was worth the 7 year wait

author: {'steamid': '76561198183450495', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 153, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1711701542}
review: Freedom Planet 2 is a game I’m going to struggle scoring. This game is absolutely incredible, it’s simply put one of the best platformers I’ve ever played and a crowning achievement for the genre. Every single step in this game had my jaw dropping from shock and excitement. Every single level stepped up from the last. Every single boss was more challenging and engaging than the previous. Every single song caught my ears more. This game is an absolute masterclass in pacing and design. It’s story is fun and memorable, with much better scripting and acting that Freedom Planet 1. The game is simple the best Pixel based visual style I’ve every seen, and I’m not sure it’s close. Everyone who worked on this game should be absolutely applauded, as this game is something much more than the sequel to a game I love from 8 years ago. If you were even ever considering it, please play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112163800', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1696516465}
review:
Looking back at it I don't like a lot of how this game is designed,
but I seem to be the only one with this opinion. Would recommend it if you liked the first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057410442', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1663808170}
review:
An improvement on the first game in basically every way. Gameplay is tighter, story is more gripping, graphics are absolutely gorgeous, and all the characters have unique movesets that make them feel more distinct than they did in the first game.

I'd absolutely reccommend it, and the story actually had me on the edge of my seat in some moments, which is a far cry from the basic story of the first game. There were a couple weird bugs at launch, primarily in regards to how fast the game updated at framerates higher than 60, but those have all been ironed out by now (Nobody needs to fight launch day Turbo Askal)

You don't even really need to play the first game to play this one. While it certainly helps, the game's story stands out on its own enough and the first game's story wasn't really that memorable anyways.

also, spoilery joke, don't look at this until after you've beat the game
[spoiler]Merga did nothing wrong.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068661196', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1663818803}
review:
Freedom Planet 2 is quite a beautiful and content-rich successor. It features astonishing BGMs and exciting stages with pretty details that make everything feel a lot more alive while also adding interesting mechanics to the gameplay. Stages such as Zulon Jungle, Zao Land, Phoenix Highway, Shenlin Park, Sky Bridge, and Globe Opera are outstanding and creative. 

On the other hand, I couldn't appreciate the red stages quite as much. They felt like shallow and repetitive boss fights that require the player to wait too long for an opportunity to attack rather than give their best. Even more if you're playing on Expert and looking for an S rank as Lilac, whose move set isn't as compelling as other character's. What's worse is a part of the game has quite the streak of red stages and cutscenes that would be a pain to watch were it not for the quality voice acting. 

Don't miss out on this if you're a fan of the genre, but expect to get dragged into dull fights and rides as you approach the lategame and the game decides to go longer than neccessary. I'd rather have a slightly shorter campaign to play and collect everything once as each character than having such an extensive one I don't feel like going through a second time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097279922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1700216209}
review:
|I really want to play this game
|All the things I've seen for it, and my own experiences from the first game...
|
|But no matter what I do, the game's audio refuses to play...
|Not the only game that's like this... but I'm absolutely unable to identify the cause.

Scratch all of the above (Windows 10 did a small oof, or maybe just my computer), I've since gone through and S ranked almost every mission, the only exceptions being the true final boss and its re-fight.

I've never had a game get my adrenaline going so hard that I had to step away twice on the same level, really brought out my warrior's spirit.

This game took seven years to come out, and even if it isn't perfect, it's everything I wanted out of a sequel and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124008258', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1694230533}
review: It's been 7 years in the making, and it was all worth it. The levels are well paced and designed, the environments are beautiful, the music is really good, the characters are adorable and so fleshed out. This is the perfect sequel from sonic fangame to its own series. A fully voice acted story with world lore and amazing combat and fast paced gameplay. This isn't your typical sonic platformer, its better.

review: Freedom Planet 2 is finally here!!! i loved the first game and to no surprise im loving the second game. FP2 takes everything that made FP1 fun and polishes it to make it even better. more fluid gameplay, betterish story (more on that later) and the character redesigns look super good! the music is also very good as well! just like FP1 though the story really isnt that good. FP1 had such an awful story with meh voice acting that when i would replay the game i'd play it in classic mode so i wouldnt have to deal with the story. with FP2 while it's not unbearable and def has some improvements...the story still isnt all that great and the voiceacting still has some rough spots. overall a good game and worth the price imo

author: {'steamid': '76561198080367082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1704573490}
review: Wow, pasó tanto tiempo que no sé por donde empezar. El primer Freedom Planet me hizo un fanático de los juegos indies y es mi juego indie favorito hasta ahora. La verdad jamás creí estar vivo para ver la continuación luego de tanto tiempo y tantos cambios. Cambio de casa, de pareja (de sexualidad tambien!) una pandemia, una nueva guerra. Tantas cosas pasaron y sin embargo, acá estoy el primer día de la salida del primero. Gracias chicos por darnos tan hermosos juegos!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986902911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1712431584}
review:
Probably one of my favourite platformers of all time. Great gameplay, story, and music. Definitely worth picking up if you're looking for something new to play.

I can describe the gameplay best as a mix of Sonic, Rocket Knight/Sparkster, and Gunstar Heroes, but improves on all of them significantly. The movement and combat is fluid, and unlike Sonic where you take damage on enemy contact (which slows the pace to a crawl if you're trying to avoid damage) enemies have to land various telegraphed attacks, giving you an opportunity to dodge, parry, or attack, making it feel a lot faster paced/less stop-and-go.

The game features multiple characters with their own mechanics, attack combos, and movement physics, which adds replayability to the game and depth to the combat and platforming. Some of the speed-running strategies people have come up with for this game using the different characters are honestly quite insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840894087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1691778904}
review:
Alright, i haven't completed yet, but there are two bugs i'd like to report, i take it that this is not the best place for this specially with a positive review but anyway, here goes.

One bug is that the dragon boost breaker, you know, the attack that happens if you press the C button before the Dragon Boost ends, that attack freezes the game for a few seconds on the first time you do it for every launch

The other bug i'd like to address is the performance drop in levels that are affected by lightning, basically levels that have "darkness" in them make the game run with less fps for me.

Anyway that's basically it for me, I'm enjoying the game greatly so far, i intend to write a proper review later on addressing other criticisms i have, but don't worry much, the pros outweight any of the cons by a mile, if you enjoyed the first game you very likely enjoy this one too

author: {'steamid': '76561198073899785', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1669493370}
review:
Freedom Planet 2. Mi experiencia con este juegazo aun no esta completa...Pero 7 años de desarrollo para ver una obra maestra valio cada minuto. Lo mejor de todo es que es barato a comparacion de otros juegos, y aqui en Argentina compensa mucho su precio. El juego cambia en absolutamente todo a diferencia de la primer entrega...Soy muy fan de Galaxytrail...y la espera por este juego lo valio un monton...Gracias Galaxytrail por no ponerlo a 1000$ars o mas para que los paises con mala economia y gobiernos puedan jugar esta obra maestra... Como me aburri de los AAA y los Sonic Elegi esta franquicia... Muy buen juego, Buena banda Sonora y Muy Buena historia (hasta ahora...porque no me lo termine aun xd). Una cosa que me fascino de este juego es que tiene mas caracteristicas que el original y que lo diferencian bastante con Sonic como la guardia y lo diferentes combos para ataques. Muy recomendado si quieres liberarte de los AAA y los Sonic ademas de darle una oportunidad a los indies. 10/10
Tened Un buen Dia y Buen gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039778613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1663109769}
review:
I'm not far into this game yet, and I do intend on continuing playing. But early impressions of this game haven't been great for me. The new pixel art is incredibly gorgeous and detailed... Unfortunately to the point where it's actually hard to see what's going on while playing. I've noticed far more bugs in the first 3 stages than I have in the entirety of the first Freedom Planet, frequently clipping through terrain and objects, weird audio quality drops in VO, and on the very first boss somehow triggering a bug that made me invulnerable after I was supposed to die. Most of these can be fixed with a patch, though the cognitive overload of the pixel art may be difficult to patch. The thing that I think can't be patched though? I'm just overall having way less fun with this game than I did with FP1. The level design and combat just *feels* off to me. Combat doesn't connect and have that same crunch that it had in FP1. The levels feel far more convoluted and frustrating to navigate than the first game; I find myself getting lost far more frequently than FP1. As a once or twice thing I'd say that's more on me, but this was a constant struggle for me in the first 3 levels I played.

I really REALLY want to like this game and I'm going to continue playing it in hopes that maybe I'm being just a little too harsh with my first impressions. But I hope by leaving this review the devs can make some adjustments to the game to live up to the first game's greatness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012256767', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 70, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1712381008}
review:
[h1] 더 다양해진 이동*가속 바리에이션과 기믹, 개선된 그래픽 [/h1]
[h1] 풍부하고 재밌는 스토리. 전작의 문제점도 다수 개선되었다. [/h1]

[h1] 퍼리 팬덤이면 사라. 「모든 로망」이 들어있다.  [/h1]
[h1] 그야말로 "퍼-리덤 플래닛" [/h1] 



전작인 프리덤 플래닛 1 이후 7~8년(?)정도가  개발에 소요된 후속작.

가속의 메커니즘은 전작과 똑같되, 좀더 유연하게 이동방향을 바꿔 가속을 잃지 않도록 다양한 바리에이션이 추가되었다. (특히 캐롤 특수기 활용이 굉장히 유연함.)

어느정도 게임 이해도가 있으면 엄청난 가속을 게임 내내 유지할 수 있고,  처음해보는 유저도 가속을 느낄 수 있는 구간이 다수 존재한다.

보스전도 적당히 타격하기 어려우면서, 광역패턴이 있어 방어기를 적절히 섞어 써야하는데, 이것대로 나름 재미가 쏠쏠하다.

초회차 플레이시, 몇몇 보스가 너무 과하게 어렵다 느낄 수 있으나, 모두 파훼법은 있으니 천천히 해보길 바란다.

이번작 보스전은 실력이 고이면 고일수록 재밌다. 배틀스피어에서도 보스전 따로 연습 플레이 가능하니 참고하길바란다.


그래픽은 전작에서 대폭 개선되었고, krita의 마스코트 아티스트인 tyson tan좌도 참여해서 아름답고 수상한 캐릭터들이 매력적이다. 

기본적으로 픽셀그래픽도 상급으로 꽤 디테일하면서도 수려하고 밋밋하지 않게 색감을 잘 주었다.

보스 디자인은 주로 적당히 뽕차는 동물- 메카닉 느낌이니  취향에 잘 맞을 수 있다.

보스들의 액션도 벽타기, 레일타기 등 연출적으로 다양하니 보는 맛이 더 즐겁다.

심지어는 너무나도 쌈마이한 3단 합체변신 동물롸벗까지 나오는데, 디듀로는 진짜 신이다..

각 맵 디자인도 비주얼 면이나, 각종 다양한 기믹이 있어서 지루한 틈이 없다.

맵의 볼륨도 대략 20개정도 넘어간다. (거의 30개에 육박한다.)



음향적인 부분도 전작에서 담당했던 woofle이 한 것으로 알고 보증은 확실한 듯. 

전작 음향이 빵빵 불려주는 요란스런 일렉트로 느낌이었다면, 이번에는 테마에 맞춰 좀 더 리드미컬하게 맞춘 느낌인데, 다소 밋밋하게 들릴 수 있으나  충분히 좋다.

개인적으로는 닌텐도 게임 음향 느낌 들었었음.



스토리는 전작에서 부족했던 컷씬, 서사를 다량 추가했는데, 전작에서 넣지 못해 부족했던 캐릭터성이 대폭 보충되어 개꿀잼이다.

겉멋충, 빡대가리 듀오, 변신로봇 로망충 별의별 놈들이 다나와서 그야말로 세상은 요지경.

플레이어블에 진지충 캐릭이 있긴한데, 별의별 웃긴 캐릭터가 다 나와서 오히려 케미가 또 좋다.

더빙은 전작과 마찬가지로 마을맵 상호작용을 제외하고는 전부 풀더빙인데, 3년후 배경일지라도 전작의 앳된  보이스액팅으로 전개되니 이부분은 호불호가 갈릴 수 있다. 

개인적으론 아이들 우당탕탕 대소동 느낌에 세상은 요지경 스토리가 잘 맞는 느낌이라 호였음.

※박물관 맵에서 개발자 말에 따르면 본래 스페이드도 플레이어블 예정이었던 듯 한데, 
   '또' 스케줄을 맞추다보니 취소된듯 해서 아쉽다. 박물관에 모션 데이터가 있으니 참고.




개인적으로 특히 맘에 드는 부분은 전작에서 제기된 문제점들이 개선된점.

부족한 튜토리얼, 아쉬운 그래픽과 보스디자인, 스토리가 본게임 템포를 막는 점을 개선한 점이다.

튜토리얼은 본편 시작전 선택해서 직접 조작해볼 수 있고, 

스토리는 본편이 끝난 이후, 혹은 스토리 진입 전 허브에서 짧게 더빙과 함께 틀어준다. 

인게임 상에서도 건볼트의 라이브 노벨의 느낌처럼 틀어주는데, 여러 게임을 잘 참고했다.




[strike] 단점은 아직 출시된지 하루된 게임이라 그런지, 최적화가 부족한 모습이 보인다. 캐릭터가 많은 허브에서는 프레임 드랍이 간헐적으로 자주 느껴진다. [/strike]
※최적화 문제가 개선되었는지, 이제 허브 맵에서 렉 안걸림.




플레이타임은  순수 게임시간 3시간 30분,   스토리 포함 총 게임시간 10시간이 걸렸는데.

이는 내(숙련자) 기준이고, 초심자면 순수 게임시간 5~6시간 혹은 그 이상이 걸릴 수 있다.

서로 완전히 다른 특징의 캐릭터도 4명인 점을 감안하면,,

모두 플레이 할 경우 순수게임 시간은 20시간 이상 소요될 수 있다.





소닉, 건볼트, 록맨류 게임 팬, 스피드런을 매우 좋아하는 사람이라면 초갓겜이니 강력 추천.

최상급 조작감과 물리엔진의 가속&관성에, 재밌는 스토리, 아름다운 픽셀그래픽, 리드미컬한 음향에, 풀더빙 + 고봉밥 분량까지. 

30000원 안부른 현재값도 엄청난 혜자다.   솔직히 30000원 주고 사도 안아까움. 

수년동안 농땡이 친게 아니라 정말 마음을 담아서 개발한게 느껴지는 게임.

클래식 소닉의 명맥이 거의 끊기고,  록맨류의 정신적 후속작도 거의 나사 하나 빠진 개떡으로

나오는 현시점에서 정말 어떻게 이렇게 나온건가 싶을정도의 소닉류 명작 게임이다.

괜히 클래식 소닉 개발자들이 보고 배워가야할 게임이라고 말하는게 아니다.
(클래식 소닉은 이미 소닉 매니아에서 거의 끝났다고 본다만 말이다..)





[h2] +)가속 메커니즘 정보 추가  +  장비 및 아이템 설명 [/h2]

공통 - 전작에서 점프하면서 완만한 벽모서리 닿으면 천장 붙기 + 이동 가능했는데, 
           일부 지형 한정으로 막힌듯합니다.

캐롤 - 1. 이동 中 점프 다운킥 연속 사용시, 가속 있습니다. 
               (이 덕분인지 전작보다 바이크 의존도가 많이 낮아서 좋습니다.)
          2. 이동 中 점프 업킥 연속 사용시, 호버링 같이 떠서 좀 더 공중에 있을 수 있습니다.
          3. 가속에 공격속도가 비례합니다.  기본딜 약한대신, 딜레이가 짧아 방어사용이 매우 유연합니다.


라일락 - 1. 전작 대비 큰 변화 없음.  
              (내리막 경사면에서 점프 다운킥시, 있던 최대 가속이 너프된 감이 다소 있습니다.)
                 ※Tip.   점프+(↓+점프[사이클론]) 쓰고,  직후 다운킥 하면 내리막 최대 가속이 좀 더 쉬워집니다.
              2. 특수기 취소 직후, 스페이스바를 누르고 있으면 바로 방어대쉬 가능함 
                   (모자란 거리를 채워줘서 드래곤부스트 의존도를 다소 줄여주는 감이 있습니다.)
                   (특수기 취소시, 생기는 잔상에 있는 딜을 보스전에 자주 이용하도록 합시다.)
              3. 점프+다운킥 中 공격키 연타시, 좀 더 연타 딜링 가능합니다. 올려치기를 함께 사용합시다.


밀라 - 1. 전작과 대비해 큰 변화는 없음. 
              (아래 대각선으로 슈퍼실드버스트를 쏘아 반동가속을 했던 전작과 약간 다릅니다.)
              (수평방향, 내리막일시 위방향, 점프필요시 아래방향으로 유연한 가속이 가능합니다.)  
              (수평방향 반동 가속시, 점프가 너무 낮거나 너무 빨리쓰면 가속이 안되고 위로 붕뜹니다. 약간 높이 있게 뜁시다.)
              (전작과 마찬가지로, 평지면 밀라가 최대가속 도달이 가장 빠릅니다.)
           2. 니라와 같이 공격중, 유연한 방어사용이 어렵습니다. 실드를 자주 사용합시다.
           3. 제자리에서 근접공격 연타 + 방어 직후 슈퍼실드 버스트를 통한 딜링도 가능합니다.
 

니라 - 1. 스페이스바 특수기 + 점프 2단공격시, 가속이 가능합니다.  (그 외 가속법 없음....)
               (캐릭터 자체가 파워형 캐릭터인 영향이 큰 듯 합니다.)
           2. 스페이스바 특수기 사용 中 게이지가 조금이라도 남은 경우, 
                ↑ +C,   ↓ +C ,   C 특수기 사용 가능합니다.
                 스페이스바 특수기 中 적 공격시, 게이지가 조금 회복됩니다.
                가속 뽕 전부 뽑은 다음 ,  ↑ +C로 모자란 점프력 보충 가능합니다.
                 C를 잘 이용하면 어려운 퍼즐구간에서의 꼼수가 가능합니다.
                 C는 일부 소형 보스 또한 얼릴 수 있습니다만,  보스에 따라 지속시간이 짧습니다.
                  ↓ +C는 주로 딜링보다는 점프력 부족 구간에서 쓰입니다.
           3. 기본공격 후딜이 매우 깁니다!!!!  캐롤, 라일락과 달리, 유연한 방어 사용 불가능함.
                기본 딜이 쌔지만, 정확한 딜링 타이밍을 노리는 플레이가 요구됩니다.
           4. 점프+올려치기 타격 시, 공중에 더 오래 있을 수 있으며, 추가 타격 가능합니다.
                공중 보스, 공중 몹 잡을 때 사용합시다. 공중전에서 내려찍기 효율이 안좋습니다.


+)아이템 관련
 1. 포션 - 소모품 아닙니다!!!! 이름만 포션이고 영구 사용 가능한 장비입니다!!! 꼭 사세요!!! 
                포션 최대 5가지를 조합해 캐릭터 기본 능력치 펌핑이 가능합니다.
                조합 사용 가능한 장비인 점에서 나름대로의 재미있는 스피드런 빌드가 가능합니다
                꽤 신선하고 재밌는 게임 시스템임.

 2. 장비 - 주로 플레이 편의성 개선에 집중되어 있습니다. 
                체력UP, 초반 특수 아이템 제공(바이크 등),  기본 5원소 쉴드 제공  등등.
                그 외
                캐릭터별 갖는 원소속성으로 도트데미지를 주는 element burst
                방어시, 공격을 돕는 클론을 소환하는 shadow guard

 3. 쉴드 -  의외로 전작에 있었던 무적효과의  레인보우 쉴드가  있습니다.
                 단, 상점에서 레인보우 참을 사서 착용해야  랜덤... 으로 등장합니다.
                 아쉽게도 쉴드 발동할 때 나오는 jingle sound 가 없습니다...

This game far surpasses its predecessor and adds new and surprising things to the table at every turn. With a storied cast of voice actors , amazing pixel art and music , and superb level design this is definitely one of my favorite games on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974417489', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1702706133}
review:
After several hours in I can tell you this is the epitome of what a modern 2d sonic inspired platformer should feel like. It mixes in stage elements from Sonic 3, Sonic & Knuckles, and even some aesthetic from Sonic Adventure 2 even though it's not a 3d game. The combat mechanics also have a modern feel to them where stage bosses feel like stage bosses, and it can take a little bit of effort to get the patterns & mechanics down. It's not as brutal as something like Hollow Knight, but brings that same vibe that has graced a lot of the platformer & metroidvania genres in modern time that makes the battling a part of the game. This makes a lot of sense from a design perspective considering that there is more emphasis on non-Lilac game play.

This game was a solid buy out of the gate, and it remains that way as they have continued to drop patches to fix bugs and tweak based on feedback every day since the release. 

-------------- Original Review -----------------

Freedom Planet returns for a 2nd entry finally after many long years. It still holds the same charm as the first game with a bunch of new features, a new character, and new levels. The game's medium difficulty feels right, and for players who struggle there are assist options available such as auto-guard to not exclude anyone. This makes this both an incredible throwback to the era of 2D Sidescrollers, but also an easy title to jump into, or even have children play if you set up the accessibility options for them. 

I did have a bit of an issue getting used to the default control scheme, since it feels like it's from the Playstation 1/2 era, but the good news is there are options for changing bindings if you're really frustrated as well! Worked out of the box with a PS4 controller directly connected.

Additionally it seems like there may be some bugs that haven't been fully worked out - I killed the boss on the second stage & got the achievement for killing it with dragon boost, however the stage didn't end, and it was then further immune with no health bar. After letting myself die and go back to the checkpoint, killing it the second time worked without issue, and hasn't impact any other level so far.

Overall, this is a solid buy and I'm glad I bought it at release, it was worth the wait!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088425856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1703979908}
review:
Wow. The game was worth the wait, I've never have been that hyped to try a game since this one.

+ The game plays great, solid 60 fps even with browser and discord open (God knows how a pixelart game can lag your laptop but this one isn't)
+ The gameplay is nice, I really like this "combat x beat them up" feeling. The replay value is also a fresh step, since the first game, the battlesphere and challenges are fun, I really apreciate that.
+ The game is controlling great, the guard button is a big improvement.
+ The art. The art is bless to the eyes, the art direction is perfect (East asian culture enjoyers like me will surely enjoy it) The chara design is on point, all the NPCs and characters are charming.
+ Kudos to the music too.
+ The story seems interesting and easy to follow, for now I can't really say much, as I'm still far away in the game.

My only complains for now are:
- I have hard time understanding the voices, espicially Neera's. Her voice seems a bit muted compared to the others.
- You have to complete Adventure mode to unblock Classic mode wich is a downside.

So... Is this game worth? Yes, yes and yes.
If you like 2D beat them up plateformers, give it a try!

Also note: No you don't have to be a fan of Sonic style games to enjoy this gem, it plays QUITE differently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259583490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1710717897}
review:
I've been following the development of this game for years, and as someone who as played the first game in the series, I had developed quite a lot of high expectations ever since I heard a sequel was being made.

And so far, it has far far FAR exceeded my expectations, it's so much more than I had hoped and improves upon the previous game's mechanics and flow so much more!

I absolutely love the new load-out/item system which either lets you makes things easier, harder or just gives you a unique kind of challenge for each level. For my first run through each level, I always go item-less and then when I try to beat it again I try it with the items to make it more interesting. That already adds so much to the replay-ability. 

Love the hidden unlockables and the sweet to talk to NPCs all around. So far it's been great and I hope to keep playing and finish the game with each character!

Keep it up GalaxyTrail!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 5149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1711050777}
review:
[h1]Freedom Planet 2 the most surprising game that I had pleasure to play and listen...[/h1]

Even though I waited for years it still surpassed my expectations. The simple joy of adventure to new lands, meeting new friends and blasting through new enemies. Exoticness freedom and jamming to music there is no better platforming game for that.

And the difficulty scalling map complexity it was all on right places. Plenty of gadgets potions boosts, teleports, waterfalls, gravity, lava, floor rotations, elevations of multiple kinds, canons, everything was here! This journey was fair but it will be difficult, if you want to challenge it for time rankings and all collectables. Bloody tons of them. Badges, Items, Memory capsules, Music boxes and Museum for enemies that you've met. Also true ending for fnishing game with all characters?!

Variety this game took me all around the world of Avalice, all around it's inhabitants. All the charming places villages characters. I loved it and I will play it more with other characters. Never forget this game & this music, for all simple reasons and joys.

review:
The first game was arguably the best Sonic game ever made, and also a really fleshed-out and varied platformer with lots of originality and dedication from the devs. The sequel is even better. It just feels like 100% videogame, every moment.

If you like 2D platformers, adventure platformers, any Sonic game or just like very detailed and high-effort indie games, it's perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015853169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 100, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1711861546}
review:
I've waited for this game since the announcement Trailer, I've waited for this game for 7 years. 
And my god I'm blown away about the amount of details in everything, From the Art, To the Music, to all the little details in animations, Such as Running backwards if you've been pushed back into a skid and then changing your movement to that direction. Going in completely blind, only limiting myself to trailers before release and not watching any gameplay aside from playing the Demo, has been a great decision. I'd recommend the same to anyone even remotely interested.
10/10, Love this shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133571656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1710446855}
review:
Ох, как же долго я ждал эту игру, как и другие фанаты оригинальной Freedom Planet...и наконец-то наше ожидание подошло к концу!
Freedom Planet 2 это пример очень качественного сиквела, который расширяет и углубляет как геймплей оригинала, так и сюжет (лор) в целом. Боевка приобрела несколько новых фишек, добавлены элементы "прокачки" которые помогут в прохождении или наоборот, дадут немного хардкора, давая в награду прибавку кристалов в конце уровня. Сюжет в традициях оригинала, только с большим количеством действующих лиц. Озвучка персонажей стала гораздо качественней по сравнению с первой частью, из-за чего она ещё больше доставляет. Имеются небольшие баги, но они не критичны + немного поломано отображение кнопок геймпада, например - кнопка "вверх" показывается как "влево" и т.д.
Если вы фанат первой части - уже должны иметь у себя в библиотеке.
Если вы не играли в первую часть - советую пройти первую и приступать к этой.
Вообщем, игру советую всем!

Спасибо GalaxyTrail за труд над игрой на протяжении 7 лет разработки! Жду релиз на остальные платформы (для меня PS4) чтобы купить и там игру!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161027032', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1704834588}
review:
It's so good to be home! Freedom Planet 2 is familiar, yet adds so many new things that are expanding on its predecessor's ideas and contribute to cement the series as one of the best Sonic-inspired games out there.

Coming from FP1, the controls are refined, more responsive and as fast paced as ever. The levels are huge, sometimes intricate, and most often than not clever in their designs and gimmicks.  

The true show stealer though is the world of Avalice itself, that can now be visited extensively through a Mario-like overworld map with hubs sprayed up here and there, filled with NPCs commenting on the plot and the state of the world, providing the titular Freedom Planet a depth that the original game could only scratch. 

So far, this is the sequel that all freedom Planet fans were waiting for, full to the brim with swift action, clever level-design, great music and, of course, a very corny yet lovable cast of characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059110622', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1665168874}
review:
It improves everything that made good the forst game
+ Story
+Writting
+Gameplay
+Graphics
Despite all that, the game still has bugs and glithes to fix
-Select your preffered button icons according your controller like PS4/5, Nintendo Switch or Xbox
-The way the camera shakes outside the palace to acomodate the text when talking to people
-The music is not as memorable as the previous game
-Not exclusive stages or branched stories for each character, we basically have the same story four times with very little differences.
I got very tired at the third run and couldn't even care about playing the panda girl's story... 
Is a good sequel but somehow it feels like it lacks what made the first stand out with the way the story was told.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120412543', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1663778442}
review:
I'm not good at writing detailed reviews, so this is all I'm gonna say.
In a world dominated by sprawling open world games with realistic graphics, this humble retro platformer managed to keep my anticipation for it higher than anything else for the 6 years I was waiting for its release. And you know what? It's already worth it. Highly recommend it whether you're already a fan of the first game or if you're new to the series because it delivers the same fast paced, incredibly fun gameplay of the first game with vast graphical improvements, *many* new features, quality of life improvements, and of course, the new story.

Hats off to GalaxyTrail for setting a fine example for the gaming industry. It took a long time, far longer than even they anticipated, but they used that time to make sure they delivered a quality game to the fans.

It's really nice to be back in Avalice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101958904', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1664241288}
review:
[b] Plays great, looks great. Buy it. [/b]
I've just started the game, but already I can see a ton of improvements compared to FP1.

[b] Notes, in case a dev is reading through the reviews: [/b]
- The sprite for the "inactive state" of the spinning enemies in the first proper stage is a bit messed up at 240 FPS. 
- In the [spoiler] Corazon fights [/spoiler] you can stand on the upper edges of the arena and avoid getting hit.
- [spoiler] Cannons [/spoiler] are bugging quite a bit for me. I get stuck in walls often, to the point where I had to abandon a [spoiler] challenge in the Battle Sphere [/spoiler]. Gonna wait til that's fixed to finish it.
- At high refresh rates you often times don't bounce off the wall after dragonboosting against it but slide up the wall vertically (I tested it. It happens at 240 FPS but not at 60)

[b] Some things I'd wish for: [/b]
- I play on a 240hz monitor with Vsync on, cuz it feels much much smoother and better than the 60 FPS u get when Vsync is turned off. Would love to see some option to manually lock the FPS to certain values without having to enable Vsync at the same time (maybe at least 60, 120, 144, 240). [b] [EDIT: has been added! Thank you devs <3] [/b]
- A minimap would be a nice quality of life addition, since the levels can be a bit disorienting if you're not familiar with them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996574815', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1665280082}
review:
FINALLY, ITS OUT!!!

I've played a good hour of it, and its pretty dope, I like the art style, and humour, however, I've got a few minor issues

1st: I'm still getting small screen stutters (just how I was getting them on the demo), its not a major problem, they are noticeable but does not spoil the game play

2nd: Game needs controller prompts and control schemes, I had to manually keybind accordingly to my Xbox one controller, doing so however, give me a lot of control as needed, so its diffidently worth keybinding when needed.

Overall, the Sequel is pretty damn good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199064196089', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1705722677}
review:
CONGRATS, SABRINA!!! It's out!!! And it's AWESOME!!!

This game is soooo much fun!!! Imagine Classic Sonic, Megaman X, and Gunstar Heroes fused together, and you get this!!! I tried the first game a few months back ago and I was glad I did because I really liked it, and I'm happy to say this game blows it out of the water in so many ways! 

The gameplay was so much more faster and energetic this time, at least that's the case with Lilac because I mainly played as her so far. Got a lot of Sonic Rush vibes which is a massive plus because I LOVE those games! The story was actually really entertaining and dramatic, which is great because admittedly the plot in the first game was one of it's weaker elements. The music and sound-design ARE SO GOOD, I plan to buy the OST in the future if it wasn't released already, because I often found myself turning down the sfx and voices to listen to it. Really reminds me of Jet Set Radio (and a lot of Hideki Naganuma's work in general). 

but ummm YEAH!!! This game is really cool! Congrats to Sabrina and everyone else at GalaxyTrail, because the wait was totally worth it! Haven't been this excited for a game since Sonic Mania!
:D

author: {'steamid': '76561198084014911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1669492414}
review:
[h1]Awesome game - awesome sequel[/h1]

Freedom Planet at one time divided Sonic fans into two camps. The first saw a solid game with their own style, the others turned on the morons and started yelling about plagiarism and parasitism on Sonic ... which, in fact, has long gone to shit. However, Freedom Planet has received the recognition and love it deserves, building up a fan base that is finally looking forward to the sequel.

[b]Plot[/b]

The story starts three years after the first game. The grown up and prettier heroines are attacked by unknown robots that destroy their house. Forced to cooperate with the royal nobility, they investigate a series of incidents involving the same robots, which slowly but surely leads to key events.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Compared to the first game, the combat system has been noticeably upgraded here, adding a defensive move, as well as lowering the limitation for old abilities, allowing the use of much more advanced attack combinations.
The levels here are divided into two types:

1) Combat - where we have to run through vast locations, making our way through their unique opponents in order to defeat the big bosses at the end.

2) Urban - the most beautiful residential settlements with many characters who are ready not only to talk, but also to trade.

In addition to the standard levels, there are also secondary activities, such as an arena with various modes, among which I especially liked a kind of PvP analogue that allows me to push the protagonists head-on.

[b]Graphic arts[/b]

Stunning sixteen-bit visuals have been pumped to perfection here, giving out not only magnificent detailed cities with civilians, but also combat levels, each of which lives according to its own laws, always remaining in motion.

[b]Soundtrack[/b]

The musical accompaniment of Freedom Planet immediately wanted to add its own playlist and the sequel took its well-deserved place in it. The soundtrack not only harmoniously combines with peaceful towns and dynamic levels, but also literally caresses the ear from the first seconds, and the sound effects are my respect.

[b]Results[/b]

Freedom Planet 2 perfectly demonstrates to us those rare cases when the sequel not only does not lose the dignity of the original, but also multiplies them many times over, making literally everything better. This is a true creation of people who love their work and their project, and this same love does not let go even after a complete passage, as it was with the first Freedom Planet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108039684', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1697319092}
review:
absolutely worth the wait!! at its core, FP2 is a fun, satisfying, and challenging speedy platformer with unique and memorable characters, GREAT music, beautiful stages, and intense bosses. i suggest making yourself familiar with how FP1’s levels are laid out because FP2 greatly expands upon the scale of each stage, and it can get easy to become lost while you’re trying to make progress.

expect a few bugs occasionally, like losing speed on a weird slope or getting soft locked in some rare cases on some stages, but nothing that could ruin your experience as a whole. i’ve enjoyed all my time spent playing this game, even while playing through the story as each character just for 100%ing (i wouldn’t mind some extra achievements though, perhaps for some lesser known challenges like [spoiler]rainbow S ranks[/spoiler]). 

tldr get the game it’s really good

author: {'steamid': '76561198124184352', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 3641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1681298626}
review:
Alright, this time I won’t write the review as a joke.

This game not only means a lot to me and some of my friends, but I would be certain enough to say it is even a contestant to my favourite game of all time. So of course, to express al the love I feel for this game, I shall prioritize my negative criticism first!
Wait-

- Some sounds are, like, LOUD, REALLY FREAKING LOUD, LIKE HOLY F**K, more specifically some bosses’ screams but also with stuff like several bombs exploding together, I could lower the volume, sure, but then the game would be too quiet for most of the time.
- Music does not loop in some areas. This is a more major gripe, it can kill the mood in some areas, I feel. Sometimes it is not too bad, but there are many areas (usually Lobbies) were music just stopped for no reason and it made me have a poker face for a couple of seconds.
- The items. Oh, dear… The items. Like, I find cool that you can “choose your own difficulty”, but why does hard mode have to be linked to two items? It kinda ruined experimentation for my first play-through because I wanted to play it in hard mode right off the bat. I honestly wouldn’t be complaining about this if the taking double damage and no revives mechanics were separated from the item system, or if we had 2 negative item slots separate from positive item slots.
- The potions. Great addition to the game, except I didn’t get to use them until late game because I seriously thought that those were 1-use only. I am unsure if there’s some kind of explanation somewhere in the game about how potions work, but I would have appreciated if I got told from the start about this system.
- Vsync is on by default. According to my Bible this is a sin.

Okay so now for the praises.
*Holy Cungadero is this game good*. This is a huge glow up from the first Freedom Planet: the playable characters have a much more unique and diverse moveset than before, there’s a lot of lore and story  to enjoy that explains a lot about this game world’s culture and past, music is fantastic (just like the first game), and even the main antagonist has a much deeper personality. And oh boy, don’t get me freaking started about the artstyle and pixel art… First of all, the entire game’s sprites has “Tyson Tan” written all over them (not literally), and when I got told that this guy was helping in the art department of this FP2, I knew it was gonna look good, but even then, it surpassed my expectations, making my jaw drop a couple of times. What the art and graphics department of Galaxy Trail has achieved is pure freaking magic, I tell you, hahahaha.

I could keep praising each individual part of this game, and every single thing I loved about this journey, but I think I already wrote a long enough review. Thanks, Galaxy Trail team, for making not only what should be considered as a perfect sequel, but also the continuation of the game that made me meet what I can consider today as my best friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041568550', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1689856260}
review:
Je suis un gros fan de Sonic, et j'avais adoré le 1er Freedom Planet car il en était clairement inspiré et était très bon.
Pour Freedom Planet ce serait une insulte de le réduire en tant que bon Sonic like, dés le début on sent qu'on est pas sur le même niveau que le 1, je n'ai joué que Lilac pour l'instant mais je suis déjà convaincu dés le début, le fun est bien présent, c'est beau, c'est drôle et la bande son est géniale comme pour le 1er.
Le jeu à 4 persos jouable avec un mode histoire pour chacun d'entre eux,
Un mode gallery sous forme de Hub en 2D qu'on peut explorer,
Une world map interactive ou on peut explorer certains lieu et parler avec PNJ,
C'est bien plus qu'un simple Sonic like.
Foncez c'est juste un excellent jeu.

Si vous êtes toujours pas convaincu regardez cet extrait d'un niveau avec Lilac, si vous aimez Sonic, vous ne pourrez pas résister.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Ul06HTFJbs
